[Her]108-birdalone voice seemed so cheery and friendly to [the priest]1677-the priest , that [he]1677-the priest shook off somewhat the moodiness of [his]1677-the priest desire , and looked up and said : [I]0-i shall tell [thee]108-birdalone , [lady]493-lady , that [I]0-i suppose [thou]1677-the priest hast more errand with [[my]0-i lords]1728-my lords than to crave lodging of [them]1728-my lords despite the custom of [the castle]1534-the castle . Nay , [I]0-i have an inkling of what thine errand may be , whereof more anon ; but now shall [I]0-i tell [thee]108-birdalone what is best for [thee]108-birdalone to do so as to have speech of [them]1728-my lords the soonest . [They]1728-my lords have gone forth with [some of [[our]1731-our lads]1732-our lads]1730-some of our lads to gather venison , or it may be beeves and muttons for [our]1731-our victualling , and somewhat of battle may [they]1728-my lords have had on the way , for [ill neighbours]1733-ill neighbours have [we]1731-our . But if [they]1728-my lords come back unfoughten [they]1728-my lords will be wending [this road]1734-this road , and must needs pass by [thy]108-birdalone copse - side ; and if [thou]108-birdalone be sleeping the noise of [them]1728-my lords will full surely awaken [thee]108-birdalone . Then all [thou]108-birdalone hast to do is to come forth and stand in the way before [them]1728-my lords , that [they]1728-my lords may see [thee]108-birdalone ; and when once [they]1728-my lords have seen [thee]108-birdalone , how may [they]1728-my lords pass [thee]108-birdalone by unspoken with ? [I]0-i thank [thee]108-birdalone heartily for [thy]108-birdalone rede , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; but [I]0-i would ask [thee]108-birdalone two things : first , what is the name of [the castle behind [us]1736-us]1735-the castle behind us ? and second , why have [ye]108-birdalone the custom of shutting the door upon [women]420-women ? Said [the priest]1677-the priest : [The castle]1534-the castle is called in [this country - side]1740-this country - side , [the White Ward]24-the white ward by [the Water]5-the water ; but within [there]215-there [we]1736-us call [it]1534-the castle [the Castle of the Quest]25-the castle of the quest ; and thus is it called because [[my]0-i lords]1728-my lords are seeking [their]1728-my lords loves whom [they]1728-my lords have lost ; and [they]1728-my lords have sworn an oath that [no woman]746-no woman shall enter therein till [their]1728-my lords own loves have trodden [its]1534-the castle floors . Rose the heart of [Birdalone]108-birdalone at that word , and [she]108-birdalone deemed indeed that [she]108-birdalone was come thither whereas [[her]108-birdalone she - friends]1744-her she - friends would have had [her]108-birdalone . [The priest]1677-the priest beheld [her]108-birdalone and saw how [her]108-birdalone beauty was eked by that gladness , and [he]1677-the priest scarce knew how to contain [himself]1677-the priest ; and might speak no word awhile ; then [he]1677-the priest said : Hearken further concerning [thy]108-birdalone matter ; if [[my]0-i lords]1728-my lords be tarried , and come not by matin - song , then [I]0-i doubt not but [the castellan]1691-the castellan will send [folk]4521-folk to see to [thee]108-birdalone . [He]1677-the priest looked down therewith and said : [I]0-i will come to [thee]108-birdalone [myself]0-i ; and will bring [thee]108-birdalone [men - at - arms]1749-men - at - arms , if need be . But sometime tomorrow morning [[my]0-i lords]1728-my lords will come , save mischief hath betid , which God forbid . And [he]1677-the priest crossed [himself]1677-the priest ; then [he]1677-the priest looked up and full in [her]108-birdalone face , and said : But keep [thine]108-birdalone heart up ; for whatsoever may betide , [thou]108-birdalone shalt not be left uncared for . Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : [I]0-i see of [thee]108-birdalone that [thou]108-birdalone art become [[my]0-i good friend]1751-my good friend , and it rejoiceth [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i shall be well at ease to - night in [thy]108-birdalone cot , and tomorrow morn [I]0-i shall be valiant to do [thy]108-birdalone bidding . The sweetness of [her]108-birdalone speech so overcame [him]1677-the priest , that [he]1677-the priest but looked confusedly on [her]108-birdalone , as if [he]1677-the priest scarce heard [her]108-birdalone ; and [they]1752-they went on together without more words , till [he]1677-the priest said : Here are [we]1752-they at the cot , and [I]0-i will show [thee]108-birdalone [[thy]108-birdalone chamber]298-thy chamber . So [he]1677-the priest led [her]108-birdalone to [a little thatched bower]1754-a little thatched bower , built with walls of wattle - work daubed with clay , which stood without the remnant of the cot : [it]1754-a little thatched bower was clean and dry , for the roof was weather - tight ; but there was nought in [it]1754-a little thatched bower at all save a heap of bracken in a corner . There stood [the priest]1677-the priest , still holding [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s hand , and spake not , but looked about , yet always covertly on [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; but in a while [he]1677-the priest let go [her]108-birdalone hand , and seemed to wake up , and said : This it is ; a sorry place enough , were it even for [a gangrel body]1756-a gangrel body . Even so am [I]0-i , quoth [she]108-birdalone laughing ; and [thou]1757-thou mayest look to it , that herein [I]0-i shall rest full happily . Then [he]1677-the priest gave [her]108-birdalone a horn , drawing it from out of the basket of victual , which [he]1677-the priest now set down on the ground ; and [he]1677-the priest said : If [thou]1757-thou shouldst deem [thee]108-birdalone hard bestead , then wind this horn , and [we]1758-we shall know its voice up there and come to help [thee]108-birdalone . Now [I]0-i give [thee]108-birdalone good - night . [She]108-birdalone thanked [him]1677-the priest sweetly , and [he]1677-the priest went slowly out of the bower , but was scarce gone ere [he]1677-the priest came back again , and said : One thing [I]0-i may perchance tell [thee]108-birdalone without drawing thine anger on [my]0-i head ; to wit , that [I]0-i it was who said to [the castellan]1691-the castellan that [he]1691-the castellan should take [thee]108-birdalone in . Wilt [thou]1757-thou say aught to this ? [She]108-birdalone said : [I]0-i will thank [thee]1677-the priest again and again ; for it was the saving of [my]0-i life and [mine]0-i errand . And clearer is it now than ever that [thou]1757-thou art [a good friend unto [me]0-i]1760-a good friend unto me . As [she]108-birdalone looked on [him]1677-the priest and caressed [him]1677-the priest with kind eyes , [she]108-birdalone saw that [his]1677-the priest brow was knit , and [his]1677-the priest face troubled , and [she]108-birdalone said to [him]1677-the priest : What ails [thee]1677-the priest ? art [thou]1757-thou wroth with [me]0-i in any wise ? O no , said [he]1677-the priest ; how should [I]0-i be wroth with [thee]108-birdalone ! But there is a thing [I]0-i would ask of [thee]108-birdalone . Yea , and what ? said [she]108-birdalone . [He]1677-the priest said : Nay , [I]0-i may not , [I]0-i may not . It shall be for tomorrow , or another day . [He]1677-the priest spake it looking down , and in a broken voice ; and [she]108-birdalone wondered somewhat at [him]1677-the priest , but not much , deeming that [he]1677-the priest was troubled by something which had nought to do with [her]108-birdalone , and which [he]1677-the priest might refrain from thinking of , even before [a stranger]1235-a stranger . But presently [he]1677-the priest caught [her]108-birdalone hand and kissed it , and bade [her]108-birdalone good - night again , and then went hastily out of the bower ; and when [he]1677-the priest was well without , [he]1677-the priest muttered , but not so as [she]108-birdalone might hear [him]1677-the priest : Durst [I]0-i have asked [her]108-birdalone , [she]108-birdalone would have suffered [me]0-i to kiss [her]108-birdalone cheek . Alas ! fool that [I]0-i was ! [Birdalone]108-birdalone turned then to [her]108-birdalone bracken bed , and found [it]1762-it sweet and clean ; and [she]108-birdalone was at rest and peace in [her]108-birdalone mind , albeit [her]108-birdalone body was exceeding weary . [She]108-birdalone felt happy in [the little lonely cot]1763-the little lonely cot , and [her]108-birdalone heart had gone out to [the sweet meadow - land]1764-the sweet meadow - land , and [she]108-birdalone loved it after all the trouble of [the water]347-the water ; and herseemed that even now , in the dusk a - growing into dark , it loved and caressed [her]108-birdalone . So [she]108-birdalone laid [her]108-birdalone down , nor unclad [herself]108-birdalone at all , lest [she]108-birdalone should have to arise on a sudden , and show those tokens of the three damsels on [her]108-birdalone body . A little while [she]108-birdalone lay there happily , hearkening the voices of the nightingales in the brake , and then [she]108-birdalone fell into a dreamless sleep , unbroken till the short night passed into day . Chapter III ~ How [Birdalone]108-birdalone Dight [Her]108-birdalone for Meeting [the Champions of the Quest]1766-the champions of the quest It was the birds beginning [their]1767-their first song once more that awakened [Birdalone]108-birdalone before the sun was up ; but [she]108-birdalone had no will to stir a while , whereas [she]108-birdalone felt so happy and restful ; and that all the more when [she]108-birdalone remembered where [she]108-birdalone was , and told [herself]108-birdalone that [her]108-birdalone errand was now like to be accomplished ; and [she]108-birdalone thought of [[her]108-birdalone friends whom [she]108-birdalone had left on [the Isle of Increase Unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought]1768-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought , and blessed [them]1768-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought for [their]1768-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought kindness , and the love of [them]1768-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought was sweet to [her]108-birdalone heart , and amidst such thoughts [she]108-birdalone fell asleep again . When [she]108-birdalone awoke thereafter there was a flood of sunshine lying on [the meadows]1769-the meadows , and [she]108-birdalone sprang up in haste lest [she]108-birdalone had overslept [herself]108-birdalone , but when [she]108-birdalone was come out of the bower , [she]108-birdalone soon saw that the sunbeams lay low on [the land]198-the land , and that it was yet the first hour of the sun ; so [she]108-birdalone turned about , and went through [the copse]1771-the copse to [the other side]1772-the other side , and lo ! [a little clear stream running before [her]108-birdalone]1773-a little clear stream running before her . So [she]108-birdalone spake to [herself]108-birdalone softly and said : Fie on it ! [I]0-i was weary with [the boat]850-the boat and [my]0-i hunger last night , and [I]0-i went to bed unwashen ; and this morn [I]0-i am weary for the foulness of [my]0-i unwashen body . Unseemly it were to [me]0-i to show [myself]0-i sluttish before [these lords]1775-these lords ; let [me]0-i find time for a bath at least . Therewith [she]108-birdalone went swiftly down to [the water]347-the water , undoing [her]108-birdalone girdle and laces by the way . [She]108-birdalone came to [the stream]1777-the stream and found [it]1777-the stream running between blue - flowering mouse - ear and rushes , into a pool which deepened from [a sandy shallow]1778-a sandy shallow : so anon [her]108-birdalone borrowed raiment was lying on [the grassy lip of the water]1779-the grassy lip of the water , and [she]108-birdalone was swimming and disporting [her]108-birdalone in [the pool]1780-the pool , with [her]108-birdalone hair loose and wavering over [her]108-birdalone white back like some tress of the water - weed . Therein [she]108-birdalone durst not tarry long , but came hurrying out on to the grass , and clad [herself]108-birdalone in haste . But [she]108-birdalone covered not [her]108-birdalone shoulders with the golden gown , nor laced it over [her]108-birdalone bosom , so that [Viridis]108-birdalone â€™ smock might be the plainer to see : which smock was noteworthy , for the breast thereof was broidered with green boughs , whence brake forth little flames of fire , and all so dainty - wrought as if [the faery]4682-the faery had done it . Withal [she]108-birdalone gathered up the gown into [her]108-birdalone girdle , and let the skirt - hem clear [her]108-birdalone ankles , so that [Atra]109-atra â€™s shoon might be seen at once ; and they were daintily dight with window - work and broidery of gold and green stones , and blue . And forsooth it was little likely that [any man]4683-any man should stand before [her]108-birdalone a minute ere [his]4683-any man eyes would seek to [her]108-birdalone feet and ankles , so clean and kindly as they were fashioned . Therewith [she]108-birdalone set [her]108-birdalone hands to [her]108-birdalone head , and trussed up [her]108-birdalone hair , and bound it closely to [her]108-birdalone head , so that it might hide no whit of [her]108-birdalone borrowed attire . There [she]108-birdalone stood , with [Aurea]107-aurea â€™s collar lying on [her]108-birdalone dear neck , and [Viridis]108-birdalone â€™[108-birdalone] girdle about [her]108-birdalone shapen loins , and [Atra]109-atra â€™s ring on [her]108-birdalone lovesome finger . And [she]108-birdalone hearkened a while and heard no sound of coming [men]204-men ; and there came into [her]108-birdalone heart a gentle fear , which grieved [her]108-birdalone not . Over the water before [her]108-birdalone hung an eglantine bush , with its many roses either budding or but just out . [Birdalone]108-birdalone stole thither softly , and said , smiling : Nay , if [I]0-i have nothing that is mine on [my]0-i body , [I]0-i will take this of [the maiden]393-the maiden â€™s bath and make it [mine]0-i . And therewith [she]108-birdalone plucked a spray of the bush and turned it into a garland for [her]108-birdalone head ; and then when [she]108-birdalone had stood shyly a while in [that same place]1783-that same place , [she]108-birdalone turned and went swiftly to [her]108-birdalone place beside [her]108-birdalone night - harbour , and stood there hearkening with that sweet fear growing upon [her]108-birdalone , [her]108-birdalone colour coming and going , and [her]108-birdalone heart beating fast . Now the thought of [that kind priest who had led [her]108-birdalone to the bower last night]1784-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night came into [her]108-birdalone mind , and [she]108-birdalone wondered why [he]1784-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night had been so troubled . And [she]108-birdalone thought , would [those others]1785-those others be so kind to [her]108-birdalone , or would [they]1785-those others deem [her]108-birdalone [an impudent wench]1786-an impudent wench or [a foolish]1787-a foolish , or pass [her]108-birdalone by ? [Forsooth]108-birdalone if any had passed [her]108-birdalone by it had been not that [he]1784-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night should miss seeing [her]108-birdalone beauty , but that [he]1784-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night should fear it , and deem [her]108-birdalone [some goddess of [the Gentiles of old time]1789-the gentiles of old time]1788-some goddess of the gentiles of old time come before [him]1784-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night for [his]1784-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night ensnaring . Chapter IV ~ And Now [She]108-birdalone Meets [the Champions Now]1790-the champions now , as [she]108-birdalone stood hearkening , [she]108-birdalone deemed [she]108-birdalone heard something that was not so loud as the song of the blackbird in the brake , but further off and longer voiced : and again [she]108-birdalone hearkened heedfully , and the sound came again , and [she]108-birdalone deemed now that it was the voice of an horn . But the third time of [her]108-birdalone hearing it [she]108-birdalone knew that it was nought less ; and at last it grew nigher , and there was mingled with it the sound of [men]204-men shouting and the lowing of neat . Then [she]108-birdalone stepped down to the very edge of the way , and now [she]108-birdalone saw [the riding - reek]1792-the riding - reek go up into the clear air , and [she]108-birdalone said : Now are [they]1793-them coming without fail , and [I]0-i must pluck up a heart ; for surely [these dear friends of [[my]0-i friends]1795-my friends]1794-these dear friends of my friends shall neither harm [a poor maiden]1796-a poor maiden nor scorn [her]1796-a poor maiden . Soon came the leading beasts from out of the dust - cloud , and behind [them]1793-them was the glitter of spear - heads ; and then presently was a herd of neat shambling and jostling along [the road]1797-the road , and after [them]1793-them a score or so of spearmen in jack and sallet , who , forsooth , turned to look on [Birdalone]108-birdalone as [they]1793-them passed by , and spake here and there a word or two , laughing and pointing to [her]108-birdalone , but stayed not ; and all went on straight to [the castle]1534-the castle . Thereafter was a void , and then came riding leisurely another score of [weaponed men]1799-weaponed men , whereof [some in white armour]1800-some in white armour ; and amongst [them]1793-them were five sumpter horses laden with carcasses of venison . And all these also went by and stayed not , though the most of [them]1793-them gazed on [Birdalone]108-birdalone hard enough . Last of all came [three knights]1801-three knights riding , [one with a gold surcoat]1802-one with a gold surcoat over [his]1802-one with a gold surcoat armour , and thereon a cleft heart of red ; [the second with a green surcoat]1803-the second with a green surcoat , and on the same [a chief of silver with green boughs thereon]1804-a chief of silver with green boughs thereon , [their]1801-three knights ends a - flaming ; but [the third]1805-the third bore a black surcoat besprinkled with silver tears . And [all these three]1806-all these three rode bare - headed , save that [the Black Knight]128-the black knight bore an oak - wreath on the head . Now did [Birdalone]108-birdalone take to [her]108-birdalone valiancy , and [she]108-birdalone stepped out into [the road]1797-the road till [she]108-birdalone was but a ten paces from [those men]1808-those men , who reined up when [they]1808-those men beheld [her]108-birdalone ; and [she]108-birdalone said in a clear voice : Abide , [warriors]1809-warriors ! for if [ye]1809-warriors be what [I]0-i deem [you]1809-warriors , [I]0-i have an errand unto [you]1809-warriors . Scarce were the words out of [her]108-birdalone mouth , ere [all three]1397-all three had leapt off [their]1397-all three horses , and [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight came up to [her]108-birdalone , and laid [his]1811-the golden knight hand upon [her]108-birdalone side , and spake eagerly and said : Where is [she]108-birdalone , whence [thou]1812-thou gattest this gown of good web ? And [thou]1812-thou , said [she]108-birdalone , art [thou]1812-thou [Baudoin the Golden Knight]115-baudoin ? But [he]1811-the golden knight set [his]1811-the golden knight hand to the collar on [her]108-birdalone neck , and touched [her]108-birdalone skin withal , and said : This , was [she]108-birdalone alive when [thou]1812-thou camest by it ? [She]108-birdalone said : If [thou]1812-thou be [Baudoin the Golden Knight]115-baudoin , [I]0-i have an errand to [thee]1812-thou . [I]0-i am [he]1811-the golden knight , said [the knight]1813-the knight ; O tell [me]0-i , tell [me]0-i , is [she]108-birdalone dead ? Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : [Aurea]107-aurea was alive when last [I]0-i saw [her]108-birdalone , and [mine]0-i errand is from [her]108-birdalone to [thee]1812-thou , if [thou]1812-thou be verily [[her]108-birdalone lover]1814-her lover . Now with this word [I]0-i pray [thee]1812-thou to be content a while , said [she]0-i , smiling kindly upon [him]1812-thou , for needs must [I]0-i do [mine]0-i errand in such wise as [I]0-i was bidden . And [thou]1812-thou seest also that [[thy]1812-thou friends]1815-thy friends would have a word of [me]0-i . Meanwhile [I]1341-the green knight pray [thee]1812-thou forbear a little ; for , as [I]1341-the green knight trow , all is well , and [thou]1812-thou shalt see [[my]1341-the green knight dear friend]4685-my dear friend [Viridis]108-birdalone again . [He]4684-sir withdrew [him]4685-my dear friend a little , flushed and shamefaced . [He]1341-the green knight was [a young man exceeding beauteous , clear - skinned and grey - eyed , with curly golden hair]4686-a young man exceeding beauteous , clear - skinned and grey - eyed , with curly golden hair , and [he]1341-the green knight bore [his]1341-the green knight armour as though it were silken cloth . [Birdalone]108-birdalone looked upon [him]1341-the green knight kindly though shyly , and was glad to the heart â€™s root that [Viridis]108-birdalone had so lovely [a man to [her]108-birdalone darling]4687-a man to her darling . As for [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight , as [Birdalone]108-birdalone might see now , [he]1341-the green knight stood a little aloof ; [he]1341-the green knight was [a very goodly man of some five and thirty winters]4689-a very goodly man of some five and thirty winters ; tall [he]1341-the green knight was , broad - shouldered and thin - flanked , black - haired , with somewhat heavy eyebrows , and fierce hawk - eyes ; [a man terrible of aspect , when one first beheld [him]1341-the green knight]4690-a man terrible of aspect , when one first beheld him . Now when [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire had hearkened [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s word concerning [Viridis]108-birdalone , [he]1341-the green knight threw [himself]1341-the green knight down on the ground before [her]108-birdalone , and fell to kissing [her]108-birdalone feet ; or , if [you]4692-you will , Atra â€™s shoon which covered them . [He]1341-the green knight spake not , but still gazed on [her]108-birdalone till [she]108-birdalone reddened . [She]108-birdalone knew not whether to deem [him]1341-the green knight less goodly than [the other twain]4523-the other twain . [He]1341-the green knight also was [a young man of not over five and twenty years]4696-a young man of not over five and twenty years , slim and lithe , with much brown hair ; [his]1341-the green knight face tanned so dark that [his]1341-the green knight eyes gleamed light from amidst it ; [his]1341-the green knight chin was round and cloven , [his]1341-the green knight mouth and nose excellently fashioned ; little hair [he]1341-the green knight had upon [his]1341-the green knight face , [his]1341-the green knight cheeks were somewhat more hollow than round . [Birdalone]108-birdalone noted of [his]1341-the green knight bare hands , which were as brown as [his]1341-the green knight face , that they were very trim and shapely . Now [he]1341-the green knight rose to [his]1341-the green knight feet , and [the three]288-the three stood together and gazed on [her]108-birdalone ; as how might [they]288-the three do otherwise ? [Birdalone]108-birdalone hung [her]108-birdalone head , and knew not what next to do or say . But [she]108-birdalone thought within [herself]108-birdalone , would [these three men]4698-these three men have been as kind to [her]108-birdalone as [[her]108-birdalone three friends of [the Isle]32-the isle of nothing]4699-her three friends of the isle , had [she]108-birdalone happened on [them]4698-these three men in like case as [she]108-birdalone was that time ? And [she]108-birdalone settled with [herself]108-birdalone that [they]4698-these three men would have been no less kind . Now spake [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight , and said : Will [the kind maiden]4701-the kind maiden do [her]4701-the kind maiden errand to [us]4698-these three men here and now ? for [we]4698-these three men be eager and worn with trouble . [Birdalone]108-birdalone looked adown and was somewhat confused . [Fair sirs]4702-fair sirs , said [she]108-birdalone , [I]1341-the green knight will do [your]4702-fair sirs will herein . But [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire looked on [her]108-birdalone and saw that [she]108-birdalone was troubled , and [he]1325-the black squire said : [Your]108-birdalone pardon , [fair fellows]4704-fair fellows , but is it not so that [we]4698-these three men have [an house somewhat anigh]4705-an house somewhat anigh , not ill purveyed of many things ? By [your]108-birdalone leave [I]1341-the green knight would entreat [this kind and dear lady]4706-this kind and dear lady to honour [us]4698-these three men so much as to enter [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest with [us]4698-these three men , and abide there so long as [she]4706-this kind and dear lady will ; and therein may [she]4706-this kind and dear lady tell [us]4698-these three men all [her]4706-this kind and dear lady errand at [her]4706-this kind and dear lady leisure ; and already [we]4698-these three men may see and know , that it may not be aught save a joyous one . Then spake [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight , and said : [I]1341-the green knight will ask [the lady]1145-the lady to pardon [me]1341-the green knight , and will now join [my]1341-the green knight prayer to thine , [brother]4710-brother , that [she]4706-this kind and dear lady come [home]373-home with [us]4698-these three men . [Lady]493-lady , [he]1341-the green knight said , wilt [thou]4713-thou not pardon [me]1341-the green knight , that in the eager desire to hear tidings of [my]1341-the green knight speech - friend [I]1341-the green knight forgat all else . And therewithal [he]1341-the green knight knelt before [her]493-lady , and took [her]493-lady hand and kissed it ; and for all [his]1341-the green knight fierce eyes and [[his]1341-the green knight warrior]4714-his warrior â€™s mien , [she]493-lady deemed [him]1341-the green knight kind and friendly . Then needs must [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight kneel and kiss also , though [he]1341-the green knight had no pardon to crave ; but [a fair sweet lad]4716-a fair sweet lad [she]493-lady thought [him]1341-the green knight , and again [her]493-lady heart swelled with joy to think that [[her]493-lady friend]433-her friend [Viridis]108-birdalone had [so dear a speech - friend]4718-so dear a speech - friend to long for [her]493-lady . Then came the turn of [the Black Squire]119-arthur , and by then were [the two others]4719-the two others turned away a little toward [their]4719-the two others horses ; and [he]1341-the green knight knelt down on both knees before [Birdalone]108-birdalone and took [her]108-birdalone right arm above the wrist , and looked at the hand and kissed it as if it were a relic , but stood not up ; and [she]108-birdalone stood bending over [him]1341-the green knight , and a new sweetness entered into [her]108-birdalone , the like of which [she]108-birdalone had never felt . But as for [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , it seemed that one hand would not suffice [him]1341-the green knight , and [he]1341-the green knight took [her]108-birdalone left hand and fell to kissing it , and then both the hands together all over the backs of them , and then the palms thereof , and [he]1341-the green knight buried [his]1341-the green knight face in the two palms , and held them to [his]1341-the green knight cheeks ; and the dear hands suffered it all , and consented to the embracing of [his]1341-the green knight cheeks . But [Birdalone]108-birdalone deemed that this was the kindest and sweetest of [the three kind warriors]4721-the three kind warriors , and sorry [she]108-birdalone was when [he]1341-the green knight let go [her]108-birdalone hands and stood up . [His]1341-the green knight face was flushed , but [his]1341-the green knight speech calm , as [he]1341-the green knight spake so that [the other knights]4722-the other knights might hear [him]1341-the green knight : Now will [we]4723-we straight to [the castle]1534-the castle , [lady]493-lady , and [we]4723-we will ask [thee]493-lady which of [us]4723-we three [thou]493-lady wilt honour by riding [his]1341-the green knight horse there ; shall it be [[Baudoin]115-baudoin â€™s bright bay]4726-baudoin â€™s bright bay , or [Hugh]118-hugh â€™s dapple - grey , or [my]1341-the green knight red roan ? And therewith [he]1341-the green knight took [her]108-birdalone by the hand and led [her]108-birdalone toward the horses . But [she]108-birdalone laughed , and turning a little , pointed to [the castle]1534-the castle , and said : Nay , [sweet lords]4728-sweet lords , but [I]1341-the green knight will fare afoot , such a little way as it is , and [I]1341-the green knight all unwont to the saddle . [Spake]109-atra [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight : If that be so , [lady]493-lady , then shall [we]4723-we three walk afoot with [thee]493-lady . Nay , nay , [she]108-birdalone said ; [I]1341-the green knight have nought to carry but [myself]1341-the green knight ; but [ye]493-lady have [your]493-lady byrnies and [your]493-lady other armour , which were heavy for [you]493-lady to drag on afoot , even a little way . Moreover , [I]1341-the green knight were fain to see [you]493-lady mount [your]493-lady horses , and ride and run about [the meadow]499-the meadow with tossing manes and flashing swords , while [I]1341-the green knight trudge quietly toward the gate ; for such things , and so beauteous , are all new unto [me]1341-the green knight , as [ye]493-lady shall learn presently when [I]1341-the green knight tell [you]493-lady [my]1341-the green knight story . Do so much to pleasure [me]1341-the green knight , [kind knights]4732-kind knights . [The tall Baudoin]115-baudoin nodded to [her]108-birdalone , smiling kindly , as much as to say that [he]115-baudoin thought well of [her]108-birdalone desire . But [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight ran to [his]1341-the green knight horse with a glad shout , and [anon]4734-anon was in the saddle with [his]4734-anon bright sword in [his]4734-anon fist ; then [he]4734-anon spurred , and went a - gallop hither and thither over the mead , making [his]4734-anon horse turn short and bound , and playing many tricks of the tilt - yard , and crying , [A Hugh]4735-a hugh , [A Hugh]4735-a hugh , for [the Green Gown]129-the green gown ! [The Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight was slower and more staid , but in manywise [he]1811-the golden knight showed [his]1811-the golden knight war - deftness , riding after [Hugh]118-hugh as if [he]118-hugh would fall on [him]118-hugh , and staying [his]1811-the golden knight way just as it became perilous ; and [he]1811-the golden knight cried , [Baudoin]115-baudoin , [Baudoin]115-baudoin , for Gold - sleeves ! And all this seemed to [Birdalone]108-birdalone both terrible and lovely . But for [the Black Squire]119-arthur , [he]119-arthur was slow to let loose [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s hand ; but thereafter [he]119-arthur was speedy to vault into [his]119-arthur saddle , and [he]119-arthur made courses over [the meadow]499-the meadow , but ever came back to [Birdalone]108-birdalone as [she]108-birdalone went [her]108-birdalone ways , riding round and round [her]108-birdalone , and tossing [his]119-arthur sword into the air the while and catching it as it fell . And no less lovely did this seem to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone smiled on [him]119-arthur and waved [her]108-birdalone hand to [him]119-arthur . Going slowly in this wise , [she]108-birdalone came at last to the castle gate ; and now had all those three out - gone [her]108-birdalone and stood afoot in the wicket to welcome [her]108-birdalone , and [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight , who was [the oldest of [the three]288-the three]4740-the oldest of the three , was [the speaker of the welcome]4742-the speaker of the welcome . Chapter V ~ [Birdalone]108-birdalone Has True Tokens from [the Champions of the Quest]1766-the champions of the quest Now [they]1766-the champions of the quest brought [Birdalone]108-birdalone into [a very fair chamber]4745-a very fair chamber , where was presently everything [she]108-birdalone might need , save [a tiring woman]4746-a tiring woman , which , forsooth , was no lack unto [her]108-birdalone , since never had [she]108-birdalone had any to help [her]108-birdalone array [her]108-birdalone body . [Lady]493-lady , said [the knight]1813-the knight , thus it was : [Aurea]107-aurea , [[my]1341-the green knight sweetling]4783-my sweetling , abode with [an ancient dame]4784-an ancient dame , [a kinswoman of [hers]4784-an ancient dame]4785-a kinswoman of hers , who was but scantly kind to [her]4784-an ancient dame ; and on a day when [we]4786-we had met [privily]4787-privily , and were talking together , [[my]1341-the green knight love]4788-my love lamented the niggard ways of [[her]4784-an ancient dame said kinswoman]4789-her said kinswoman , and told how [she]4784-an ancient dame had no goodly gown to make [her]4784-an ancient dame fair when feasts were toward ; but [I]1341-the green knight laughed at [her]4784-an ancient dame , and told [her]4784-an ancient dame that so clad as [she]4784-an ancient dame was ( and [her]4784-an ancient dame attire was verily but simple ) [she]4784-an ancient dame was fairer than any other ; and then , as [ye]4790-ye may wot , there was kissing and clipping between [us]4786-we ; but at last , as from the first [I]1341-the green knight meant it , [I]1341-the green knight promised [her]4784-an ancient dame [I]1341-the green knight would purvey [her]4784-an ancient dame such a gown as [no lady]4791-no lady should go with a better in all [the country - side]4792-the country - side ; but [I]1341-the green knight said that in return [I]1341-the green knight must have the gown [she]4784-an ancient dame went in then , which had so long embraced [her]4784-an ancient dame body and been strained so close to [her]4784-an ancient dame body and [her]4784-an ancient dame sides , and was as it were a part of [her]4784-an ancient dame . That [she]4784-an ancient dame promised [me]1341-the green knight with kisses , and [I]1341-the green knight went away as merry as a bird . Straightway thereafter [I]1341-the green knight did do make this very gown , which [thou]4793-thou bearest , [dear maiden]1196-dear maiden , and on the appointed day [she]4784-an ancient dame came out to [me]1341-the green knight unto the same place clad as [she]4784-an ancient dame was before ; but the new gown [I]1341-the green knight had with [me]1341-the green knight . Hard by [our]4795-our trysting - place was a hazel - copse thick enow , for it was midsummer , and [she]4784-an ancient dame said [she]4784-an ancient dame would go thereinto and shift gowns , and bear [me]1341-the green knight out thence the gift of the old clout ( so [she]4784-an ancient dame called it , laughing merrily ) . But [I]1341-the green knight said : Nay , [I]1341-the green knight would go into the copse with [her]4784-an ancient dame to guard [her]4784-an ancient dame from evil things , beasts or [men]204-men ; and withal to see [her]4784-an ancient dame do off the old gown , that [I]1341-the green knight might know before [I]1341-the green knight wedded [her]4784-an ancient dame whatlike stuffing and padding went to make the grace of [her]4784-an ancient dame flanks and [her]4784-an ancient dame hips . Then [she]4784-an ancient dame did on this golden gown , and departed when [she]4784-an ancient dame had given [me]1341-the green knight the old clout aforesaid , and [I]1341-the green knight went away with it , scarce feeling the ground beneath [my]1341-the green knight feet ; and [I]1341-the green knight set the dear gown in a fair little coffer , and here in [this castle]1662-this castle [I]1341-the green knight have it now , and many times [I]1341-the green knight take it forth and kiss it and lay [my]1341-the green knight head upon it . Now this is a simple tale , [lady]493-lady , and [I]1341-the green knight am ashamed that [I]1341-the green knight have made it so long for [thee]493-lady . [Birdalone]108-birdalone deemed [Baudoin]115-baudoin [a good man]4801-a good man indeed , and the tears came into [her]108-birdalone eyes as [she]108-birdalone answered and said : True is [thy]115-baudoin tale , [dear friend]1220-dear friend , and [I]1341-the green knight have deemed it rather short than long . And yet , said [she]0-i , [Viridis]108-birdalone â€™[1341-the green knight] tale was the longest of all . [I]0-i doubt [thou]1817-thou mayst fail in the token . And [she]0-i laughed ; and [he]1818-he no less , and took [her]0-i by the shoulders , and kissed [her]0-i cheek frankly , and in such wise that [she]0-i feared [him]1818-he nought , and said : Now that is to pay [thee]1818-he for [thy]1818-he gibe ; what wouldst [thou]1818-he have of [me]0-i ? Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : [I]0-i would have [thee]1817-thou tell [me]0-i how it was that [Viridis]108-birdalone came by the smock with the green boughs aflame , which now [I]0-i bear upon [me]0-i . Hearken , [darling lady]1819-darling lady , said [he]1818-he : On a day [Viridis]108-birdalone and [I]0-i were alone in [the meadow]499-the meadow , and so happy , that [we]1821-we might find nought to do save to fall into strife together ; and [I]0-i said it to [her]0-i , that [she]0-i loved [me]0-i not as well as [I]0-i loved [her]0-i ; which , by the way , was no less than a lie , for of all things living [she]0-i is the most loving , and when [we]1821-we be together [she]0-i knoweth not how to make enough of [me]0-i . Well , [we]1821-we fell to wrangling after the manner of [lovers]1822-lovers , till [I]0-i , having nothing else to say , bade [her]0-i remember that since [we]1821-we had first come to love [each other]569-each other , [I]0-i had given [her]0-i many things , and [she]0-i had given [me]0-i nothing . [Lo]93-lo , then ! [[my]0-i dear]1824-my dear , what [an ill - conditioned lad]1825-an ill - conditioned lad was [I.]0-i But , little as [I]0-i meant it , [she]0-i took it all amiss , and leapt up , and fell to running back [home]373-home over [the meadow]499-the meadow ; [thou]1828-thou mayst think how easily [I]0-i caught up with [her]0-i , and how little loth [she]0-i was to be dragged back by the shoulders . So when [we]1821-we were sitting again under the thorn - bush , [we]1821-we had well - nigh done [our]1821-we wrangle ; but [she]0-i unlaced [her]0-i gown and drew down a corner thereof , to show [me]0-i [her]0-i shoulder , how [I]0-i had hurt it eâ€™en now ; and forsooth some little mark there was on the rose - leaf skin ; and that made good time for kissing again , as [ye]1829-ye may well wot . Then [she]0-i said unto [me]0-i : And how may [I]0-i , [a poor damsel]1830-a poor damsel , give [thee]1828-thou gifts , and [my]0-i kindred all greedy about [me]0-i ? Yet would [I]0-i give [thee]1828-thou a gift , such as [I]0-i may , if [I]0-i but knew what [thou]1828-thou wouldst take . Now [my]0-i heart was afire with that kissing of [her]0-i shoulder , and [I]0-i said that [I]0-i would have that very same smock from [her]0-i body , which then [she]0-i bore , and that thereof [I]0-i should deem that [I]0-i had a rich gift indeed . What ! said [she]0-i , and wouldst [thou]1828-thou have it here and now ? And indeed [I]0-i think [she]0-i would have done it off [her]0-i that minute had [I]0-i pressed [her]0-i , but [I]0-i lacked the boldness thereto ; and [I]0-i said : Nay , but would [she]0-i bring it unto [me]0-i the next time [we]1831-we met ; and forsooth [she]0-i brought it folded in a piece of green silk , and dearly have [I]0-i loved it and kissed it sithence . But as for [thy]0-i smock , [I]0-i had it fairly wrought and embroidered with the flaming green branches , as [thou]0-i seest it , and [I]0-i gave it to [her]0-i ; but not on the day when [she]0-i gave [me]0-i the gift ; for the new one was long about doing . Now this is all the tale , and how [Viridis]108-birdalone might eke it into a long one , [I]0-i wot not . But let it be , and tell [me]0-i , have [I]0-i won [thy]0-i smock , or lost it ? [Birdalone]108-birdalone laughed on [him]1832-he and said : Well , at least [thou]0-i shalt have it as a gift ; and [thou]0-i mayst call it given either by [Viridis]108-birdalone or [me]0-i , which [thou]0-i wilt . But with it goes another gift ; which [thou]0-i mayst have at once since [thou]0-i must lend [me]0-i the smock a little longer . And therewith [she]0-i betook [him]1832-he [her]0-i girdle , and [he]1832-he kissed it , but said : Nay , [fair lady]1833-fair lady , this befitteth well the loveliness of [thy]0-i body that [thou]0-i shouldst wear it ; and well it befitteth the truth and love of [thy]0-i soul toward it for [me]0-i ; [I]0-i pray [thee]0-i to keep it . Nevertheless , [she]0-i said , [I]0-i will not have it , for it goeth with [mine]0-i errand that [thou]0-i take it of [me]0-i . Now [I]0-i bid [thee]0-i depart , and send hither [[thy]0-i fellow]1834-thy fellow , [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire . Went [he]1832-he then , and anon comes [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , and now that [he]1832-he was alone with [Birdalone]108-birdalone this first time , [he]1832-he seemed moody and downcast , all unlike [the two others]4719-the two others . [He]1832-he stood a little aloof from [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and said : What wouldst [thou]0-i ask of [me]0-i ? [Her]0-i heart was somewhat chilled by [his]1832-he moodiness , for erst had [she]0-i deemed [him]1832-he [the kindest of [the three]288-the three]1838-the kindest of the three ; but [she]0-i said : It is of [mine]0-i errand to ask of [thee]1832-he concerning this foot - gear which [Atra]109-atra lent [me]0-i until [I]0-i give it unto [thee]1832-he , if [thou]1832-he be verily [[her]109-atra lover]1814-her lover . Said [he]1832-he : [I]0-i was verily [[her]109-atra lover]1814-her lover . [Birdalone]108-birdalone said : Then canst [thou]1832-he tell [me]0-i the manner of [thy]1832-he giving these fair shoon unto [Atra]109-atra ? [He]1832-he said : Even so ; [we]1842-we were walking together in [this country - side]1740-this country - side and came to [a ford of [the river]1845-the river]1844-a ford of the river , and it was somewhat deep and took [me]0-i to over the knee , so [I]0-i bore [her]109-atra over in [my]0-i arms ; then [we]1842-we went on a little further till [we]1842-we must cross [the river]1845-the river back again in another place , and there [the ford]1847-the ford was shallower , and , the day being hot , [Atra]109-atra must needs wade it on [her]109-atra own feet . So [she]109-atra did off hosen and shoon , and [I]0-i led [her]109-atra by the hand , and it took [her]109-atra but up to mid - leg . But when [we]1842-we came up out of [the water]347-the water and were on the grass again , [I]0-i craved the gift of [her]109-atra foot - gear for the love of [her]109-atra , and [she]109-atra gave it straightway , and fared [home]373-home barefoot , for it was over the meads [we]1842-we were wending in early summer , and the grass was thick and soft . But thereafter [I]0-i did do make the fair shoon which [thou]1850-thou hast on [thy]1850-thou feet , and gave them to [her]109-atra . And , for a further token that [my]0-i tale is true , [I]0-i shall tell [thee]1850-thou that the name of [the first ford [we]1842-we waded]1851-the first ford we waded that day is [the Grey - nag]1852-the grey - nag â€™s Wade , and the second is called [Goat Ford]27-goat ford . This is all [my]0-i tale , [lady]493-lady ; is the token true ? True it is , [squire]1547-squire , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and was silent awhile , and [he]1547-squire also . Then [she]109-atra looked on [him]1547-squire friendly , and said : [Thou]1850-thou art out of heart as now , [[my]0-i friend]304-my friend . Fear not , for [thou]1850-thou shalt without doubt see [[thy]1850-thou speech - friend]4693-thy speech - friend again . Moreover here is a ring which [she]109-atra set upon [my]0-i finger , bidding [me]0-i give it [thee]1850-thou . And [she]109-atra held it out unto [him]1547-squire . [He]1547-squire took the ring , and said : Yea , it is best that [I]0-i have it of [thee]493-lady , lest unluck come thereof . [She]109-atra saw trouble in [his]1547-squire face , but knew not what to say to cheer [him]1547-squire , and [they]1857-they stood silently facing [one another]1858-one another for awhile . Then [he]1547-squire said : Let [us]1857-they back to [[our]1857-they fellows]1859-our fellows , and talk it over , what is now to be done . So [they]1857-they went [their]1857-they ways to where lay [the other two]1860-the other two upon the green grass , and [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire lay down beside [them]1857-they ; but [Birdalone]108-birdalone stood before [them]1857-they and spake unto [the three]288-the three . Chapter VI ~ How the Champions Would Do [Birdalone]108-birdalone to Be Clad Anew in [the Castle of the Quest Lords]1863-the castle of the quest lords , [she]109-atra said , now is it clear by the tokens that [mine]109-atra errand is to [you]1547-squire and none other ; now therefore am [I]0-i to tell [you]1547-squire what to do to come unto [[your]1547-squire speech - friends]1864-your speech - friends and deliver [them]1864-your speech - friends and bring [them]1864-your speech - friends back hither . For this is [their]1864-your speech - friends case , that [they]1864-your speech - friends are in captivity in [a wonder - isle of [this great water]1866-this great water]1865-a wonder - isle of this great water , and it is called [the Isle of Increase Unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought . Spake [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight : [Fair lady]1833-fair lady , [we]1869-we have heard before that [[our]1869-we friends]1870-our friends fared hence , or rather were taken hence over [the water]347-the water . And that is the cause why [we]1869-we builded [this castle on [the water]347-the water â€™s edge]1872-this castle on the water â€™s edge , on [the very stead where was raised [the pavilion]4413-the pavilion]1874-the very stead where was raised the pavilion , [the house]311-the house made for [the ladies]1877-the ladies to abide therein the battle of [the Champions]132-the champions . Since that time , moreover , many [a barge and keel]1878-a barge and keel have [we]1869-we thrust out into [the water]347-the water , that [we]1869-we might accomplish the Quest whereunto [we]1869-we were vowed ; but ever one way went [our]1869-we seafaring , that when [we]1869-we were come so far out into [the water]347-the water as to lose sight of [land]641-land , came upon [us]1869-we mist , rose against [us]1869-we dusk and darkness ; and then a fierce driving wind that drave [us]1869-we back to [this shore]1882-this shore . It is but six days ago since [we]1869-we tried this adventure for the last time , and belike the same shall befall [us]1869-we the next time [we]1869-we try it . Wherefore [I]0-i must ask [thee]1883-thou , [lady]493-lady , dost [thou]1883-thou know any way whereby [we]1869-we may come to [the said isle]1885-the said isle ? For if [thou]1883-thou dost , full surely [we]1869-we will try it , whatsoever may be the risk thereby to [our]1869-we bodies or [our]1869-we souls . Full surely [I]0-i do , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; else how had [I]0-i come from thence hither [mine]0-i own self ? And therewith [she]108-birdalone told [them]1886-them of the Sending Boat , what it was , and how [she]108-birdalone had come all the way by means thereof from [the Isle of [Increase Unsought]29-increase unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought ; and [they]1886-them all hearkened [her]108-birdalone heedfully , and wondered both at the sorcery , and the valiant heart of [her]108-birdalone who had driven it as [she]108-birdalone would in despite of the evil . But in the end [she]108-birdalone spake and said : [Lords]1887-lords , [ye]1887-lords have now heard some deal of [my]0-i story , even that which concerns [you]1887-lords thereof ; and which must needs be told at once : wherefore doubtless [ye]1887-lords shall fare unto [[your]1887-lords speech - friends]1864-your speech - friends by this ferry in the very wise that [I]0-i shall show [you]1887-lords ; unless perchance [ye]1887-lords deem that [I]0-i have been lying and making light tales to [you]1887-lords , as , sooth to say , [I]0-i deem [ye]1887-lords think it not . [Spake]109-atra [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight : [Damsel]127-damsel , in all wise [we]1890-we trow in [thee]1887-lords and [thy]1887-lords tale . And [God]114-god forbid that [we]1890-we should tarry ! Go [we]1890-we hence this very day . [Yea]1891-yea , but hearken , said [the Black Squire]119-arthur : Is it not a part of [this damsel]1892-this damsel â€™s errand that [she]1892-this damsel should deliver to [us]1890-we the raiment of [[our]1890-we friends]1870-our friends , which now [she]1892-this damsel beareth on [her]1892-this damsel own body , that [we]1890-we may bear it back unto [them]1870-our friends ? Sooth is that , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [ye]1894-ye may well wot that this may be nought but needful , whereas [the said ladies]1895-the said ladies be all beset by sorceries . See [ye]1894-ye then , [fellows]1314-fellows , said [the Black Squire]119-arthur , it may not be today nor yet tomorrow that [we]1890-we may take [the road]1797-the road . For [ye]1894-ye wot that there is [no woman]746-no woman â€™s gear in all [the castle]1534-the castle , and [we]1890-we must needs send otherwhere to seek it . Look [thou]1900-thee , [maiden]1105-maiden , said [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight , laughing , how duly [this young knight]1903-this young knight thinketh of [thee]1900-thee ; whereas [I]0-i , who am [[his]1903-this young knight elder]1904-his elder , and should be wiser than [he]1903-this young knight , am but heedless of [thee]1900-thee . [I]0-i pray [thy]1900-thee pardon . Moreover , said [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , there may well be wisdom in abiding ; for it is to be thought that [[our]1890-we dear loves]1906-our dear loves considered this , and knew what the time of tarrying should be , and have so dight [their]1906-our dear loves matter as to fit in therewith ; and [I]0-i may not deem it of [them]1906-our dear loves that [they]1906-our dear loves would have [us]1890-we array this [[our]1890-we dear sister]1907-our dear sister and [theirs]1906-our dear loves in unseemly wise . Nay , for that would be an ill beginning of this deal of the Quest . Now all yeasaid this gladly ; and [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight said : It were not so ill done that [we]1890-we should see more of [[our]1890-we sister]1909-our sister here ere [we]1890-we depart , and hear more of [her]1909-our sister tale ; for meseemeth [she]1909-our sister began it erewhile but half - way . And [he]1341-the green knight turned to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and took [her]108-birdalone hand and caressed it . [Birdalone]108-birdalone smiled on [them]1906-our dear loves somewhat shyly , and thanked [them]1906-our dear loves ; but bade [them]1906-our dear loves spend as little time as might be on [her]1909-our sister arrayal . For , said [she]108-birdalone , though [those ladies]1501-those ladies may well have reckoned on the time of the arrayal of [my]0-i body , yet surely also [they]1501-those ladies shall have reckoned with the eager fire of love in the hearts of [you]1911-you , and the haste it shall breed therein . Well pleased were [they]1501-those ladies with that word of [hers]1909-our sister , but [none the less]1912-none the less sent [two sergeants]1913-two sergeants and a squire with led horses unto [the cheaping - town]219-the cheaping - town , [a goodly and great town hight Greenford]1915-a goodly and great town hight greenford , which was some twenty miles thence , with the errand to bring back with [them]1906-our dear loves [a good shaper and embroideress]1916-a good shaper and embroideress , and sewing - [women]420-women , and cloth and silk and linen , and all things needful . As for jewels , [each one of [them]1906-our dear loves]1918-each one of them was fain to give [her]108-birdalone something which [he]1919-he prized , and fair and rich were the gifts , though they had not been made for [women]420-women . As a fair SS collar of gold , which [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight gave [her]108-birdalone , and a girdle of broad golden plates , wrought beauteously , which was the gift of [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire . Albeit [he]1919-he did not offer to clasp it round [her]108-birdalone loins , as [she]108-birdalone deemed [he]1919-he would ; for when [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight brought [his]1341-the green knight gift , a great gold ring , very ancient of fashion , [he]1341-the green knight would have [her]108-birdalone turn back the sleeve from [her]108-birdalone fore - arm , that [he]1341-the green knight might set [his]1341-the green knight dwarf - wrought gold upon the bare flesh ; neither did [he]1341-the green knight refrain [him]1341-the green knight from kissing it withal . But [the messengers]1924-the messengers came back with [their]1924-the messengers work - [women]420-women and stuffs early on the morrow ; and now was changed all the manner of [the womanless castle]1926-the womanless castle , and [men]204-men were full merry therein . Chapter VII ~ Of [Birdalone]108-birdalone , How [She]108-birdalone Told [the Champions]1928-the champions All [Her]108-birdalone Tale It was a matter of eight days , the making of all [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s raiment , and meanwhile [she]108-birdalone was ever with [the three Champions]1929-the three champions , either all three together , or one or other of [them]1929-the three champions . And as to [their]1929-the three champions manners with [her]108-birdalone , ever was [the Golden Knight of somewhat sober demeanour]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , as if [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour were [an older man than [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour verily was]1931-an older man than he verily was . [The Green Knight]1341-the green knight was for ever praising [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s beauty to [her]108-birdalone face , and seemed to find it no easy matter to keep [his]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour eyes off [her]108-birdalone , and somewhat [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour wearied [her]108-birdalone with kisses and caresses ; but [a gay and sportive lad]1933-a gay and sportive lad [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour was ; and when [she]108-birdalone rebuked [him]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour for [his]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour overmuch fondness , as now and again [she]108-birdalone did , [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour would laugh at [himself]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour along with [her]108-birdalone ; and in sooth [she]108-birdalone deemed [him]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour heart - whole , and of all truth to [Viridis]108-birdalone , and oft [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour would talk of [her]108-birdalone to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and praise [her]108-birdalone darling beauty to [her]108-birdalone , and tell of [his]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour longing for [his]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour love aloof . Only , quoth [he]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , here art [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , [[my]0-i sister]1162-my sister , dwelling amongst [us]1935-us , and shedding [thy]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour fragrance on [us]1935-us , and showing to [us]1935-us , wilt [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , wilt [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour not , as do the flowers , all the grace and loveliness of [thee]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour ; and [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour so tender of heart withal , that [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour must not blame [me]0-i overmuch if whiles [I]0-i forget that [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour art [[my]0-i sister]1162-my sister , and that [my]0-i love is , woe â€™s [me]0-i ! far away . So [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour wilt pardon [me]0-i , wilt [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour not ? [Yea]1937-yea , verily , said [she]0-i , with a whole heart . Yet [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour needest not reach out for [my]0-i hand ; [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour hast had enough of it this morning . And [she]0-i hid it , laughing , in the folds of [her]0-i gown ; and [he]1938-he laughed also , and said : Of a truth [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour art good in all wise , and [a young fool]1939-a young fool am [I]0-i ; but [Viridis]108-birdalone shall make [me]0-i wiser , when [we]1940-we come together again . Sawest [thou]1930-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour ever so fair [a damsel]1941-a damsel ? Never , [she]0-i said , and surely there is none fairer in all [the world]417-the world . So hold [thee]1938-he aloof now for a while , and think of [her]0-i . As for [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , hight [Arthur]119-arthur , [Birdalone]108-birdalone was troubled for [him]1938-he , and [he]1938-he made [her]0-i somewhat sad . True it is that [he]1938-he came not before [her]0-i again so moody and downcast as when [he]1938-he was giving [her]0-i the token ; yet [she]0-i deemed that [he]1938-he enforced [himself]1938-he to seem of good cheer . Furthermore , though [he]1938-he sought [her]0-i company ever , and that lonely with [him]1938-he , and would talk with [her]0-i almost as [one man]1944-one man with another , though with a certain tenderness in [his]1938-he voice , and looking earnestly on [her]0-i the while , yet never would [he]1938-he take [her]0-i hand , or touch [her]0-i in any wise . And true it is that [she]0-i longed for the touch of [his]1938-he hand . On the third day of [her]0-i sojourn in [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest , [Birdalone]108-birdalone took heart at the much egging of [[her]0-i friends]1305-her friends , as [they]1305-her friends sat all together in [the meadow]499-the meadow without [the castle]1534-the castle , to tell [them]1305-her friends all the story of [her]0-i ; [she]0-i hid none , save concerning [the wood - mother]925-the wood - mother , for [she]0-i deemed that [[her]0-i sweet friend]1950-her sweet friend would love [her]0-i the better if [she]0-i babbled not of [her]0-i . So [the Champions]1928-the champions hearkened [her]0-i telling the tale in [her]0-i clear lovely voice , and great was [their]1928-the champions love and pity for [the poor lonely maiden]1952-the poor lonely maiden . And in especial clear it was to see that [they]1928-the champions were sore moved when [she]0-i told how [she]0-i first came on [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat , and how [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife tormented [her]0-i innocent body for that guilt . Then [Baudoin]115-baudoin laid [his]115-baudoin hand upon [her]0-i head , and spake : [Poor child]1955-poor child , much indeed hast [thou]1956-thou suffered ! and now [I]0-i will say it , that it was for [us]1957-us and [our]1957-us loves that [thou]1956-thou hast borne all this anguish of captivity and toil and stripes . But [Hugh]118-hugh leaned over to [her]0-i , as [she]0-i sat with [her]0-i head hanging down , and kissed [her]0-i cheek , and said : [Yea]1958-yea ! and [I]0-i was not there to smite the head off that accursed one ; and [I]0-i knew nought of [thee]1959-thee and thine anguish , as [I]0-i took [my]0-i light pleasure about [these free meadows]1960-these free meadows . And [he]118-hugh turned very red , and went nigh to weep . [Arthur]119-arthur sat still with [his]119-arthur eyes bent down on the ground , and [he]119-arthur said nothing ; and [Birdalone]108-birdalone glanced on [him]119-arthur wistfully ere [she]108-birdalone went on with [her]108-birdalone tale . And [she]108-birdalone went on and told closely all that had happened unto [her]108-birdalone in the crossing of [the water]347-the water and on [the Isle of [Increase Unsought]112-increase unsought]4590-the isle of increase unsought , and the other [Wonder Isles]31-wonder isles ; and [she]108-birdalone deemed it not too much that [she]108-birdalone should tell it twice over , nor [they]1963-they that twice over [they]1963-they should hearken it . That same evening as [Birdalone]108-birdalone walked by [herself]108-birdalone in [the castle]1534-the castle pleasance , [she]108-birdalone saw [Arthur]119-arthur peering about as if [he]119-arthur were seeking [someone]485-someone ; so [she]108-birdalone stood forth , and asked [him]119-arthur was [he]119-arthur seeking aught ; and [he]119-arthur said : [Thee]1966-thee was [I]0-i seeking . But [she]108-birdalone durst not ask [him]119-arthur what [he]119-arthur would , but stood silent and trembling before [him]119-arthur , till [he]119-arthur took [her]108-birdalone hand , and spake not loud but eagerly . After what [thou]1967-thee hast told [us]1968-us today , [I]0-i seem to know [thee]1967-thee what [thou]1967-thee art ; and [I]0-i tell [thee]1967-thee that it is a pain and grief to [me]0-i to leave [thee]1967-thee , [yea]1969-yea to leave [thee]1967-thee were it but for a minute . O [I]0-i pray [thee]1967-thee pity [me]0-i for the sundering . And therewith [he]119-arthur turned about and hastened into [the castle]1534-the castle . But [Birdalone]108-birdalone stood there with [her]108-birdalone heart beating fast and [her]108-birdalone flesh quivering , and a strange sweetness of joy took hold of [her]108-birdalone . But [she]108-birdalone said to [herself]108-birdalone that it was no wonder though [she]108-birdalone felt so happy , seeing that [she]108-birdalone had found out that , despite [her]108-birdalone fears , [this one of [[her]108-birdalone friends]1305-her friends]1971-this one of her friends loved [her]108-birdalone no less well than [the others]1287-the others . And then [she]108-birdalone spake it in a soft voice that [she]108-birdalone would indeed pity [him]119-arthur for the sundering , yea , and [herself]108-birdalone also . Nevertheless , when [they]1974-they met thereafter , [his]119-arthur demeanour to [her]108-birdalone was none otherwise than it had been ; but [she]108-birdalone no longer heeded this since now [she]108-birdalone trowed in [him]119-arthur . Chapter VIII ~ In the Meanwhile of [the Departing of [the Champions]1928-the champions]1975-the departing of the champions , [They]1928-the champions Would Pleasure [Birdalone]108-birdalone with Feats of Arms and Games of Prowess Passed the days now speedily , and [the three Champions]1929-the three champions did what [they]1928-the champions might for the solace of [Birdalone]108-birdalone . For [they]1928-the champions and [[their]1928-the champions household]1978-their household showed [her]108-birdalone of arms , and [they]1928-the champions tilted together courteously ; and [the sergeants]1979-the sergeants stood forth , and shot in the bow before [her]108-birdalone , till [she]108-birdalone [herself]108-birdalone by [their]1979-the sergeants bidding took the bow in hand , and shot straighter and well - nigh as hard as [the best man]1980-the best man [there]215-there , whereat [they]1979-the sergeants marvelled , and praised [her]108-birdalone much . Then [the young men]1982-the young men ran afoot before [her]108-birdalone for the prize of a belt and knife , and forsooth [she]108-birdalone wotted well that were [she]108-birdalone to run against [them]1982-the young men with trussed - up skirts [she]108-birdalone would bear off the prize ; but [she]108-birdalone had no heart thereto , for amidst [them]1982-the young men all , and [her]108-birdalone new friendships , [she]108-birdalone had grown shamefast , and might play [the wood - maiden]517-the wood - maiden no longer . Yet twice [the Champions]1928-the champions fared further afield with [her]108-birdalone to show [her]108-birdalone some woodcraft ; yet were not very free to go far , because of the ill neighbours whereof [the chaplain]1985-the chaplain had told [her]108-birdalone that first night of [her]108-birdalone coming . And in all these pastimes , whatso [they]1982-the young men were , [Birdalone]108-birdalone bore [herself]108-birdalone well and merrily , and put from [her]108-birdalone the sorrow of the sundering , and the peril of [[her]108-birdalone dear friends]1986-her dear friends which grew now so near at hand . [The chaplain]1985-the chaplain aforesaid , who hight [Leonard]130-leonard , [she]108-birdalone fell in with not seldom ; and [he]1985-the chaplain was ever meek and humble before [her]108-birdalone ; and ever withal was sorrow easy to be seen in [his]1985-the chaplain countenance , and trouble withal ; and [she]108-birdalone knew not how to help [him]1985-the chaplain , save by being courteous and kind with [him]1985-the chaplain whenso [they]1988-they met ; but none the more might [he]1985-the chaplain pluck up cheerful countenance in answer to [her]108-birdalone kindness . With [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , [the grizzle - haired castellan]1989-the grizzle - haired castellan , [she]108-birdalone foregathered also oft enough , and could not forbear some merry gibes with [him]1985-the chaplain concerning [their]1988-they first meeting , and how that [she]108-birdalone had been a burden and a terror to [him]1985-the chaplain ; and these mocks [she]108-birdalone made [him]1985-the chaplain because [she]108-birdalone saw it liked [him]1985-the chaplain not ill to be mocked in friendly fashion ; though forsooth betwixt the laughter [he]1985-the chaplain looked on [her]108-birdalone somewhat ruefully . And ever , ere [he]1985-the chaplain parted from [her]108-birdalone , [he]1985-the chaplain made occasion to kiss [her]108-birdalone hands ; and [she]108-birdalone suffered it smiling , and was debonair to [him]1985-the chaplain ; whereas [she]108-birdalone saw that [he]1985-the chaplain was of good will to [her]108-birdalone . In such wise then wore the hours and the days . Chapter IX ~ [Birdalone]108-birdalone Cometh Before [the Champions]132-the champions in [Her]108-birdalone New Array Now the time was come when [Birdalone]108-birdalone had all [her]108-birdalone gear ready , and [the women]1990-the women were to abide in [the castle]1534-the castle as [[her]108-birdalone serving - damsels]1992-her serving - damsels while [the Champions]1928-the champions were away . So now in the summer eve , an hour before sunset , [Birdalone]108-birdalone did on the richest of [her]108-birdalone new raiment , and came into [the hall]1193-the hall where sat [the Three together]1995-the three together , and [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris with [them]1995-the three together . [She]108-birdalone was so clad , that [she]108-birdalone had on a green gown with broidered sleeves , and thereover a white cote - hardie welted with gold , and gold - embroidered ; on [her]108-birdalone feet were gold shoon of window - work , pearled and gemmed ; and on [her]108-birdalone head a rose garland ; on [her]108-birdalone neck [she]108-birdalone bore the Golden Knight â€™s collar ; [her]108-birdalone loins were girt with the Black Squire â€™s girdle ; and on [her]108-birdalone wrist was [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight â€™s ancient gold ring ; and [she]108-birdalone carried in [her]108-birdalone arms [Aurea]107-aurea â€™s gown and [Viridis]108-birdalone â€™ shift and Atra â€™s shoon . Rather sunrise than sunset it seemed , as verily [Birdalone]108-birdalone [she]108-birdalone came into [the hall]1193-the hall with bright eager eyes , and flushed cheeks , and countenance smiling with love . [The men]4811-the men stood up all , and would come down from the dais to meet [her]108-birdalone ; but [she]108-birdalone bade [them]4811-the men go back , and sit each in [his]4811-the men place till [she]108-birdalone stood before [them]4811-the men . Up [the hall]1193-the hall then [she]108-birdalone walked , and every step of [hers]108-birdalone seemed lovelier than the last , till [she]108-birdalone came to [them]4811-the men and gave unto [each]4577-each [his]4811-the men keepsake , and said : [Champions]4814-champions , now is [mine]108-birdalone errand all done , save that tomorrow [I]1985-the chaplain must show [you]4814-champions the manner of [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat . Now there is nought save the darkness of the coming night to hinder [you]4814-champions from this last deal of [your]4814-champions Quest ; and it is [I]1985-the chaplain that have brought [you]4814-champions to this , and have done this good unto [you]4814-champions , if no more good [I]1985-the chaplain do in [the world]417-the world . Wherefore [I]1985-the chaplain pray [you]4814-champions to love [me]1985-the chaplain ever , and bear [me]1985-the chaplain ever in [your]4814-champions minds . [They]4811-the men gazed on [her]108-birdalone , and were overcome by [her]108-birdalone loveliness and grace , and by the kindness and valiancy of [her]108-birdalone heart . Next arose [the Golden Knight]115-baudoin , [Baudoin]115-baudoin to wit , and took a cross from [his]115-baudoin breast , and held it up , and spake : [Maiden]133-maiden , [thou]133-maiden sayest well , and never shall [we]4811-the men forget [thee]133-maiden , or cease to love [thee]133-maiden ; and here [I]1985-the chaplain swear by [God]114-god upon the Tree , that it shall be a light thing for [me]1985-the chaplain to die for [thee]133-maiden , if in any need [I]1985-the chaplain find [thee]133-maiden . [Brethren]4817-brethren , will [ye]4817-brethren not swear the same ? And this is but [thy]133-maiden due , [maiden]1105-maiden , for [I]1985-the chaplain declare unto [thee]133-maiden , that when [thou]133-maiden didst enter [the hall eâ€™en]4819-the hall eâ€™en now , it was as if the very sun of heaven was coming in unto [us]4811-the men . Thereon [the other two]1860-the other two took the Rood and swore upon it : and [Hugh]118-hugh was hushed and meek and sad - faced after [he]118-hugh had sworn ; but [Arthur the Black Squire]119-arthur bowed down [his]119-arthur head and wept , and [[his]119-arthur fellows]4821-his fellows marvelled nought thereat , neither did [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; and all [her]108-birdalone body yearned toward [him]119-arthur to solace [him]119-arthur . Now turned [Sir Baudoin]115-baudoin to [the castellan]1691-the castellan and said : [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , [I]1985-the chaplain will now swear [thee]131-sir aymeris to guard [this lady]4823-this lady as the apple of thine eye whiles [we]4811-the men three be away , and therein to spare neither [thyself]4824-thou nor [others]4825-others . For [thou]4824-thou seest well what grief it would be to [us]4811-the men if [she]4823-this lady came to any harm . And to [me]1985-the chaplain also , said [the castellan]1691-the castellan . And therewith [he]1985-the chaplain swore upon [the Rood]134-the rood , and then came round the table , and knelt before [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and kissed [her]108-birdalone hands . Thereafter were [they]4811-the men all silent a space ; and then came [Birdalone]108-birdalone to the inner side of the table and sat betwixt [Baudoin]115-baudoin and [Hugh]118-hugh . But [the Black Squire]119-arthur took up the word and spake : [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [sweet child]902-sweet child , one thing is to be said , to wit , that it were well that [thou]4824-thou keep within walls while [we]4811-the men be away ; or at least that [thou]4824-thou go but a little beyond [the castle]1534-the castle , and never but within a half bowshot , save [thou]4824-thou be well accompanied . For there be [men of violence dwelling no great way off]4829-men of violence dwelling no great way off , [reivers and rovers]4830-reivers and rovers , who would be well pleased to take from [us]4811-the men anything which [we]4811-the men deem dear ; besides [others who would think the lifting of such a jewel good hap]4831-others who would think the lifting of such a jewel good hap indeed . [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , have a care of [the Red Knight]135-the red knight ; and if [thou]4824-thou mightest come by [a few more stout lads]4832-a few more stout lads , to wage [them]4832-a few more stout lads , it were well . [Birdalone]108-birdalone heeded not what [the castellan]1691-the castellan answered , such a shaft of joy went to [her]108-birdalone heart when [she]108-birdalone heard [that friend]4834-that friend speak [her]108-birdalone own name in such wise as [he]4834-that friend had never done erst , and that before [them]4811-the men all . [She]108-birdalone but murmured some yeasay to that which [Arthur]119-arthur had spoken unto [her]108-birdalone , and then [she]108-birdalone held [her]108-birdalone peace for the sweetness of that moment . So there [they]4811-the men sat and talked a while in dear and pleasant converse ; and [Hugh]118-hugh fell to asking [her]108-birdalone of [her]108-birdalone life in [the House under [the Wood]4-the wood]4835-the house under the wood , and [she]108-birdalone answered all frankly and simply , and the more [she]108-birdalone told [the dearer]4836-the dearer [she]108-birdalone seemed to [them]4811-the men . Thus drew night in , till [folk]4521-folk came flockmeal into [the hall]1193-the hall ; for needs must be feast and banquet for triumph of the furtherance of the Quest ; and [the most of men]4839-the most of men were merry ; but somewhat sober were all [the three Champions]1929-the three champions , so that whoso ran might read it in [their]4811-the men faces . As for [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [she]108-birdalone showed cheerful to all that folk which loved [her]108-birdalone and praised [her]108-birdalone ; but inwardly sorrow had come home to [her]108-birdalone heart . Chapter X ~ [The Champions]1928-the champions Go [Their]1928-the champions Ways in [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat When the sun was arisen on the morrow [the three Champions]1929-the three champions went down to [the landing - place]1643-the landing - place , and there was none with [them]1929-the three champions ; for [they]1929-the three champions had given command that [no man]534-no man should pry into [their]1929-the three champions doings . Thither to [them]1929-the three champions cometh [Birdalone]108-birdalone , clad no more in [her]108-birdalone gay attire , but in a strait black coat and with unshod feet ; and [she]108-birdalone looked no sorrier than [she]108-birdalone was . By [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s rede [the Champions]1928-the champions bore down in [their]1928-the champions own hands the victual and weapons and armour that [they]1928-the champions needed for the voyage ; for [she]108-birdalone knew not but that [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat might take it amiss that any should touch [her]108-birdalone save [the senders]4848-the senders . And when [they]1928-the champions had done lading [her]108-birdalone , then [all four]4849-all four stood together by [the water]347-the water â€™s edge , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone spake to [[her]108-birdalone friends]1305-her friends , and again bade [them]1305-her friends beware of the wiles of [the Isle of Nothing]1595-the isle of nothing ; and again [she]108-birdalone told [them]1305-her friends of the woful images of [the Isle of Kings]4853-the isle of kings and [the Isle of Queens]4854-the isle of queens , and [the strange folk of [the Isle of [the Young and the Old]4655-the young and the old]4856-the isle of the young and the old]4855-the strange folk of the isle of the young and the old . Then [she]108-birdalone said : Now when [ye]4858-ye come to [the Isle of Increase Unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought , what think [ye]4858-ye to do ? Said [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight : If [I]1985-the chaplain might rule , [we]4860-we should go straight up to [the witch sitting in [[her]4861-the witch sitting in her hall hall]4862-her hall]4861-the witch sitting in her hall , as [thou]4863-ye toldest [us]4860-we , [[my]1985-the chaplain dear]1824-my dear , and then and there smite the head from off [her]4861-the witch sitting in her hall . [His]1985-the chaplain eyes flashed and [his]1985-the chaplain brow knitted , and so fierce [he]1985-the chaplain looked that [Birdalone]108-birdalone shrank back from [him]1985-the chaplain ; but [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire smiled and said : It may come to the smiting off of heads in the end ; yet must [we]4860-we so fashion [our]4860-we carving , that it avail [us]4860-we for the freeing of [[our]4860-we friends]1870-our friends ; else may [the witch]394-the witch die , and the secret of [the prison - house]4868-the prison - house die with [her]4861-the witch sitting in her hall . How sayest [thou]4863-ye , dear [Birdalone]108-birdalone ? [She]108-birdalone reddened at the caress of [his]1985-the chaplain voice , and answered : By [my]1985-the chaplain rede [ye]4863-ye shall seek and find [[your]4863-ye speech - friends]1864-your speech - friends ere [ye]4863-ye make open war upon [the witch]394-the witch ; else may [her]4861-the witch sitting in her hall malice destroy [them]1864-your speech - friends ere [ye]4863-ye undo [her]4861-the witch sitting in her hall . [Her]108-birdalone face flushed yet more as [she]108-birdalone spake again : But concerning all things , [I]1985-the chaplain deem that [Atra]109-atra may give [you]4863-ye the best rede , when [ye]4863-ye have met [the loves]4871-the loves ; for that [she]109-atra knoweth more of [the isle]631-the isle and its guiles than the others . [Quoth Baudoin]136-quoth baudoin : Herein is wisdom , [sweet maiden]4873-sweet maiden , for as guileless as [thou]4874-thou mayst be ; and so far as [we]4875-we may [we]4875-we shall follow [thy]4874-thou rede ; but all lieth in the fathom of the coming time . And now this moment is the moment of sundering and farewell . Came [he]4876-he then to [Birdalone]108-birdalone and took [his]4876-he two hands about [her]108-birdalone head , and lifted [her]108-birdalone face unto [him]4876-he , and kissed it kindly , as [a father]908-a father might kiss [a daughter]4878-a daughter , and said : Farewell , [dear child]4663-dear child , and take heed to the word that [Arthur]119-arthur spake yesterday , and go not from [the castle]1534-the castle even a little way save with good and sure company . Then came [Hugh]118-hugh to [her]108-birdalone , and took [her]108-birdalone hand somewhat timidly ; but [she]108-birdalone put up [her]108-birdalone face to [him]4876-he in simple wise , and [he]4876-he kissed either cheek of [her]108-birdalone , and said no more than : Farewell , [Birdalone]108-birdalone !
