Lastly came [Arthur]119-arthur , and stood before [her]108-birdalone a little ; and then [he]119-arthur knelt down on the stones before [her]108-birdalone and kissed [her]108-birdalone feet many times , and [she]108-birdalone shuddered and caught [her]108-birdalone breath as [they]4881-they felt [his]119-arthur kisses ; but neither [he]119-arthur nor [she]108-birdalone spake a word , and [he]119-arthur stood up and turned away at once toward [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat , and boarded [her]108-birdalone first of the three ; and [the others]1287-the others followed straightway . Thereafter [the Champions]1928-the champions bared each an arm , and let blood flow thence into a bowl , and reddened stem and stern of [[their]1928-the champions barge]4885-their barge , and then [all three]1397-all three spake the spell together thus , as [Birdalone]108-birdalone had taught [them]1928-the champions : The red raven - wine now Hast [thou]4887-thou drunk , stern and bow : Wake then , and awake , And the northern way take ! The way of the Wenders forth over the flood , For the will of [the Senders]4848-the senders is blent with the blood . Went all as before thereafter , that the Sending Boat stirred under [them]1928-the champions , and then turned about and pointed [her]108-birdalone bows to the northward , and sped swiftly over [the waters]624-the waters . It was a fair sunny day , with no cloud , nought save the summer haze lying on [the lake]355-the lake far away . [Birdalone]108-birdalone stood watching the speeding of [the boat]850-the boat , till [she]108-birdalone could see it no longer , not even as a fleck on the face of [the waters]624-the waters . Then [she]108-birdalone turned away and went toward [[her]108-birdalone chamber]4893-her chamber , saying to [herself]108-birdalone that the sundering was easier to bear than [she]108-birdalone had deemed it would be , and that [she]108-birdalone had a many things to do that day . But when [she]108-birdalone came into [[her]108-birdalone chamber]4893-her chamber , and shut the door , [she]108-birdalone looked about [her]108-birdalone on the things which had grown so familiar to [her]108-birdalone in these few latter days , and [she]108-birdalone stood watching the bright sunshine that streamed across the floor and lay warm upon [her]108-birdalone feet ; then [she]108-birdalone took three steps toward the window , and saw [the lake]355-the lake lying all a - glitter under the sun , and [her]108-birdalone heart failed [her]108-birdalone withal , and [she]108-birdalone had no might so much as to think about [her]108-birdalone sorrow and caress it , but fell down where [she]108-birdalone was swooning on to the floor , and lay there , while all [the house]311-the house began to stir about [her]108-birdalone . Now came [Birdalone]108-birdalone to [herself]108-birdalone , and that was but little joy unto [her]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone yet lay still on the floor for a while , for [she]108-birdalone loathed the hour that was to come . Then the life stirred in [her]108-birdalone , and whereas [she]108-birdalone would not that [[her]108-birdalone women]4897-her women should find [her]108-birdalone [there]215-there , [she]108-birdalone stood up , and clad [herself]108-birdalone somewhat more seemly ; yet [she]108-birdalone did on [her]108-birdalone black raiment ; and determined in [her]108-birdalone mind that nought would [she]108-birdalone wear save black unadorned while [[her]108-birdalone friends]1305-her friends were away . [She]108-birdalone betook [her]108-birdalone now to [the chamber where [[her]108-birdalone women]4897-her women were gathered together]4900-the chamber where her women were gathered together , and watched [them]4897-her women working a while , but spake nought . Then [she]108-birdalone went [her]108-birdalone ways into the pleasance , and paced [the plashed alley]4767-the plashed alley up and down , letting the tears run down from [her]108-birdalone as they would . Then [she]108-birdalone turned back into [the castle]1534-the castle , and went out - a - gates and walked over [the meadow]499-the meadow a little , and might well have gone further than wisdom would . But [the castellan]1691-the castellan espied [her]108-birdalone from a window , and came hurrying out after [her]108-birdalone , and with many prayers for pardon , brought [her]108-birdalone back again , babbling to [her]108-birdalone by the way ; but not a word might [he]1691-the castellan get from [her]108-birdalone ; and when [he]1691-the castellan came into [the hall]1193-the hall with [her]108-birdalone , and , after [his]1691-the castellan wo nt , knelt down to kiss [her]108-birdalone hands , [she]108-birdalone caught them away from [him]1691-the castellan peevishly , and was sorry for it thereafter . Long [she]108-birdalone sat in [the hall]1193-the hall , scarce moving , till [she]108-birdalone heard [one entering from the screen]4908-one entering from the screen , and lo it was [Leonard]130-leonard [the chaplain]1985-the chaplain . [He]1691-the castellan came [her]108-birdalone way , and showed [her]108-birdalone rueful countenance ; and pity of [him]1691-the castellan smote [her]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone remembered therewith how [they]4910-they first went out of gates together ; and at the thought thereof [her]108-birdalone tears brake forth again , but [she]108-birdalone made [him]1691-the castellan a sign with [her]108-birdalone hand to sit down beside [her]108-birdalone , and [he]1691-the castellan did so ; and when [she]108-birdalone might for [her]108-birdalone weeping , [she]108-birdalone looked kindly on [him]1691-the castellan , and [he]1691-the castellan fell to talk , making as if [he]1691-the castellan noted not [her]108-birdalone tears and sorrow ; but [she]108-birdalone answered [him]1691-the castellan little , for [she]108-birdalone had shame to begin the talk concerning [the Champions]1928-the champions and [their]1928-the champions Quest , and [their]1928-the champions departure ; yet might [she]108-birdalone not bring [her]108-birdalone tongue to make any speech else . But presently [he]1691-the castellan took up the word , and asked [her]108-birdalone how long a while [she]108-birdalone deemed [they]1928-the champions would be away , and [she]108-birdalone answered , smiling on [him]1691-the castellan for thanks , and having reckoned the days on [her]108-birdalone fingers : If all go better than well , [they]1928-the champions may be back in ten days â€™[1985-the chaplain] time . Said [the chaplain]1985-the chaplain : There be longer whiles of waiting in [most men]1998-most men â€™s lives . [Yea]1999-yea , [she]1985-the chaplain said , but this is the delay at the best ; it may be far longer ; for how may [we]2000-we tell what [haps]2001-haps may be ? [Yea]1999-yea , said [Leonard]130-leonard , shall [we]2000-we then call it twenty days , or thirty ? Forsooth , that may be long for [thee]2002-thee ; though there be [some who must needs endure hope]2003-some who must needs endure hope deferred a deal longer . But it may run out longer than even thirty days , [thy]2002-thee waiting - tide . [She]1985-the chaplain answered not , and [he]130-leonard said : Whenso the time hangs heavy on hand with [thee]2002-thee , if [thou]2002-thee hast will to fare abroad out of [the castle]1534-the castle , [I]0-i shall be ever at hand to guide [thee]2002-thee . Indeed , [I]0-i wot that [the castellan]1691-the castellan will be loth to let [thee]2002-thee go ; but [he]1691-the castellan is old and straitlaced : and yet withal [he]1691-the castellan wotteth , as do [we]2000-we all , that there is now little peril or none were [we]2000-we to fare a five miles or more , whereas [we]2000-we are as good as at peace for the last five days with all save [the Red Knight]135-the red knight , and of [him]1691-the castellan [we]2000-we wot that [he]1691-the castellan is gone into another land with as many of [[his]1691-the castellan folk]1328-his folk as be not needed for the warding of [his]1691-the castellan hold . [I]0-i thank [thee]2007-thee , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , but it is like to be [my]0-i will not to fare out - a - gates till [the Champions]1928-the champions come back [home]373-home . [I]0-i was glad eâ€™en now when [the castellan]1691-the castellan fetched [me]0-i in again : to say sooth , fear of peril had just entered [my]0-i heart when [he]1691-the castellan came up with [me]0-i . [The priest]1677-the priest seemed somewhat chapfallen at [her]108-birdalone answer . [He]1677-the priest spake little more , and presently [he]1677-the priest stood up , made [his]1677-the priest obeisance , and departed . Chapter II ~ [Birdalone]108-birdalone Learneth Lore of [the Priest]1677-the priest . Ten Days of [Waiting Wear Wore]137-waiting wear wore that day and the next , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone fell to talking with [[her]108-birdalone women]4897-her women , whereof were five now left ; and [four of [them]4897-her women]2014-four of them were young , [the eldest scarce of thirty summers]2015-the eldest scarce of thirty summers , and [the fifth]2016-the fifth was [a woman of sixty , both wise and kind]2017-a woman of sixty , both wise and kind . All these told [her]108-birdalone somewhat of [their]4897-her women own lives when [she]108-birdalone asked [them]4897-her women ; and [some withal]2018-some withal told of [folk whom [they]4897-her women had known or heard tell of]2019-folk whom they had known or heard tell of . And well pleased was [Birdalone]108-birdalone to hear thereof , and learn more of the ways of [the world]417-the world , and quick - witted [she]108-birdalone was at the lesson , so that [she]108-birdalone needed not to ask many questions . Furthermore , [she]108-birdalone took to [her]108-birdalone broidering again , and fell to doing a goodly pair of shoon for [Atra]109-atra , since [she]108-birdalone had worn those borrowed ones somewhat hardly . And [the women]1990-the women wondered at [her]108-birdalone needlework , so marvellous fine as it was , and how that in little space of time were come flowers and trees , and birds and beasts , all lovely ; and [they]1990-the women said that [the faery]4682-the faery must have learned [her]108-birdalone that craft . But [she]108-birdalone laughed and reddened , and thought of [the wood - mother]925-the wood - mother ; and , sitting there within the four walls , [she]108-birdalone longed for [the oak - glades]2024-the oak - glades , and the wood - lawns , and for the sight of the beasts that dwelt therein . Again [she]108-birdalone fell in with [Leonard]130-leonard [the priest]1677-the priest , and [he]130-leonard asked [her]108-birdalone could [she]108-birdalone read in a book , and when [she]108-birdalone said nay , [he]130-leonard offered to teach [her]108-birdalone that lore , and [she]108-birdalone yeasaid that joyously ; and thenceforth would [she]108-birdalone have [him]130-leonard with [her]108-birdalone every day a good while ; and [an apt scholar]2026-an apt scholar [she]108-birdalone was , and [he]130-leonard no ill master , and [she]108-birdalone learned [her]108-birdalone A B C speedily . Now it was the ninth day since [the Champions]1928-the champions were gone , and all that time [she]108-birdalone had not been out - a - gates ; and after the first two days , had enforced [herself]108-birdalone to fill up [her]108-birdalone time with [her]108-birdalone work as aforesaid : but this last day [she]108-birdalone might do but little , for [she]108-birdalone could not but take it for sure that the morrow would be the day of return ; nay , even [she]108-birdalone deemed that [they]2028-they might come in the night - tide ; so that when [she]108-birdalone went to bed , though [she]108-birdalone was weary , [she]108-birdalone would wake if [she]108-birdalone might , so that it was nigh dawn ere [she]108-birdalone fell asleep . Some three hours after [she]108-birdalone woke up , and heard a sound of [folk]4521-folk stirring in [the house]311-the house , and the clashing of weapons ; and the heart leapt in [her]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone said : [They]2028-they are come , [they]2028-they are come ! Nevertheless [she]108-birdalone durst not get out of bed , lest [her]108-birdalone hope had beguiled [her]108-birdalone ; and [she]108-birdalone lay awake another hour , and no tidings came to [her]108-birdalone ; and then [she]108-birdalone wept [herself]108-birdalone to sleep ; and when [she]108-birdalone awoke once more , [she]108-birdalone found that [she]108-birdalone must have wept sleeping , for the pillow beside [her]108-birdalone face was all wet with the tears . The sun was high now , and [his]2031-his beams were cast back from the ripple of [the lake]355-the lake , and shone wavering on the wall of [the chamber]292-the chamber , the window whereof gave on to the water . Then came a hand on the latch of the door , and [she]108-birdalone started , and [her]108-birdalone heart grieved [her]108-birdalone ; but it was one of [the women who opened , and came in]2034-the women who opened , and came in , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone rose up sitting in [her]108-birdalone bed , and said faintly , for [she]108-birdalone could scarce speak : Is any tiding toward , [Catherine]138-catherine ? [The maid]589-the maid said : Yes , [[my]0-i lady]603-my lady ; for early after sunrise came [weaponed men]1799-weaponed men to the gate , and would sell [us]2038-us beeves ; and [[my]0-i lord]2039-my lord , [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , must needs go forth and chaffer with [them]1799-weaponed men , though belike [they]1799-weaponed men had been lifting what was neither [ours]2038-us , nor [theirs]2038-us , nor [the neighbours]2040-the neighbours â€™ . Maybe [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris looked to buy tidings from [them]1799-weaponed men as well as [beef]4912-beef . Anyhow [they]1799-weaponed men departed when [they]1799-weaponed men had gotten [their]1799-weaponed men money and drunk a cup . And now it is said that [the Red Knight]4913-the red knight hath been hurt in some fray , and keepeth [his]4913-the red knight bed ; wherefore [the land]198-the land shall have peace of [him]4913-the red knight awhile . Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : [I]0-i thank [thee]108-birdalone , [good Catherine]138-catherine ; [I]0-i shall lie a little longer ; depart now . [The woman]237-the woman went [her]237-the woman ways ; and when [she]237-the woman was gone , [Birdalone]108-birdalone wept and sobbed , and writhed upon [her]108-birdalone bed , and found no solace to [her]108-birdalone grief . But [she]237-the woman arose and paced [the chamber]292-the chamber , and sithence looked out of the window over [the empty water]4917-the empty water , and wept again . Then [she]237-the woman said : Yet [they]4918-they may come ere noon , or it may be ere evening , or perchance tomorrow morning . And [she]237-the woman stayed [her]237-the woman weeping , and was calmer . But still [she]237-the woman walked the floor , and whiles looked out of window , and whiles [she]237-the woman looked on [her]237-the woman limbs , and felt the sleekness of [her]237-the woman sides , and [she]237-the woman said : O [my]0-i body ! how [thou]4919-thou longest ! But at last [she]237-the woman clad [herself]237-the woman in haste , and went stealthily from [the chamber]292-the chamber , as if [she]237-the woman feared to meet [anyone]4921-anyone ; and [she]237-the woman stole up to the tower - top that was nighest , and looked through the door on to the leads , and saw [no one there]4922-no one there ; so [she]237-the woman went out , and stood by the battlement , and gazed long over [the water]347-the water , but saw [neither boat]4924-neither boat nor burning mountain coming towards [her]237-the woman . Chapter III ~ Now Would [Birdalone]108-birdalone Ride Abroad After a while [she]108-birdalone came down again , and went to [the women]1990-the women , and sat working with [them]1990-the women a while , and so wore away two hours . Then [she]237-the woman sent for [the priest]1677-the priest and had [her]237-the woman lesson of [him]1677-the priest ; and when [she]237-the woman had been at it another two hours , [she]237-the woman bade [him]1677-the priest begin and learn [her]237-the woman writing ; and nought loth [he]1677-the priest was thereto ; forsooth [he]1677-the priest had been longing to pray [her]237-the woman to suffer [him]1677-the priest learn [her]237-the woman , but durst not . For in such teaching needs must [he]1677-the priest sit full nigh to [her]237-the woman , and watch [her]237-the woman hands , and [her]237-the woman fingers striving to shape the letters ; nay , whiles must [he]1677-the priest touch [her]237-the woman hand with [his]1677-the priest , and hold it . Wherefore now [he]1677-the priest promised [himself]1677-the priest a taste of Paradise . Withal [he]1677-the priest was full meet to learn [her]237-the woman , whereas [he]1677-the priest was [one of the best of [scribes]4928-scribes]4927-one of the best of scribes , and [a fair - writer full handy]4929-a fair - writer full handy . So [they]4930-they fell to the lesson , and [she]237-the woman became eager thereover , and learned fast , and clave to the work , while [his]1677-the priest soul was tormented with longing for [her]237-the woman . And thus wore a three hours , and then suddenly [she]237-the woman looked up wearily from [her]237-the woman work , and [her]237-the woman trouble was awake , and the longing for [[her]237-the woman speech - friend]4931-her speech - friend , and [she]237-the woman gave [the priest]1677-the priest leave for that day , but suffered [him]1677-the priest to kiss [her]237-the woman hand for wages . Then [she]237-the woman hurried up to the tower - top , when the afternoon was wearing into evening ; and abode there a long while looking over [the waters]624-the waters , till it began to dusk , and then came down miserably and went to [[her]237-the woman women]4897-her women . The next day was like unto this ; nought betid , and [she]237-the woman wore the hours whiles going up to the tower - top and looking over [the lake]355-the lake , whiles broidering amidst [[her]237-the woman maids]4936-her maids , whiles learning [[her]237-the woman clerk]4937-her clerk â€™s work with [Sir Leonard]139-birdalone , but ever eating [her]237-the woman heart out with [her]237-the woman longing . On the third of these days [she]237-the woman called [the castellan]1691-the castellan to [her]237-the woman for a talk , and asked [him]1691-the castellan what [he]1691-the castellan thought of it , this delay of [[his]1691-the castellan lords]4939-his lords â€™[0-i] return . Quoth the greyhead : [[My]0-i lady]603-my lady , [we]2042-we may not wonder if [they]2043-they be tarried for a few days ; for this is an adventure on which [they]2043-they have gone , and many haps betide in such tales . Now [I]0-i beseech [thee]603-my lady torment not [thyself]2044-thyself ; for the time is not yet come for [thee]603-my lady even to doubt that [they]2043-they have miscarried . [His]2045-him words solaced [her]603-my lady much for that time , whereas [she]603-my lady saw that [he]2045-him spake but the sooth ; so [she]603-my lady thanked [him]2045-him , and smiled upon [him]2045-him kindly ; and [he]2045-him was ravished thereat , and was for kneeling before [her]603-my lady at once and kissing [her]603-my lady hands after [his]2045-him wo nt ; but [she]603-my lady smiled again and refrained [him]2045-him , and said : Nay , not yet , [fair friend]535-fair friend ; that is for the departure , and [I]0-i have yet a word to say unto [thee]603-my lady : to wit , that [I]0-i long to go out - a - gates , and it will solace [me]0-i and give [me]0-i patience to abide the coming of [[my]0-i friends]1795-my friends . For [thou]2048-thou must know , [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , that [I]0-i was reared amidst [the woods]450-the woods and [the meadows]1769-the meadows , with the burning of the sun , and the buffets of the wind ; and now for lack of some deal of that am [I]0-i waxing white and faint . And [thou]2048-thou wouldst not have [me]0-i falling sick on thine hands now , wouldst [thou]2048-thou ? Nay , surely , [lady]493-lady , said [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris ; this very day [I]0-i will ride out with [thee]493-lady ; and [two score or more of weaponed men]2052-two score or more of weaponed men shall ride with [us]2053-us for fear of mishaps . Said [Birdalone]139-birdalone , knitting [her]493-lady brows : Nay , [knight]2054-knight , [I]0-i need not [[thy]2054-knight men]2055-thy men - at - arms ; [I]0-i would fain go free and alone . For hast [thou]2048-thou not heard how that [the Red Knight]4913-the red knight is hurt and keepeth [his]4913-the red knight bed ? So what peril is there ? Said [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris : [Yea]2057-yea , [lady]493-lady ; but [the Red Knight]4913-the red knight is not the only foe , though [he]4913-the red knight be the worst : but it may well be that the story is but feigned , for [the said enemy]2060-the said enemy hath many wiles . And look [you]493-lady , [kind lady]2061-kind lady , it is most like that by now [he]4913-the red knight hath heard how in [[my]0-i poor castle]2062-my poor castle is kept a jewel , a pearl of great price , that hath not its like in [the world]417-the world , and will encompass the stealing of it if [he]4913-the red knight may . Laughed [Birdalone]139-birdalone , and said : But how if the said jewel hath a will , and legs and feet thereto , and is ready to take the peril on [her]493-lady , and will wend out - a - gates if [she]493-lady will ? What wilt [thou]2048-thou do then , [lord]2064-lord ? Then , said [the castellan]1691-the castellan , [I]0-i shall fetch [thee]493-lady back , and , though it be a grief to [me]0-i , shall have [thee]493-lady borne back perforce if nought else may do . For so the oath sworn to [[my]0-i lords]1728-my lords compelleth [me]0-i . Again laughed [Birdalone]139-birdalone , and said : Hearken , whereto cometh all this kneeling and hand - kissing ! But bear in mind , [fair lord]2067-fair lord , how once on a time [thou]2048-thou wouldst have [me]0-i out - a - gates , would [I]0-i , would [I]0-i not , and now , will [I]0-i , will [I]0-i not , [thou]2048-thou wouldst keep [me]0-i within ; so have times changed , and mayhappen [they]2068-they may change yet again . But tell [me]0-i , am [I]0-i mistress over [[my]0-i women]2069-my women to bid [them]2069-my women what [I]0-i will ? [Certes]140-certes , said [he]140-certes , and over [all of [us]2070-all of us]2070-all of us . Said [she]2071-thee : If then [I]0-i bade [them]2069-my women , [some two or three]2072-some two or three , come with [me]0-i into [the meadows]1769-the meadows and woods a half day â€™s journey for [our]2070-all of us disport , how then ? For that once , said [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , [I]0-i should bid [them]2069-my women disobey [[their]2069-my women lady]4584-their lady . Said [Birdalone]139-birdalone : And how if [they]2069-my women disobeyed [thee]2071-thee , and obeyed [me]0-i ? Quoth [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris : If [they]2069-my women bring [thee]2071-thee back safe , [they]2069-my women may chance to sing to the twiggen fiddle - bow , that [they]2069-my women may be warned from such folly ; but if [they]2069-my women come back without [thee]2071-thee , by All - hallows the wind of wrath shall sweep [their]2069-my women heads off [them]2069-my women ! [Birdalone]139-birdalone flushed red at [his]139-birdalone word , and was silent a while ; then [she]0-i said , making cheerful countenance again : [Thou]139-birdalone art [a hard master]2075-a hard master , [lord castellan]2076-lord castellan ; but [I]0-i must needs obey [thee]2076-lord castellan . Therefore [I]0-i will take [thy]2076-lord castellan bidding , and ride abroad in such wise that [I]0-i shall scare [the land]198-the land with an army , since [no otherwise]2078-no otherwise may [I]0-i look on [the summer land]2079-the summer land . But today [I]0-i will not go , nor tomorrow belike ; but some day soon . And in good sooth [I]0-i thank [thee]2076-lord castellan for [thy]2076-lord castellan heedful care of [me]0-i , and wish [I]0-i were better worth it . Nay , nay , [thou]2076-lord castellan shalt not kneel to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i to [thee]2076-lord castellan : for [thou]2076-lord castellan art verily [the master]2080-the master . Therewith [she]0-i rose from beside [him]2076-lord castellan , and knelt down before [him]2076-lord castellan and took [his]2076-lord castellan hand and kissed it , and went [her]0-i ways , leaving [him]2076-lord castellan ravished with love of [her]0-i . But now [she]0-i had no scorn of [him]2076-lord castellan , but deemed , as was true , that [he]2076-lord castellan was both valiant and trusty and kind , and [she]0-i thanked [him]2076-lord castellan in [her]0-i heart as well as in words . Chapter IV ~ Of [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s Faring Abroad Indeed [Birdalone]139-birdalone longed on any terms to be out - a - gates and to have some joy of the summer ; for now [she]0-i began to see that [she]0-i might have to abide some while ere [[her]0-i friends]1305-her friends should come to [her]0-i in [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest ; and [she]0-i was angry with [herself]0-i that [her]0-i longing was thus wasting [her]0-i , and [she]0-i rebuked [herself]0-i and said : Where is now [that Birdalone who let but few days go by without some joyance of]2083-that birdalone who let but few days go by without some joyance of [the earth]432-the earth and its creatures ? [she]2083-that birdalone who let but few days go by without some joyance of who bore [lightly the toil of a thrall , and gibes and mocking and stripes]2085-lightly the toil of a thrall , and gibes and mocking and stripes ? Surely this is grievous folly , that [I]0-i should be worsened since [I]0-i have come to be [the friend of [gentle ladies]2087-gentle ladies]2086-the friend of gentle ladies , and [noble champions]2088-noble champions , and [mighty warriors]2089-mighty warriors . Had it not been better to have abided under [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife â€™s hand ? For not every day nor most days did [she]336-the witch - wife torment [me]0-i . But now for many days there has been pain and grief and heart - sickness hour by hour ; and every hour have [I]0-i dreaded the coming of the next hour , till [I]0-i know not how to bear it . So [she]336-the witch - wife strove with [herself]336-the witch - wife , and became of better heart , and set [herself]336-the witch - wife strongly to the learning of the clerkly lore ; [she]336-the witch - wife gathered [her]336-the witch - wife wits together , and no longer looked for every day and every hour to bring about the return of [the Champions]1928-the champions , nor blamed the day and the hour because [they]2092-they failed therein , and in all wise [she]336-the witch - wife strove to get through the day unworn by vain longing . Wherefore , on a day when three whole weeks were gone since the day of departure , [she]336-the witch - wife was glad when [the castellan]1691-the castellan came to [her]336-the witch - wife and said : [Lady]493-lady , these two days [I]0-i have had [men]204-men out to spy [the land]198-the land , and [their]204-men word goes that nought is stirring which a score of [us]2097-they well - armed might have cause to fear ; wherefore tomorrow , if it be [thy]0-i will , [we]2097-they shall bring [thee]0-i out - a - gates , and so please [thee]0-i , shall be in no haste to come back , but may lie out in [the wildwood]512-the wildwood one night , and come back at [our]2097-they leisure on the morrow of tomorrow . How sayest [thou]0-i of [thy]0-i pleasure herein ? [She]336-the witch - wife thanked [him]1691-the castellan , and yeasaid it eagerly , and next morning [they]2097-they set forth ; and [Birdalone]139-birdalone had with [[her]336-the witch - wife three of [the women]1990-the women]2099-her three of the women , and [they]2097-they had sumpter - beasts with [them]2097-they , and tents for [Birdalone]139-birdalone and [[her]336-the witch - wife maids]4936-her maids . So [they]2097-they rode by pleasant ways and [fair meadows]2102-fair meadows , and the weather was good , for it was now the first days of July , and all was as lovely as might be ; and for that while [Birdalone]139-birdalone cast off all [her]336-the witch - wife cares , and was merry , and of many words and sweet ; and [all the folk]2103-all the folk rejoiced thereat , for [all]881-all loved [her]336-the witch - wife in [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , besides those one or two that loved [her]336-the witch - wife overmuch . Rode [they]2097-they thus a twelve miles or more , and then [they]2097-they came , as [their]2097-they purpose was , to the beginning of [a woodland plenteous of venison]2106-a woodland plenteous of venison , and [they]2097-they hunted [here]244-here , and [Birdalone]139-birdalone took [her]336-the witch - wife part therein , and [all]881-all praised [her]336-the witch - wife woodcraft ; albeit because of [her]336-the witch - wife went a head or two free that had fallen else , whereas of [the carle hunters]2109-the carle hunters were some who deemed the body of [her]336-the witch - wife better worth looking on than the quarry . Howsoever , [they]2097-they slew of hind and roe and other wood - cattle what [they]2097-they would , some deal for [their]2097-they supper in [the wilderness]2110-the wilderness , some to bear [home]373-home to [the castle]1534-the castle . But when night was nigh at hand [they]2097-they made stay in a fair wood - lawn about which ran a clear stream , whereby [they]2097-they pitched [[the ladies]1877-the ladies â€™ tent]4940-the ladies â€™ tent ; and [Birdalone]139-birdalone and [hers]139-birdalone went down into [the water]347-the water and washed the weariness off [them]2097-they ; and [[her]336-the witch - wife ladies]4942-her ladies wondered at the deftness of [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s swimming ; for [they]2097-they bathed in a pool somewhat great into which [the stream]1777-the stream widened , so that there was space enough for [her]336-the witch - wife therein . By then [they]2097-they were washen and clad goodly in raiment which [they]2097-they had brought on the sumpters , [the men]4811-the men had lighted fires and were cooking the venison , and anon there was supper and banquet in the wildwood , with drinking of wine and pleasant talk and the telling of tales and singing of minstrelsy ; and so at last , when night was well worn , and out in the open meadows the eastern sky was waxing grey , then [Birdalone]139-birdalone and [[her]336-the witch - wife ladies]4942-her ladies went to bed in [[their]2097-they fair tents]4946-their fair tents , and [the men - at - arms]4947-the men - at - arms lay down on [the greensward under the bare heaven]4948-the greensward under the bare heaven . Chapter V ~ Sir Aymeris Showeth [Birdalone]108-birdalone the Mountains Afar Off When it was morning and [they]2097-they arose , the day was as fair as yesterday , and [folk]4521-folk were even as joyous as [they]4521-folk had been then , all but [Birdalone]139-birdalone , and [she]336-the witch - wife was silent and downcast , even when [she]336-the witch - wife came forth from the fresh water into the sweetness of the midsummer wood . [She]336-the witch - wife had dreamed in the night that [she]336-the witch - wife was all alone in [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and that [[her]336-the witch - wife old mistress]4951-her old mistress came to [her]336-the witch - wife from out of the Sending Boat to fetch [her]336-the witch - wife away , and brought [her]336-the witch - wife aboard , and stripped [her]336-the witch - wife of [her]336-the witch - wife rich garments and sat facing [her]336-the witch - wife , drawing ugsome grimaces at [her]336-the witch - wife ; and [she]336-the witch - wife thought [she]336-the witch - wife knew that [[her]336-the witch - wife friends]1305-her friends were all dead and gone , and [she]336-the witch - wife had none to pity or defend [her]336-the witch - wife . Then somehow were [they]1305-her friends two , [the witch]394-the witch and [she]336-the witch - wife , amidmost of [the Isle of Nothing]32-the isle of nothing , and [the witch]394-the witch drew close anigh [her]336-the witch - wife , and was just going to whisper into [her]336-the witch - wife ear something of measureless horror , when [she]336-the witch - wife awoke ; and the sun was bright outside the shaded whiteness of [[her]336-the witch - wife tent]4955-her tent ; the shadows of the leaves were dancing on the ground of it ; the morning wind was rustling the tree - boughs , and the ripple of [the stream]1777-the stream was tinkling hard by . At first was [Birdalone]139-birdalone joyous that what [she]336-the witch - wife had awakened from was but a dream ; but presently [she]336-the witch - wife felt the burden of [her]336-the witch - wife longing , and [she]336-the witch - wife said to [herself]336-the witch - wife that when [they]1305-her friends came back to [the castle]1534-the castle [they]1305-her friends should find tidings , and that [she]336-the witch - wife should know either that [[her]336-the witch - wife friends]1305-her friends were indeed dead , or that [they]1305-her friends were come back again alive and well . And then [she]336-the witch - wife thought within [herself]336-the witch - wife , suppose [the three Champions]1929-the three champions and [their]1929-the three champions loves were dead and gone , how would [she]336-the witch - wife do with those that were left [her]336-the witch - wife , as [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , and [Leonard the priest]4960-leonard the priest , and [[her]336-the witch - wife women]4897-her women ? and [her]336-the witch - wife soul turned with loathing from a life so empty as that would be ; and yet [she]336-the witch - wife blamed [herself]336-the witch - wife that [she]336-the witch - wife was so little friendly to [these lesser friends]4962-these lesser friends , whom forsooth [she]336-the witch - wife loved because of [her]336-the witch - wife love for [the greater ones]4963-the greater ones . So , as abovesaid , [she]336-the witch - wife was troubled and silent amongst the joy of the others . That saw [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris [the castellan]1691-the castellan ; and when [they]4965-they had broken fast and were getting to horse , [he]1691-the castellan came to [her]336-the witch - wife and said : [Lady]493-lady , the day is yet young , and if [we]4965-they fetch a compass by a way that [I]1877-the ladies wot of [we]4965-they shall see places new to [thee]336-the witch - wife , and mayhappen somewhat wonderful , and yet come [home]373-home timely to [the castle]1534-the castle . Wilt [thou]336-the witch - wife ? [Birdalone]139-birdalone was still somewhat distraught , but [she]336-the witch - wife knew not how to naysay [him]1691-the castellan , though at heart [she]336-the witch - wife would liefer have gone back to [the castle]1534-the castle by the shortest way . [So folk]4970-so folk brought [her]336-the witch - wife [her]336-the witch - wife palfrey , and [they]4965-they rode [their]4965-they ways , [the castellan]1691-the castellan ever by [her]336-the witch - wife side . And by fair ways indeed [they]4965-they went , and so joyous was all about [them]4965-they , that little by little [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s gladness came back to [her]336-the witch - wife , and [she]336-the witch - wife made the most of it to be as merry of seeming as [she]336-the witch - wife might be . Now [they]4965-they rode fair and softly by thicket and copse and glade of [the woodland]657-the woodland , following up the stream aforesaid for the more part , till at last the trees failed [them]4965-they suddenly , and [they]4965-they came forth on to [a wide green plain]4973-a wide green plain , all unbuilded , so far as [their]4965-they eyes could see , and beyond it the ridges of [the hills]4974-the hills and blue mountains rising high beyond [them]4965-they . When [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s eyes beheld this new thing , of a sudden all care left [her]336-the witch - wife , and [she]336-the witch - wife dropped [her]336-the witch - wife rein , and smote [her]336-the witch - wife palms together , and cried out : Oh ! but [thou]4975-thou art beautiful , [O earth]4976-o earth , [thou]4975-thou art beautiful ! Then [she]336-the witch - wife sat gazing on it , while [the greyhead]4977-the greyhead turned and smiled on [her]336-the witch - wife , well pleased of [her]336-the witch - wife pleasure . After a while [she]336-the witch - wife said : And might [we]4965-they go nigher ? Yea , [certes]140-certes , said [he]140-certes , yet [I]1877-the ladies doubt if [thou]4975-thou wilt like it the better , the nigher [thou]4975-thou art . Ah ! [she]336-the witch - wife said , but if [I]1877-the ladies were only amidst it , and a part of it , as once [I]1877-the ladies was of [the woodland]657-the woodland ! So thitherward [they]4965-they rode over [the unharvested mead]4979-the unharvested mead , and saw [hart]141-hart and hind thereon , and wild kine , and of smaller deer great plenty , but of tame beasts none ; and [the hills]4974-the hills were before [them]4965-they like a wall . But as [they]4965-they drew nigher , [they]4965-they saw where the said wall of [the hills]4974-the hills was cloven by [a valley narrow and steep - sided]4982-a valley narrow and steep - sided , that went right athwart [the lie of the hills]4983-the lie of the hills ; [the said valley]4984-the said valley was but little grassed , and the bare rocks were crow - black . When [they]4965-they had gone a little further , [they]4965-they could see that [the ground near the foot of [the hills]4974-the hills]4985-the ground near the foot of the hills rose in [little knolls]4987-little knolls and ridges , but these were lower and fewer about the entry into [that valley]4988-that valley . Also presently [they]4965-they came upon [a stream which ran out of [the said valley]4984-the said valley]4989-a stream which ran out of the said valley , and [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris said that this was the water whereby [they]4965-they had lain last night ; albeit here it was little indeed . Now when [they]4965-they had ridden some five miles over [the plain]4991-the plain , [they]4965-they came amongst [those knolls]4992-those knolls at [the mouth of [the valley]4994-the valley]4993-the mouth of the valley , and [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris led [Birdalone]139-birdalone up to the top of one of [the highest of [them]4974-the hills]4995-the highest of them , and thence [they]4965-they could look into [that dale]4996-that dale and see how [it]4996-that dale winded away up toward [the mountains]200-the mountains , like to [a dismal street]4998-a dismal street ; for not only was [it]4996-that dale but little grassed , but withal there was neither tree nor bush therein . Moreover , scattered all about the bottom of [the dale]4999-the dale were great stones , which looked as if [they]4965-they had once been set in some kind of order ; and that the more whereas they were not black like the rocks of [the dale]4999-the dale - side , but pale grey of hue , so that they looked even as huge sheep of the giants feeding down [the dale]4999-the dale . Then spake [Birdalone]139-birdalone : Verily , [sir knight]5002-sir knight , [thou]5002-sir knight saidst but sooth that [I]1877-the ladies should see things new and strange . But shall [we]4965-they go a little way into [this valley]5003-this valley today ? Nay , [lady]493-lady , said [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris , nor tomorrow , nor any day uncompelled ; neither shall [we]4965-they go nigher unto it than now [we]4965-they be . Wherefore not ? said [Birdalone]139-birdalone , for meseemeth it is as the gate of [the mountains]200-the mountains ; and fain were [I]1877-the ladies in [the mountains]200-the mountains . [Lady]5007-lady , said [the castellan]1691-the castellan , overmuch perilous it were to ride [the valley]4994-the valley , which , as [thou]5002-sir knight sayest , is the very gate of [the mountains]200-the mountains . For [the said dale]5011-the said dale , which hight [the Black Valley of]5012-the black valley of [the Greywethers]142-the greywethers , hath a bad name for the haunting of unmanlike wights , against which even [[our]4965-they men]1370-our men - at - arms might make no defence . And if any might escape [them]5014-them , and win through the gates and up into [the mountains]200-the mountains , [I]1877-the ladies wot not if suchlike devils and things unkent be there in [the mountain - land]5016-the mountain - land , but of a sooth there be [fierce and wild men]5017-fierce and wild men , like enough to devils , who know no peace , and slay whatsoever cometh unto [them]5014-them , but if [they]5014-them [themselves]5014-them be slain of [them]5014-them . Well , said [Birdalone]139-birdalone , then today , at least , [we]4965-they go not into [the dale]4999-the dale ; but knowest [thou]5002-sir knight any tales of [these wild places]5019-these wild places ? Many have [I]1877-the ladies heard , said [he]1877-the ladies , but [I]1877-the ladies am [an ill minstrel]5020-an ill minstrel and should spoil [them]5014-them in the telling . Ask [them]5014-them of [Sir Leonard [[our]4965-they priest]5022-our priest]5021-sir leonard our priest , [he]5021-sir leonard our priest knoweth of [them]5014-them better than [others]4825-others , and hath a tongue duly shapen for telling [them]5014-them . [Birdalone]139-birdalone answered nought thereto ; [she]1877-the ladies but turned [her]1877-the ladies horse â€™s head and rode down [the knoll]5024-the knoll ; and so [they]5014-them came unto [[their]5014-them company]5025-their company , and all went [their]5014-them ways toward [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest . Nought befell [them]5014-them on [their]5014-them way [home]373-home ; but the nigher [they]5014-them came to [the castle]1534-the castle the more pensive waxed [Birdalone]139-birdalone , and , though [she]1877-the ladies hid it , when [they]5014-them were come to the gate [she]1877-the ladies scarce had [her]1877-the ladies wit ; for it was as if [she]1877-the ladies thought to have one rushing out and crying : Tidings , tidings ! [they]5014-them are come . Nowise it so befell ; [they]5014-them were no more come than was the Day of Doom . And a little after [they]5014-them were within gates ; it was night , and [Birdalone]139-birdalone crept wearily up to [[her]1877-the ladies chamber]4893-her chamber , and gat to bed , and so tired was [she]1877-the ladies that [she]1877-the ladies fell asleep at once and dreamed not . Chapter VI ~ [Birdalone]139-birdalone Heareth Tell Tales of [the Black Valley]33-the black valley of [the Greywethers]142-the greywethers On the morrow was [Birdalone]139-birdalone heavier of heart than ever yet , and wearier for tidings ; and [she]2114-she wondered how [she]2114-she could have been so joyous that day in [the wildwood]512-the wildwood . Yet [she]2114-she thought much of [the Valley of the Greywethers]35-the valley of the greywethers , and that solaced [her]2114-she somewhat after a while , so sore [she]2114-she longed to go thither ; and , as â€™[1877-the ladies] tis said , one nail knocks out the other . So that morning , when [she]2114-she had had [her]2114-she lesson of [priest Leonard]139-birdalone , [she]2114-she spake thereof to [him]139-birdalone , and told [him]139-birdalone what [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris had said concerning [his]139-birdalone knowledge thereof ; and [she]2114-she asked [him]139-birdalone what [he]139-birdalone knew . [I]0-i have been there , said [he]139-birdalone . [She]2114-she started at that word and said : Did aught of evil befall [thee]139-birdalone ? Nay , said [he]139-birdalone , but a great fear and dread hung about [me]0-i ; and â€™ tis said that [they]5031-their try [their]5031-their luck overmuch who go thither twice . [Birdalone]139-birdalone said : Tell [me]2115-i now of the tales that be told of [that valley]4988-that valley . Quoth [Leonard]139-birdalone : [They]5031-their be many ; but the main of them is this : that [those Greywethers]5033-those greywethers be [giants of yore agone]5034-giants of yore agone , or landwights , carles , and queans , who have been turned into stone by [I]2115-i wot not what deed ; but that whiles [they]5033-those greywethers come alive again , and can walk and talk as erst [they]5033-those greywethers did ; and that if [any man]4683-any man may be so bold as to abide the time of [their]5031-their awakening , and in the first moment of [their]5031-their change may frame words that crave the fulfilment of [his]139-birdalone desire , and if therewith [he]139-birdalone be both wise and constant , then shall [he]139-birdalone have [his]139-birdalone desire fulfilled of [these wights]5036-these wights , and bear [his]139-birdalone life back again from out [the dale]4999-the dale . And thus must [he]139-birdalone speak and no otherwise : [O Earth]36-o earth , [thou]5038-thou and [[thy]5038-thou first children]5039-thy first children , [I]2115-i crave of [you]5039-thy first children such and such a thing , whatsoever it may be . And if [he]139-birdalone speak more than this , then is [he]139-birdalone undone . [He]139-birdalone shall answer no question of [them]5036-these wights ; and if [they]5036-these wights threaten [him]139-birdalone [he]139-birdalone shall not pray [them]5036-these wights mercy , nor quail before [their]5036-these wights uplifted weapons ; nor , to be short , shall [he]139-birdalone heed them more than if [they]5036-these wights still were stones unchanged . Moreover , when [he]139-birdalone hath said [his]139-birdalone say , then shall [these wights]5036-these wights throng about [him]139-birdalone and offer [him]139-birdalone gold and gems , and all the wealth of [the earth]432-the earth ; and if that be not enough , [they]5036-these wights shall bring [him]139-birdalone the goodliest of [women]420-women , with nought lacking in [her]420-women shape , but lacking all raiment , so that [he]139-birdalone shall see [her]420-women as [she]420-women is verily shapen . But whoso shall take any one of all these gifts is lost for ever , and shall become one of [that Stony People]5043-that stony people ; and [whoso]139-birdalone naysayeth them all until the cock crow , and abideth steady by [his]139-birdalone one craving , shall win fulfilment thereof , and , as some say , all those gifts aforesaid ; for that [the Stony People]5044-the stony people may not abide the day to take them back again . [He]139-birdalone was silent therewith , and nought spake [Birdalone]139-birdalone , but looked down on the ground , and longing encompassed [her]420-women soul . Then [the priest]1677-the priest spake again : This were a fair adventure , [lady]493-lady , for [a hapless one]5047-a hapless one , but for the happy it were [a fool]482-a fool â€™s errand . [She]493-lady answered not , and [they]5036-these wights parted for that time . But the next week , there being yet no tidings come to hand , [Birdalone]139-birdalone prayed [the castellan]1691-the castellan to take [her]493-lady out - a - gates again , that [she]493-lady might once more behold [the mountains]200-the mountains , and the gates thereof ; and [he]1691-the castellan yeasaid [her]493-lady asking , and went with [her]493-lady , well accompanied , as before ; but this time , by [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s will , [they]5036-these wights rode straight to [the plain]4991-the plain aforesaid , and again [she]493-lady looked into [that dale of the Greywethers from [the knoll]5024-the knoll]5052-that dale of the greywethers from the knoll . Somewhat belated [they]5036-these wights were , so that [they]5036-these wights might not get back to [the castle]1534-the castle before dusk , wherefore again [they]5036-these wights lay out in [the wildwood]512-the wildwood , but there lacked somewhat of the triumph and joyance which [they]5036-these wights had had that other day . [They]5036-these wights came back to [the castle]1534-the castle on the morrow somewhat after noon , and found no news there ; nor , to say sooth , did [Birdalone]139-birdalone look for any ; and [her]493-lady heart was heavy . Chapter VII ~ [Birdalone]139-birdalone Beguileth [the Priest]1677-the priest to Help [Her]493-lady to [Outgoing]143-outgoing Now had the time so worn that the season was in the first days of August , and weariness and heartsickness increased on [Birdalone]139-birdalone again , and [she]493-lady began to look pined and pale . Yet when [she]493-lady spake of the tarrying of [the Champions]1928-the champions both to [the castellan]1691-the castellan and [Sir Leonard the priest]5060-sir leonard the priest ( who was [the wiser man of the two]5061-the wiser man of the two ) , [each]4577-each said the same thing , to wit , that it was no marvel if [they]5036-these wights were not yet come , seeing whatlike the adventure was ; and [neither of those two]5063-neither of those two seemed in anywise to have lost hope . Thrice in these last days did [Birdalone]139-birdalone go out - a - gates with [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris and [[his]131-sir aymeris company]5064-his company ; and the last of the three times the journey was to [the knoll that looked into [the Black Valley]33-the black valley]5065-the knoll that looked into the black valley ; but now was [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s pleasure of the sight of it afar off marred by [her]493-lady longing to be amidst thereof ; yet [she]493-lady did not show that [she]493-lady was irked by the refraining of [her]493-lady desire to enter therein , and [they]5036-these wights turned , and came [home]373-home safely to [the castle]1534-the castle . On the morrow [she]493-lady sat with [Sir Leonard]139-birdalone [the priest]1677-the priest over the writing lesson , and [she]493-lady let it be long , and oft [he]139-birdalone touched [her]493-lady hand , so that the sweetness of unfulfilled desire went deep to [his]139-birdalone heart . At last [Birdalone]139-birdalone looked up and said : [Friend]5069-friend , [I]2115-i would ask [thee]5069-friend if [thou]5069-friend seest any peril in [my]2115-i entering [the Black Valley of the Greywethers]37-the black valley of the greywethers by daylight if [I]2115-i leave it by daylight ? Alone ? quoth [he]5069-friend . [Yea]5070-yea , [she]493-lady said , alone . [He]5069-friend pondered a little , and then said : Sooth to say [I]2115-i deem the peril little in [the valley]4994-the valley itself , if [thou]5069-friend be not overcome by terror there . [Yea]5070-yea , for [my]2115-i part [I]2115-i am not all so sure that [thou]5069-friend shalt see the wonder of [the Stony Folk]5072-the stony folk coming alive ; for â€™[2115-i] tis not said that [they]2115-i quicken save on certain nights , and chiefly on Midsummer Night ; unless it be that the trier of the adventure is [some one fated above others thereto]2116-some one fated above others thereto ; as forsooth [thou]2117-thou mayst be . And as for peril of [evil men]2118-evil men , there are [few who be like to be as venturesome as]2119-few who be like to be as venturesome as [thou]2117-thou or [I.]2120-i. [They]2119-few who be like to be as venturesome as durst not enter [that black street]2121-that black street , save sore need compel [them]2119-few who be like to be as venturesome as . But forsooth , going thither , and coming back again , some peril there may be therein . And yet for weeks past there has been no word of any unpeace ; and the Red Knight it is said for certain is not riding . [Birdalone]139-birdalone was silent a while ; then [she]2120-i. said : [Fair and kind friend]2122-fair and kind friend , [I]0-i am eating [my]0-i heart out in longing for the coming back of [[my]0-i friends]1795-my friends , and it is like , that unless [I]0-i take to some remedy , [I]0-i shall fall sick thereby , and then when [they]1795-my friends come back there shall be in [me]0-i but sorry cheer for [them]1795-my friends . Now the remedy [I]0-i know , and it is that [I]0-i betake [me]0-i alone to this adventure of [the Black Valley]33-the black valley ; for meseemeth that [I]0-i shall gain health and strength by [my]0-i going thither . Wherefore , to be short , if [thou]2124-thou wilt help [me]0-i , [I]0-i will go tomorrow . What sayest [thou]2124-thou , wilt [thou]2124-thou help [me]0-i ? [He]2125-he turned very red and spake : [Lady]493-lady , why shouldest [thou]2124-thou go , as [thy]2124-thou name is , [birdalone]139-birdalone ? [Thou]2124-thou hast called [me]0-i just now [[thy]2124-thou kind friend]2127-thy kind friend , so kind as it was of [thee]2124-thou ; now therefore why should not [[thy]2124-thou friend]4800-thy friend go with [thee]2124-thou ? Kindly indeed [she]493-lady smiled on [him]2125-he , but shook [her]493-lady head : [I]0-i call [thee]2125-he trusty and [dear friend]1220-dear friend again , said [she]493-lady ; but what [I]0-i would do [I]0-i must do [myself]0-i . Moreover to what end shouldst [thou]2124-thou go ? If [I]0-i fall in with [ghosts]2130-ghosts , [a score of [men]204-men]1649-a score of men would help [me]0-i nought ; and if [I]0-i happen on [weaponed men who would do [me]0-i scathe , of what avail were one man against [them]2133-weaponed men who would do me scathe , of what avail were one man against them]2133-weaponed men who would do me scathe , of what avail were one man against them ? And look [thou]2134-thou , [Sir Leonard]139-birdalone , there is this avail in thine abiding behind ; if [I]0-i come not back in two days â€™ space , or three at the most , [thou]2134-thou wilt wot that [I]2135-i have fared amiss , and then mayst [thou]2134-thou let it be known whither [I]2135-i went , and [men]204-men will seek [me]2135-i and deliver [me]2135-i maybe . Therewith [she]2135-i stayed [her]2135-i words suddenly , and turned very pale , and laid [her]2135-i hand on [her]2135-i bosom , and said faintly : But O [my]2135-i heart , [my]2135-i heart ! If [they]204-men should come while [I]2135-i am away ! And [she]2135-i seemed like to swoon . [Leonard]139-birdalone was afraid thereat , and knew not what to do ; but presently the colour came into [her]2135-i face again , and in a little while [she]2135-i smiled , and said : Seest [thou]2134-thou not , [friend]5069-friend , how weak [I]2135-i am gotten to be , and that [I]2135-i must now beyond doubt have the remedy ? Wilt [thou]2134-thou not help [me]2135-i do it ? [Yea]5075-yea verily , said [he]139-birdalone ; but in what wise wilt [thou]2134-thou have it ? [He]139-birdalone spake as [a man distraught and redeless]5076-a man distraught and redeless ; but [she]2135-i smiled on [him]139-birdalone pleasantly , and said : Now by this time shouldst [thou]2134-thou have devised what was to do , and spared [me]2135-i the pain thereof . Two things [I]2135-i need of [thee]2134-thou : the first and most , to be put out of the castle privily betimes in the morning when nought is stirring ; the second , to have [my]2135-i palfrey awaiting [me]2135-i somewhat anigh the gate , so that [I]2135-i may not have to go afoot : for [I]2135-i am become soft and feeble with all this house - life . [Leonard]139-birdalone seemed to wake up with that word , and said : [I]2135-i have the key of [the priest]1677-the priest â€™s door of [the chapel]5078-the chapel , and the postern beyond [it]5079-it ; that shall be thine out - gate , [lady]493-lady . [I]2135-i will come and scratch at [[thy]2134-thou chamber]298-thy chamber - door much betimes , and [I]2135-i will see to it that [thy]2134-thou palfrey is bestowed in the bower wherein [thou]2134-thou didst rest the first night [thou]2134-thou camest amongst [us]5082-us . [She]493-lady said : [I]2135-i trust [thee]139-birdalone , [friend]5069-friend . And [she]493-lady thanked [him]139-birdalone sweetly , and then rose up and fell to pacing [the hall]1193-the hall up and down . [Leonard]139-birdalone hung about watching [her]493-lady a while , [she]493-lady nought forbidding [him]139-birdalone , for [her]493-lady thoughts were elsewhere , and [she]493-lady had forgotten [him]139-birdalone ; and at last [he]139-birdalone went [his]139-birdalone ways to set about doing what [she]493-lady would . Chapter VIII ~ [Birdalone]139-birdalone Fares On [Her]493-lady Adventure Dawn was but just beginning when [Birdalone]139-birdalone awoke , and though [she]493-lady had not heard [Leonard]139-birdalone at the door , [she]493-lady sprang out of bed and clad [herself]493-lady , doing on [her]493-lady black gown ; and [she]493-lady had a scrip with some bread therein , and a sharp knife at [her]493-lady girdle . Then even as [she]493-lady had done [she]493-lady heard [the priest]1677-the priest â€™s nail on the door , and [she]493-lady turned thereto ; but as [she]493-lady went , [her]493-lady eye caught [her]493-lady bow and quiver of arrows where they hung on the wall , so [she]493-lady took the bow in [her]493-lady hand and slung the quiver over [her]493-lady shoulder ere [she]493-lady opened the door and found [Leonard]139-birdalone standing there . Neither of [them]5086-they spake aught , but [they]5086-they stole [downstairs]4549-downstairs , and so to [the chapel]5078-the chapel and out by [the priest]1677-the priest â€™s door and the postern in the wall - nook , and were presently out in the fresh morning air ; and [Birdalone]139-birdalone was joyous and lightfoot , and scarce felt the earth beneath [her]493-lady soles for pleasure of [her]493-lady hope , whereas [she]493-lady deemed [she]493-lady had a thing to crave of [the Stony Folk]144-the stony folk , if [they]144-the stony folk should come alive before [her]493-lady . Fain were [she]493-lady , if [she]493-lady might withal , to give a joy to [some other]5090-some other ; so that when [they]5086-they were gone but a little way from [the castle]1534-the castle [she]493-lady reached out [her]493-lady hand to [Leonard]139-birdalone and took [his]139-birdalone , and said : Hand in hand [we]5086-they walked when first [I]2135-i went this way , and [I]2135-i deemed [thee]139-birdalone kind and friendly then , and even so hast [thou]139-birdalone been sithence . [He]139-birdalone was dumbfoundered at first for joy of the touch of [her]493-lady hand and the sweetness of [her]493-lady words ; but presently [he]139-birdalone spake to [her]493-lady confused and stammering , and praised [her]493-lady that [she]493-lady had thought to take [her]493-lady bow and arrows ; for , said [he]139-birdalone , that [they]5086-they might stand [her]493-lady in stead for defence or for getting of food , or for an excuse for wending [the woods]450-the woods . [She]493-lady nodded [yeasay]5093-yeasay unto [him]139-birdalone , and bade [him]139-birdalone again to bide three days for [her]493-lady , and if [she]493-lady came not again in that time , to make a clean breast of it to [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris . [Yea]5094-yea , said [the priest]1677-the priest , and then . . . Why , what then ? [He]139-birdalone can but shove [me]2135-i out by the shoulders , and then [I]2135-i can seek to [the little house of canons that is at [Gate Cross]38-gate cross on [the road]1797-the road to [Greenford]39-greenford]5096-the little house of canons that is at gate cross on the road to greenford . Ah , [[my]2135-i friend]304-my friend ! said [Birdalone]139-birdalone , how [we]5099-we women think of nothing at all but [ourselves]5099-we ! And wilt [thou]5100-thee be thrust out of thine [home]373-home for helping [me]2135-i herein ? Why did [I]2135-i not look to [my]2135-i palfrey [myself]2135-i ? And the keys [I]2135-i might have stolen from [thee]5100-thee , always with [thy]5100-thee good will . But now [I]2135-i see that [I]2135-i have done [thee]5100-thee a hurt . Said [Sir Leonard]139-birdalone : [Lady]493-lady , [a priest]5103-a priest hath [a home wheresoever is an house of religion]5104-a home wheresoever is an house of religion . There is no harm done , save [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris bethink [him]139-birdalone of hanging [me]2135-i over the battlements ; as [I]2135-i doubt [he]139-birdalone will not with [a priest]5103-a priest . Moreover , [I]2135-i pray [thee]5100-thee believe , that [wert]5106-us [thou]5100-thee gone from [the castle]1534-the castle , [house]919-house and [home]373-home were none for [me]2135-i [there]215-there . And [he]139-birdalone looked upon [her]493-lady piteously , as if [he]139-birdalone were beseeching . But [she]493-lady knew not what to say , and hung [her]493-lady head adown ; and presently [they]5106-us were come to the bower in the copse , which this time was a stable for [[Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s palfrey]5111-birdalone â€™s palfrey instead of [a chamber for [herself]139-birdalone]5112-a chamber for herself . So [Leonard]139-birdalone went in and fetched out the comely beast ; and [Birdalone]139-birdalone stood with [him]139-birdalone just in the cover of the copse waiting to put [her]493-lady foot in the stirrup ; but [she]493-lady might not but abide to look upon [the priest]1677-the priest , who stood there as if [he]1677-the priest were striving with [his]1677-the priest words . So [she]493-lady said : Now is need of haste to be gone . Yet one word , [[my]2135-i friend]304-my friend : Is there aught betwixt [us]5106-us wherein [I]2135-i have done [thee]304-my friend wrong ? If so it be , [I]2135-i pray [thee]304-my friend to say out what it is ; for it may be ( though [I]2135-i think it not ) [thou]304-my friend shalt not see [me]2135-i again from henceforth . [He]139-birdalone caught [his]139-birdalone breath , as if [he]139-birdalone had much ado to refrain the sobbing ; but [he]139-birdalone mastered it , and said : [Lady]493-lady and [dear friend]1220-dear friend , if [I]2135-i see [thee]304-my friend not again , [I]2135-i heed not what shall befall [me]2135-i . [Thou]304-my friend hast done [me]2135-i no wrong . There is this only betwixt [us]5106-us , that [I]2135-i love [thee]304-my friend , and [thou]304-my friend lovest not [me]2135-i . [She]493-lady looked on [him]139-birdalone sweetly and pitifully , and said : [I]2135-i may not choose but understand [thy]139-birdalone word , to wit , that [thy]139-birdalone love for [me]2135-i is the desire of [a man]217-a man toward [a woman]235-a woman ; and that is unhappy ; for [I]2135-i love [thee]304-my friend indeed , but not as [a woman]235-a woman loveth [a man]217-a man . It is best to say thus much to [thee]304-my friend downright . But [I]2135-i feel in [my]2135-i heart that when [I]2135-i have said it , it is as much as to say that [I]2135-i can not help [thee]304-my friend , and therefore am [I]2135-i sorry indeed . [He]139-birdalone stood before [her]493-lady abashed , but [he]139-birdalone said at last : Now art [thou]304-my friend so sweet , and so kind , and so true , that [I]2135-i must perforce love [thee]304-my friend yet more ; and this maketh [me]2135-i bold to say that [thou]304-my friend mayst help [me]2135-i a little , or so meseemeth . How so ? said [Birdalone]139-birdalone . Quoth [he]139-birdalone : If [thou]304-my friend wouldst suffer [me]2135-i to kiss [thy]304-my friend face this once . [She]493-lady shook [her]493-lady head , and spake : How may it avail [thee]304-my friend , when it is for once , and once only , as forsooth it must be ? Yet it is [thy]304-my friend choice , not [mine]2135-i , and [I]2135-i will not naysay [thee]304-my friend . And therewith [she]493-lady put up [her]493-lady face to [him]139-birdalone , and [he]139-birdalone kissed [her]493-lady cheek without touching [her]493-lady otherwise , and then [he]139-birdalone kissed [her]493-lady mouth ; and [she]493-lady knew that [he]139-birdalone was both timorous and sad , and [she]493-lady was ashamed to look on [him]139-birdalone , or to speak to [him]139-birdalone any more , lest [she]493-lady should behold [him]139-birdalone ashamed ; so [she]493-lady but said : Farewell , [friend]5069-friend , till tomorrow at least . And therewith [her]493-lady foot was in the stirrup , and anon [she]493-lady sat in the saddle , and [her]493-lady palfrey was ambling briskly on the way [she]493-lady would . Chapter IX ~ [Birdalone]139-birdalone Comes to [the Black Valley]33-the black valley Little is to tell of [Birdalone]139-birdalone â€™s journey unto [the knoll above [the Black Valley of the Greywethers]37-the black valley of the greywethers]5122-the knoll above the black valley of the greywethers . It was about noon when [she]493-lady came [there]215-there , and had met but [few folk on the way]5124-few folk on the way , and [those few]5125-those few were [husbandmen]5126-husbandmen , or carlines , or maidens wending afield betimes not far from [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest . Now [she]493-lady sat on [her]493-lady horse and looked down into [the dale]4999-the dale and [[its]4999-the dale stony people]5129-its stony people once more , and saw nought stirring save three ravens who , not far off , were flapping about from stone to stone of [the Greywethers]142-the greywethers , and croaking loud to each other as if some tidings were toward . [She]493-lady watched [their]5130-their play for a little , and then gat off [her]493-lady horse , and sat down on [the grass of [the knoll]5024-the knoll]5131-the grass of the knoll , and drew forth [her]493-lady victual , and ate and drank ; for [she]493-lady deemed it happier to eat and drink there than in [the very jaws of [the Black Valley]33-the black valley]5133-the very jaws of the black valley . Soon was [her]493-lady dinner done , and then [she]493-lady got to [her]493-lady saddle again , and rode slowly down to [the little stream]5134-the little stream , and along [it]5134-the little stream toward [the valley]4994-the valley and the gates of [the mountains]200-the mountains , which [she]493-lady had been fain to pass through ; but now , as had happed with [her]493-lady that morning when [she]493-lady was boun for [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat , somewhat [she]493-lady hung back from the adventure , and when [she]493-lady lacked but some five score yards from [the very dale]5138-the very dale [itself]5138-the very dale , [she]493-lady lighted down again , and let [her]493-lady way - beast bite the grass , while [she]493-lady sat down and watched the rippling water . In a while [she]493-lady drew off shoon and hosen , and stood in [the shallow ripple]5139-the shallow ripple , and bathed [her]493-lady hands and face withal , and stooped up - stream and drank from the hollow of [her]493-lady hands , and so stepped ashore and was waxen hardier ; then [she]493-lady strung [her]493-lady bow and looked to the shafts in [her]493-lady quiver , and did on [her]493-lady foot - gear , and mounted once more , and so rode a brisk amble right on into [the dale]4999-the dale , and was soon come amongst [the Greywethers]142-the greywethers ; and [she]493-lady saw that they were a many , and that [all the bottom of [the dale]4999-the dale]5141-all the bottom of the dale was besprinkled with them on either side of [the stream]1777-the stream , and some stood in [the very stream]5144-the very stream [itself]5144-the very stream , [the ground whereof was black even as the rest of [the valley]4994-the valley]5145-the ground whereof was black even as the rest of the valley , although the water ran over [it]5144-the very stream as clear as glass . As for [the dale]4999-the dale , now [she]493-lady was fairly within [it]4999-the dale , [she]493-lady could see but a little way up [it]4999-the dale , for it winded much , and at first away from [her]493-lady left hand , and the sides of it went up in somewhat steep screes on either side , which were topped with mere upright staves and burgs of black rock ; and these were specially big and outthrusting on the right hand of [her]493-lady ; and but a furlong ahead of where [she]493-lady was , one of [these burgs]5148-these burgs thrust out past the scree and came down sheer into [the dale]4999-the dale , and straitened it so much that there was but little way save by [the stream]1777-the stream itself , which ran swift indeed , but not deep , even there where it was straitened by [the sheer rocks]5151-the sheer rocks . But up [the dale]4999-the dale would [she]493-lady go , whatever was before [her]493-lady ; and now [she]493-lady told [herself]493-lady [her]493-lady very purpose , as forsooth [she]493-lady scarce had heretofore ; to wit , that [she]493-lady would abide in [the dale]4999-the dale the night over and see what should betide , and if [those wights]5154-those wights should chance to come alive , then [she]493-lady looked to have valiance enough to face [them]5154-those wights and crave the fulfilment of [her]493-lady desire . So [she]493-lady took the water and rode [the stream]1777-the stream till [she]493-lady was past [the said sheer rock]5156-the said sheer rock , and then [the valley]4994-the valley widened again , and presently was wider than it was in the beginning ; and here again were [the Greywethers grown many more and closer together]5158-the greywethers grown many more and closer together , and , as [she]493-lady deemed , were set in rings round about one very big one , which , forsooth , was somewhat in the shape of [a man sitting down with [his]5159-a man sitting down with his hands laid on his knees hands laid on [his]5159-a man sitting down with his hands laid on his knees knees]5159-a man sitting down with his hands laid on his knees . [Birdalone]139-birdalone reined up for a minute , and looked about [her]493-lady , and then went up on to the grass , and rode straight to [the said big stone]5160-the said big stone , and there lighted down from off [her]493-lady horse again , and stood by the stone and pondered . Presently [she]493-lady deemed that [she]493-lady saw something dark moving just beyond the stone , but if it were so , it was gone in a twinkling ; nevertheless [she]493-lady stood affrighted , and stared before [her]493-lady long , and saw no more , but yet for a while durst not move hand nor foot . At last [her]493-lady courage came again , and [she]493-lady thought : Yet how if [this great chieftain]5161-this great chieftain be inwardly stirring and will come awake ? Shall [I]2135-i say the word now , lest hereafter it be of no avail ? Therewith [she]493-lady stretched out [her]493-lady right hand and laid it on the stone , and spake aloud : O Earth , [thou]5162-thou and [[thy]5162-thou first children]5039-thy first children , [I]2135-i crave of [you]5039-thy first children that [he]5161-this great chieftain may come back now at once and loving [me]2135-i . And [her]493-lady voice sounded strange and unkent to [her]493-lady in that solitude , and [she]493-lady rued it that [she]493-lady had spoken . Chapter X ~ How [Birdalone]139-birdalone Fell in with [A Man]217-a man in [the Black Valley of the Greywethers]37-the black valley of the greywethers Came new tidings therewithal ; for the moment after [she]493-lady had spoken , [a tall man drew out from behind the big stone]5165-a tall man drew out from behind the big stone , and stood before [her]493-lady ; and at first it was in [her]493-lady mind that this was [the very chieftain]5166-the very chieftain come alive for [her]493-lady , and for terror [she]493-lady was like to swoon this time ; but [he]217-a man spake nought a while , but looked on [her]493-lady eagerly and curiously . [She]493-lady came to [herself]493-lady presently , so much that [she]493-lady could see [him]217-a man clearly , and was now growing more shamefast than afraid , when [she]493-lady saw beyond doubt that [the man]5167-the man was of [the sons of [Adam]96-adam]439-the sons of adam ; but what with [her]493-lady shame that was now , and [her]493-lady fear that had been , [she]493-lady yet had no might to move , but stood there pale and trembling like a leaf , and might scarce keep [her]493-lady feet . Now [the new - comer]510-the new - comer bowed before [her]493-lady smiling , and said : [I]2135-i ask [thy]493-lady pardon , [fair damsel]5170-fair damsel ( or indeed [I]2135-i should say [fairest damsel]5171-fairest damsel ) , that [I]2135-i have scared [thee]493-lady . But sooth to say [I]2135-i beheld [thee]493-lady coming riding , and even from a little aloof [I]2135-i could see that nought which might befall could ever make it up to [me]2135-i for not seeing [thee]493-lady close at hand and hearing [thee]493-lady speak . Wherefore [I]2135-i hid [myself]2135-i behind [the king]1335-the king â€™s stone here ; and no harm is done thereby [I]2135-i trow ; for now [I]2135-i see that the colour is coming into [thy]493-lady cheeks again , and [thy]493-lady fear is gone . And as for [me]2135-i , [thou]493-lady hast not fled away from [me]2135-i , as [thou]493-lady wouldst have done had [I]2135-i not hidden and come on [thee]493-lady suddenly ; and then [thou]493-lady being horsed and [I]2135-i unhorsed , [thou]493-lady wouldst have escaped [me]2135-i , whereas now [thou]493-lady art within reach of [my]2135-i hand . Then [he]2135-i smiled , and said : Furthermore , [thou]493-lady hast told so little of [thy]493-lady secret to [this stony king]5173-this stony king here , that [I]2135-i am little the wiser for [thy]493-lady word , and [thou]493-lady [the little more betrayed]5174-the little more betrayed . Only this [I]2135-i will say , that if [He]5173-this stony king loveth [thee]493-lady not , [He]5173-this stony king is more of [a fool]482-a fool than [I]2135-i be . [He]2135-i reached out [his]2135-i hand to [hers]493-lady , but [she]493-lady drew it aback , and grew yet more ashamed , and could find no word for [him]2135-i . [His]2135-i voice was soft and full , and [he]2135-i spake deftly , but [she]493-lady was not content with it for its kindness , as [she]493-lady had been with [all the other men whom [she]493-lady had met since [she]493-lady left [the House under the Wood]4835-the house under the wood]5176-all the other men whom she had met since she left the house under the wood , and [she]493-lady durst not trust [her]493-lady hand to [him]2135-i . As for [his]2135-i aspect , [she]493-lady saw that [he]2135-i was tall and well - knit , and goodly of fashion ; dark - haired , with long hazel eyes , smooth - cheeked and bright - skinned ; [his]2135-i nose long , and a little bent over at the end , and coming down close to [his]2135-i lips , which were full and red ; [his]2135-i face was hairless save for a little lip - beard . [He]2135-i was so clad , that [he]2135-i had no helm on [his]2135-i head , but a little hat with a broad gold piece in the front thereof ; [he]2135-i was girt to a long sword , and had an anlace also in [his]2135-i belt , and [Birdalone]139-birdalone saw the rings of a fine hauberk at [his]2135-i collar and knees ; otherwise [he]2135-i was not armed . Over [his]2135-i hauberk [he]2135-i wore a black surcoat , without device of any kind , and [his]2135-i foot and leg gear were of the same hue ; wherefore may [we]5178-we call [him]2135-i [the Black Knight]5179-the black knight . Sooth to say , for all [his]2135-i soft speech , [she]493-lady feared [him]2135-i and rued the meeting of [him]2135-i . Now [he]2135-i spake to [her]493-lady again : [I]2135-i see that [thou]493-lady art wroth with [me]2135-i , [lady]493-lady ; but mayhappen it is not so ill that [I]2135-i have happened on [thee]493-lady ; for [this dale]5181-this dale hath a bad name for more than one thing , and is scarce meet for [damsels]4488-damsels to wander in . But now since [thou]493-lady hast [a weaponed man]5183-a weaponed man with [thee]493-lady , and [thou]493-lady , by [All - hallows]5184-all - hallows ! not utterly unarmed , [thou]493-lady mayst well go up [the valley]4994-the valley and see something more thereof . So come now , mount thine horse again , and [I]2135-i will lead [him]2135-i for [thee]493-lady . Now [Birdalone]139-birdalone found speech and said : [Knight]2054-knight , for such [thou]493-lady seemest to [me]2135-i , [I]2135-i deem now that [I]2135-i have no need to fare further in [this dale]5181-this dale , but [I]2135-i will get [me]2135-i into the saddle and turn [my]2135-i horse â€™s head outward again , giving [thee]493-lady good day first and thanking [thee]493-lady for [thy]493-lady courtesy . And therewith [she]2135-i turned to get to [her]2135-i palfrey , but sore trembling the while ; but [he]2054-knight followed [her]2135-i and said , with brow somewhat knitted : Nay , [lady]493-lady , [I]2135-i have left [my]2135-i horse somewhat further up , and [I]2135-i must go back to fetch [him]2054-knight , that [we]5189-we may wend out of [the dale]4999-the dale together . For [I]2135-i will not suffer [thee]493-lady to flee from [me]2135-i and fall into the hands of [evil wights]5191-evil wights , be [they]5191-evil wights [ghosts]2130-ghosts or [living men]5193-living men , and that the less since [I]2135-i have heard the speech in [thy]493-lady mouth , as of honey and cream and roses . Therefore if [thou]493-lady go out of [the dale]4999-the dale , [I]2135-i shall go with [thee]493-lady afoot , leading thine horse . And look to it if it be courteous to unhorse [a knight , who is ready to be [thy]493-lady servant]5195-a knight , who is ready to be thy servant . Moreover , since [thou]493-lady hast come to [this dale of wonder]5196-this dale of wonder , and mayst leave [it]5196-this dale of wonder safely , pity it were that [thou]493-lady shouldst see nought thereof , for strange is it forsooth , and belike [thou]493-lady shalt never seek thither again . Wherefore [I]2135-i crave of [thee]493-lady , once more , to mount thine horse and let [me]2135-i lead [thee]493-lady up [the dale]4999-the dale . [He]2135-i spake these last words rather as one giving a command than making a prayer , and [Birdalone]139-birdalone feared [him]2135-i now sorely . Forsooth [she]493-lady had [her]493-lady bended bow in hand ; but let alone that [the knight]1813-the knight was over - near to [her]493-lady that [she]493-lady might get a shaft out of [her]493-lady quiver and nock it , ere [he]1813-the knight should run in on [her]493-lady , and let alone also that [he]1813-the knight was byrnied , [she]493-lady scarce deemed that it behoved [her]493-lady to slay or wound [the man]5167-the man because [she]493-lady would be quit of [him]1813-the knight . Wherefore angrily , and with a flushed face , [she]493-lady answered [him]2135-i : So shall it be then , [Sir Knight]118-hugh ; or rather so must it be , since [thou]1813-the knight compellest [me]2135-i . [He]2135-i laughed and said : Nay , now [thou]1813-the knight art angry . [I]2135-i compel [thee]1813-the knight not , [I]2135-i but say that it will not do for [thee]1813-the knight to compel [me]2135-i to leave [thee]1813-the knight . Go which way [thou]1813-the knight wilt , up [the dale]4999-the dale , or down [it]4999-the dale and out of [it]4999-the dale ; it is all one unto [me]2135-i , so long as [I]2135-i am with [thee]1813-the knight . [Forsooth]108-birdalone , [damsel]5201-damsel , [I]2135-i have said harder words to ladies who have done [my]2135-i pleasure and not deemed [themselves]5202-themselves compelled .
