And as [she]108-birdalone entered [Arthur]150-arthur was speaking , and [he]150-arthur said : To [you]108-birdalone , [ladies]2453-ladies , [I]0-i tell what [we]2454-our of [the castle]1534-the castle wot better than well , that [[our]2454-our dear friend]2456-our dear friend hath escaped so heavy a fate in escaping the Red Hold , that it were unmeet for [us]2454-our to murmur at [our]2454-our loss in [[our]2454-our fellow]5616-our fellow ; for [a warrior]2458-a warrior â€™s life , which is ever in peril of death , is nought over heavy a ransom for [such a friend , and so dear and lovely , from such a long and evil death]2459-such a friend , and so dear and lovely , from such a long and evil death . Whereas [ye]108-birdalone must wot that [the said Hold]5535-the said hold hath this long while been [a very treasure - house of woes]2461-a very treasure - house of woes and a coffer of lamentations ; for merciless was [the tyrant thereof]2462-the tyrant thereof , and merciless [all [his]2462-the tyrant thereof folk]2463-all his folk . Now another time , when [ye]108-birdalone are stronger in heart than now [ye]108-birdalone be , [I]0-i may tell [you]108-birdalone tales thereof closer and more nicely of those who did [his]2462-the tyrant thereof will ; as of [[his]2462-the tyrant thereof innermost band of [men - at - arms]1749-men - at - arms]2464-his innermost band of men - at - arms , called [the Millers]2466-the millers ; and of [[his]2462-the tyrant thereof fellow - worker]2467-his fellow - worker in [wizardry and venoms]2468-wizardry and venoms , called [the Apothecary]2469-the apothecary ; and the three hags , called [the Furies]2470-the furies ; and [the three young women]2471-the three young women , called [the Graces]2472-the graces ; and [his]2462-the tyrant thereof hounds that love [man]537-man â€™s flesh ; and the like tales , as evil as nightmares turned into deeds of the day . But now and here will [I]0-i say this , that when [we]2474-we have done the obsequies of [[our]2474-we dear fellow]2475-our dear fellow , it were good that [we]2474-we follow up the battle so valiantly begun by [him]2475-our dear fellow . [I]0-i mean that the Quest of [[our]2474-we ladies]2476-our ladies being now accomplished , [we]2474-we should turn what is left of [the fellowship]2477-the fellowship into a war against the Red Hold and its evil things ; and that so soon as the relics of [Baudoin]115-baudoin are laid in [earth]451-earth , [we]2474-we gather force and go thither in arms to live or die in the quarrel , and so sweeten [the earth]432-the earth , as did [the men of ancient days]2480-the men of ancient days when [they]2480-the men of ancient days slew the dragons and the giants , and [the children of hell]2481-the children of hell , and [the sons of [Cain]155-cain]2482-the sons of cain . [His]2475-our dear fellow cheek flushed as [he]2475-our dear fellow spoke , and [he]2475-our dear fellow looked around till [his]2475-our dear fellow eyes fell on [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [he]2475-our dear fellow saw that [her]108-birdalone face also glowed and [her]108-birdalone eyes gleamed ; but Viridis , [her]108-birdalone heart sank so that [she]108-birdalone paled , and [her]108-birdalone lips trembled . But [Aurea]107-aurea spake and said : [I]0-i thank [thee]107-aurea for [thy]107-aurea word , [Black Squire]119-arthur , and [I]0-i know that [[my]0-i man]253-my man shall rejoice in [Paradise]48-paradise when [he]253-my man knoweth of it , and thereof shall [I]0-i tell [him]253-my man tomorrow when the mass is said for [him]253-my man . And [Atra]109-atra said : Good is the word , and [we]2484-we look to it that the deed shall be better yet . Thus hath the evil arisen that shall destroy the evil , as oft hath been when [the valiant]2485-the valiant have been grieved , and the joy of the true - hearted hath been stolen from [them]2485-the valiant ; then the hand doth the doughty deed and the heart hath ease , and solaced is sorrow . [They]2486-they looked on [her]108-birdalone and wondered , for [she]108-birdalone spake with [her]108-birdalone head upraised and [her]108-birdalone eyes glittering , as [she]108-birdalone had been [one of [the wise women of yore agone]2488-the wise women of yore agone]2487-one of the wise women of yore agone . And [Birdalone]108-birdalone feared [her]108-birdalone , though [she]108-birdalone loved [her]108-birdalone . [Lastly]156-lastly spake [Hugh]118-hugh , and said : [Brother]157-brother , this is well thought of indeed , and [I]0-i marvel that [I]0-i did not prevent [thee]157-brother ; and [I]0-i am thine to live and die with [thee]157-brother . And the adventure is nought unlikely ; for if [we]2489-us have lost [a captain]2490-a captain [they]2490-a captain have lost [their]2490-a captain head devil , and [their]2490-a captain head little devil ; moreover , [the good men of [Greenford]39-greenford]2491-the good men of greenford shall join [them]2490-a captain to [us]2489-us , and that shall make [us]2489-us strong , whereas [they]2490-a captain have [men]204-men enough , and [those stout men - at - arms]2493-those stout men - at - arms ; and [artificers]2494-artificers [they]2490-a captain have to make [us]2489-us engines , and do other wisdom ; and therewithal money to buy or to wage what [they]2490-a captain will . Wherefore , to [my]0-i mind , [we]2489-us were best to make no tarrying , but send out [the messengers]1924-the messengers for the hosting straightway . [Straightway]49-straightway , said [the Black Squire]119-arthur ; and let [us]2489-us go now and find [Sir Aymeris]131-sir aymeris . So [they]1924-the messengers arose both and went [their]1924-the messengers ways , and left [the women there]2496-the women there alone , and were gone a good while . Chapter VIII ~ [Atra]109-atra and [Birdalone]108-birdalone Talk Together While [the Lords]2497-the lords Sit at the Murder - Council Meanwhile of [their]1924-the messengers absence , [Viridis]108-birdalone sat sad and silent and downcast , though [she]108-birdalone wept not , for [her]108-birdalone gladness , which erst had been so great , seemed now reft from [her]108-birdalone ; and [no merrier]2498-no merrier was [Aurea]107-aurea , as might have been looked for . But [Atra]109-atra came quietly unto [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and said softly : [I]0-i have a word for [thee]108-birdalone if [thou]108-birdalone wilt come forth with [me]0-i into [the hall]1193-the hall . [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s heart failed [her]108-birdalone somewhat , but [she]108-birdalone suffered [Atra]109-atra to take [her]108-birdalone hand , and [they]1924-the messengers went into [the hall]1193-the hall together , and [Atra]109-atra brought [her]108-birdalone into a shot - window , and [they]1924-the messengers sat down together side by side and were silent awhile . [Spake Atra]109-atra then , trembling and reddening : [Birdalone]108-birdalone , knowest [thou]108-birdalone what thought , what hope , was in [my]0-i heart when [I]0-i spake so proudly and rashly eâ€™en now ? [Birdalone]108-birdalone kept silence , and trembled as [the other]250-the other did . This it was , said [Atra]109-atra : [he]2502-he will go to this battle valiantly , [he]2502-he may fall there , and that were better ; for then is life to begin anew : and what is there to do with these dregs of life ? Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , with flushed face : If [he]2502-he die [he]2502-he shall die goodly , and if [he]2502-he live [he]2502-he shall live goodly . Yea , yea , said [Atra]109-atra ; forsooth [thou]2503-thou art [a happy woman]2504-a happy woman ! Dost [thou]2503-thou hate [me]0-i ? said [Birdalone]108-birdalone . Said [Atra]109-atra : Proud is [thy]109-atra word , but [I]0-i hate [thee]109-atra not . Nay , eâ€™en now , when [I]0-i spake thus boastfully , [I]0-i thought : When [he]2502-he hath died as [a doughty knight]2505-a doughty knight should , then , when life begins again , [Birdalone]108-birdalone and [I]0-i shall be [friends]404-friends and [sisters]1114-sisters , and [we]2508-we two will talk together oft and call [him]2502-he to mind , and the kindness of [him]2502-he , and how [he]2502-he loved [us]2508-we . Woe â€™s [me]0-i ! that was when [he]2502-he was there sitting beside [me]0-i and [I]0-i could see [him]2502-he and [his]2502-he kindness ; and then it was as if [I]0-i could give [him]2502-he away ; but now [he]2502-he is gone and [I]0-i may not see [him]2502-he , it is clear to [me]0-i that [I]0-i have no part or lot in [him]2502-he , and [I]0-i call back [my]0-i thought and [my]0-i word , and now it is : O that [he]2502-he may live ! O [[thou]2509-thou happy woman]2510-thou happy woman , that shall be glad whether [he]2502-he liveth or dieth ! Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : And now [thou]2509-thou hatest [me]0-i , dost [thou]2509-thou not , and [we]2511-we are [foes]2512-foes ? [Atra]109-atra answered not , nor spake for a while ; then [she]109-atra said : Hard and bitter is it , and [I]0-i know not what to turn to . [I]0-i have seen once and again , on the wall of [[the Minorites]2513-the minorites â€™ church at [Greenford]39-greenford]5787-the minorites â€™ church at greenford , a fair picture of [the Blessed]5788-the blessed , and [they]5788-the blessed walking in [the meads of [Paradise]48-paradise]5789-the meads of paradise , clad in like raiment , [men]204-men and [women]420-women ; [their]5788-the blessed heads flower - crowned , [their]5788-the blessed feet naked in the harmless blossomed grass ; hand in hand [they]5788-the blessed walk , with all wrath passed for ever , all desire changed into loving - kindness , all the anguish of forgiveness forgotten . And underneath the picture is it writ : Bitter winter , burning summer , never more shall waste and wear ; Blossom of the rose undying brings undying springtide there . O for the hope of it , that [I]109-atra might hope it ! O for the days to be and the assuaging of sorrow : [I]109-atra speak the word , and the hope springeth ; the word is spoken , and there abideth desire barren of hope ! And [she]109-atra bowed down [her]109-atra head and wept bitterly ; and [Birdalone]108-birdalone called to mind [her]108-birdalone kindness of the past and wept for [her]109-atra , [she]108-birdalone also . After a while [Atra]109-atra lifted up [her]109-atra head , and thus [she]109-atra spake : [I]109-atra hate [thee]109-atra not , [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; nor doth one say such things to [a foe]5792-a foe . Yea , furthermore , [I]109-atra will crave somewhat of [thee]109-atra . If ever there come a time when [thou]109-atra mayst do something for [me]109-atra , [thou]109-atra wilt know it belike without [my]109-atra telling [thee]109-atra . In that day and in that hour [I]109-atra bid [thee]109-atra remember how [we]5793-we stood together erst at the stair - foot of the Wailing Tower in [the Isle of Increase Unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought , and [thou]109-atra naked and fearful and quaking , and what [I]109-atra did to [thee]109-atra that tide to comfort [thee]109-atra and help and save [thee]109-atra . And then when [thou]109-atra hast called it to mind , do [thou]109-atra for [me]109-atra what [thou]109-atra canst do . Wilt [thou]109-atra promise this ? [Yea]5794-yea , yea , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; and with all the better will , that oft and over again have [I]109-atra called it to mind . Wherefore [I]109-atra behight [thee]109-atra to let [me]109-atra serve [thee]109-atra if [I]109-atra may whenso the occasion cometh , even if it be to [my]109-atra own pain and grief ; for this [I]109-atra know [thou]109-atra meanest . See [thou]109-atra to this then , said [Atra]109-atra coldly ; and [thou]109-atra shalt be the better for it in the long run belike : for [thou]109-atra art [a happy woman]2504-a happy woman . [She]109-atra arose as [she]109-atra spake , and said : [Hist]5796-he ! here come [the lords from the murder - council]5797-the lords from the murder - council ; and lo , now that [he]5796-he cometh , [my]109-atra heart groweth evil toward [thee]109-atra again , and well - nigh biddeth [me]109-atra wish that [thou]109-atra wert naked and helpless before [me]109-atra again . Lo [my]109-atra unhap ! that [he]5796-he should mark [my]109-atra face that it shows as if [I]109-atra were fain to do [thee]109-atra a mischief . And nought of that would [I]109-atra do ; for how should it avail [me]109-atra , and [thou]109-atra [[my]109-atra fellow]2411-my fellow and [the faithful messenger of the Quest]5799-the faithful messenger of the quest ? Now little of [her]109-atra last words did [Birdalone]108-birdalone meet , as into [the hall]1193-the hall came [Hugh]118-hugh and [Arthur]119-arthur ; and though [she]109-atra strove to sober [her]109-atra mind and think of [[her]109-atra [she]5801-her she - friend - friend]5801-her she - friend and [her]109-atra unhappiness , yet [she]109-atra could not choose but to be full of joy in [her]109-atra inmost heart now [she]109-atra knew without doubt that [she]109-atra was so well - beloved of [[her]109-atra beloved]5802-her beloved : and [she]109-atra deemed that [Atra]109-atra was in the right indeed to call [her]109-atra [a happy woman]2504-a happy woman . So now [they]5804-they all went into [the solar]5465-the solar together , and sat [them]5804-they down with [the two others]4719-the two others ; and [Hugh]118-hugh did [them]5804-they to wit , how [they]5804-they had ordered all the matter of [the messengers who were to summon [the knights and [chiefs of thereabouts]5809-chiefs of thereabouts]5808-the knights and chiefs of thereabouts , and [the aldermen of [Greenford]39-greenford]5810-the aldermen of greenford , to meet at [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest]5807-the messengers who were to summon the knights and chiefs of thereabouts , and the aldermen of greenford , to meet at the castle of the quest , that [they]5804-they might set afoot the hosting to go against [the Red Hold]42-the red hold . Chapter IX ~ [Hugh]118-hugh Tells the Story of [the Quest]26-the quest â€™s Ending . When this was said , and there had been silence a while , [Birdalone]108-birdalone took up the word , and spake meekly and sweetly , saying : [Dear friends]1316-dear friends , how it fared with [you]1316-dear friends on [the isle]631-the isle from the time of [my]109-atra leaving [you]1316-dear friends , and how with [you]1316-dear friends , [true knights]5814-true knights , from the time of [your]1316-dear friends departure , [I]109-atra both were fain to know for the tale â€™s sake , and also [I]109-atra would take the telling thereof as a sign of [your]1316-dear friends forgiveness of [my]109-atra transgression ; so [I]109-atra would crave the same of [you]1316-dear friends but if it weary [you]1316-dear friends overmuch . All [they]5804-they yeasaid [her]108-birdalone kindly , and [Hugh]118-hugh spake and said : By [your]1316-dear friends leave , [fellows]1314-fellows , [I]109-atra will tell in few words what betid [us]5816-us on [our]5816-us way to [the Isle of [Increase Unsought]29-increase unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought , and then shall [Viridis]108-birdalone take up the tale from the time that [Birdalone]108-birdalone left [the said isle]1885-the said isle in [[the witch]394-the witch â€™s ferry]772-the witch â€™s ferry . None said aught against it , and [Hugh]118-hugh went on : Short is [my]109-atra tale of the journey : [We]2514-we came to [the Isle of Nothing]1595-the isle of nothing on the morrow â€™s morn of [our]2514-we departure , and being warned of [thee]5821-thee , [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [we]2514-we abode there but a little while to rest [us]2514-we from [the boat]850-the boat , and went nowhither from [the strand]648-the strand , and so went on [our]2514-we way in a three hours â€™[109-atra] space . Thence again [we]2514-we took the water , and came to [the Isle of Kings]4853-the isle of kings , and that was in the middle of the night : [we]2514-we beheld [the dead]2516-the dead long and heedfully when the morning came , and departed again before noon , and came to [the Isle of Queens]4854-the isle of queens a little after nightfall . The next morning [we]2514-we deemed [we]2514-we needs must go see the images of [those ladies]1501-those ladies , lest aught might have befell since [thou]2519-thou wert there which might be of import to [the Quest]26-the quest , but all was unchanged , and [we]2514-we came away while the day was yet young . [We]2514-we made [the Isle of [the Young]120-the young]19-the isle of the young and [the Old]4658-the old about sunset that day , and [the boy]1404-the boy and [the girl]2522-the girl came down to [the strand]648-the strand to behold [us]2514-we and wonder at [us]2514-we , and [we]2514-we sported with [them]1501-those ladies merrily a while ; and then [they]1501-those ladies brought [us]2514-we to [the house of [the old man]1380-the old man , who received [us]2514-we courteously and gave [us]2514-we to eat and drink]2524-the house of the old man , who received us courteously and gave us to eat and drink . [Forsooth]108-birdalone , when the night was somewhat spent , [he]1380-the old man brought out strong drink to [us]2514-we , and took it somewhat amiss that [we]2514-we drank not overmuch thereof , as forsooth [he]1380-the old man did , and so fell asleep . Before [he]1380-the old man was drunk [we]2514-we asked [him]1380-the old man many questions about [the isle]631-the isle and [its]631-the isle customs , but [he]1380-the old man knew nought to tell [us]2514-we of them . Of [thee]2527-thee also [we]2514-we asked , [sister]773-sister , but [he]1380-the old man had no memory of [thee]2527-thee . On the morrow [he]1380-the old man fared down with [us]2514-we to [[our]2514-we ferry]2529-our ferry , and made many prayers to [us]2514-we to take [him]1380-the old man along with [us]2514-we ; for here , said [he]1380-the old man , is neither [lordship]2530-lordship nor [fair lady]1833-fair lady ; and if [here]244-here [I]0-i abide , soon shall [I]0-i come to [mine]0-i ending day , and sore [I]0-i yearn for joyance and a long term to [my]0-i years . Now [we]2514-we durst not take [him]1380-the old man aboard lest [we]2514-we should fare amiss with the wight of [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat ; so [we]2514-we naysaid [him]1380-the old man courteously , thanked [him]1380-the old man for [his]1380-the old man guesting , and gave [him]1380-the old man gifts , to wit , a finger gold ring and an ouch of gold , so [he]1380-the old man turned away from [us]2514-we somewhat downcast as [we]2514-we deemed ; but ere [we]2514-we had given the word to [the Sending]2534-the sending [Boat]51-boat [we]2514-we heard [him]1380-the old man singing merrily in a high cracked voice as [he]1380-the old man went on [his]1380-the old man way . Now on this last day betid somewhat of new tidings ; for scarce was [this isle]4486-this isle out of sight behind , ere [we]2514-we saw [a boat]676-a boat come sailing toward [us]2514-we from [the north - east]2537-the north - east , and it came on swiftly with a blue ripple of [the lake]355-the lake behind it . Thereat [we]2514-we marvelled , and yet more when [we]2514-we saw that [its]676-a boat sail was striped of gold and green and black ; next then were [we]2514-we betwixt fear and joy when , as it drew nigher , [we]2514-we saw three women in [the said boat]2539-the said boat , clad in gold , green , and black ; and it came so nigh unto [us]2514-we at last , that [we]2514-we could see [their]2540-their faces that [they]2540-their were verily those of [[our]2514-we lovelings]5613-our lovelings ; and [each]4577-each reached out [her]4577-each arms to [us]2514-we and called on [us]2514-we for help , each by [our]2514-we name : and there [we]2514-we were , oarless , sailless , at the mercy of [[our]2514-we unkenned ferry]2543-our unkenned ferry . Then would [Baudoin]115-baudoin and [I]0-i have leapt overboard to swim to [our]2514-we loves at all adventure ; but [Sir Arthur]150-arthur here stayed [us]2514-we , and bade [us]2514-we think of it , that [we]2514-we were now nearing [the Witch - land]2544-the witch - land , and if [we]2514-we might not look to be beset with guiles and gins to keep [us]2514-we from winning to [our]2514-we journey â€™s end ; wherefore [we]2514-we forbore , though in all wretchedness , and [the gay boat]2545-the gay boat ran down the wind away from [us]2514-we , and the breeze and the ripple passed away with it , and [the lake]355-the lake lay under the hot sun as smooth as glass ; and on [we]2514-we went , weary - hearted . Came again another sail out of [the north - east]2537-the north - east , when the sun was getting low , and speedily it drew nigh , but this time it was [no small boat or [barge]2549-barge]2548-no small boat or barge , but [a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered [she]2550-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung was and shield - hung]2550-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung , and the basnets gleamed and the spears glittered from [[her]2550-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung castle - tops and bulwarks]2551-her castle - tops and bulwarks , and the sound of [her]2550-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung horns came down the wind as [she]2550-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung neared [us]2514-we . [We]2514-we two handled [our]2514-we weapons and did on [our]2514-we basnets , but [Arthur]150-arthur there , [he]150-arthur sat still , and said : Not over - wise is [the witch]394-the witch , that [she]394-the witch lets loose on [us]2514-we two sendings in one day so like unto [each other]569-each other . Hah , said [Baudoin]115-baudoin , be [we]2514-we wary though ; [they]2554-they are going to shoot . And sure enough [we]2514-we saw a line of [bowmen]2555-bowmen in [all the castles]2556-all the castles and even along , and a horn blew , and then forth flew the shafts , but whither [we]2514-we knew not , for [none]1359-none came anywhere anigh [us]2514-we ; and [Arthur]150-arthur laughed and said : A fair shot into the clouds ; but , by [[our]2514-we Lady]477-our lady ! if none shot better in [[our]2514-we country]2559-our country , [I]0-i would bear no armour for [their]2554-they shafts . But [we]2514-we two were confused and knew not what to think . [The great ship]2560-the great ship flew past [us]2514-we on the wind as [the barge]2561-the barge had done , but when [she]2560-the great ship was about half a mile aloof [we]2514-we saw [her]2560-the great ship canvass fall to shivering and [her]2560-the great ship yards swaying round , and [Arthur]150-arthur cried out : [St. Nicholas]159-st. nicholas ! the play beginneth again ! [she]2560-the great ship is coming about ! Even so it was , and presently [she]2560-the great ship was bearing on [us]2514-we , and was ere long so close aboard that [we]2514-we could see [her]2560-the great ship every spar and rope , and [[her]2560-the great ship folk]2562-her folk all gathered to the windward , [knights]5590-knights , [sergeants]2564-sergeants , [archers]2565-archers , and [mariners]2566-mariners , to gaze at [us]2514-we and mock [us]2514-we ; and huge and devilish laughter arose from amongst [them]2562-her folk as [she]2560-the great ship ploughed the water so close beside [us]2514-we , that [one]504-one might well - nigh have cast a morsel of bread aboard [her]2560-the great ship ; for clear it was presently that [she]2560-the great ship had no mind to run [us]2514-we down . Spake [Arthur]150-arthur then : There will be a fresh play presently , [[my]0-i mates]2568-my mates , but [ye]2568-my mates sit fast , for [meseemeth]2569-meseemeth this show is no more perilous than the other , though it be bigger . Scarce were the words out of [his]150-arthur mouth , ere there was a stir amongst [the men gathered in the waist]2570-the men gathered in the waist , and lo , amidst a knot of [big and fierce mariners]2571-big and fierce mariners , [three women standing , pale , with flying hair]2572-three women standing , pale , with flying hair , and [their]2572-three women standing , pale , with flying hair hands bound behind [them]2572-three women standing , pale , with flying hair , and [one was clad in gold and another in green and the third in black]2573-one was clad in gold and another in green and the third in black ; and [their]2572-three women standing , pale , with flying hair faces were as the faces of [Aurea]107-aurea and [Viridis]108-birdalone and [Atra]109-atra . Then there came forth from [that ship]2574-that ship a huge cruel roar blent with mocking laughter that shamed [our]2514-we very hearts , and those evil things in the form of [mariners]2566-mariners took hold of [each one of [the ladies]1877-the ladies]2576-each one of the ladies and cast [them]2572-three women standing , pale , with flying hair overboard into [the gulf of the waters]2578-the gulf of the waters , first [Aurea]107-aurea , next [Viridis]108-birdalone , and then [Atra]109-atra ; and [we]2514-we two stood up with [our]2514-we useless swords brandished and would have leapt over into [the deep]2579-the deep , but that [Arthur]150-arthur arose also and took hold of an arm of each of [us]2514-we and stayed [us]2514-we , and said : Nay , then , if [ye]2580-ye go , take [me]0-i with [you]2580-ye , and let [all the Quest]2581-all the quest sink down into [the deep]2579-the deep , and let [[our]2514-we lovelings]5613-our lovelings pine in captivity , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone lose [all [her]108-birdalone friends]2584-all her friends in one swoop , and [we]2514-we be known hereafter as [the fools of lovers]2585-the fools of lovers , [the unstable]2586-the unstable . So [we]2514-we sat [us]2514-we down , but huge shrieking laughter rose up unblended from the keel of the evil thing , and then [they]2587-they let [her]108-birdalone go down the wind , and [she]108-birdalone went [her]108-birdalone way with flashing of arms , and streaming of banners and pennons , and blowing of horns , and the sun was setting over [the wide water]4588-the wide water . But [Arthur]150-arthur spake : Cheer up , [brethren]4817-brethren ! see [ye]4817-brethren not how [this proud witch]2590-this proud witch is also but [an eyeless fool]2591-an eyeless fool to send [us]2514-we such a show , and the second time in one day to show [us]2514-we the images of [[our]2514-we dearlings]2592-our dearlings , who hours ago flitted past [us]2514-we in [the stripe - sailed boat]2593-the stripe - sailed boat ? Where , then , did [they]2587-they of [the ship]2594-the ship meet with [them]2587-they ? Nay , [lords]1887-lords , let not the anguish of love steal all [your]4817-brethren wits . [We]2514-we saw [we]2514-we had been [fools to be so overcast by guile]2596-fools to be so overcast by guile , and yet were [we]2514-we exceeding ill at ease , and over - long the time seemed unto [us]2514-we until [we]2514-we should be come to [the Isle of Increase Unsought]4590-the isle of increase unsought , and find [[our]2514-we lovelings]5613-our lovelings there . Now was the night come , and [we]2514-we fell asleep , but belike were not often all asleep at once ; and at last it was , when [we]2514-we felt the dawn drawing near , though , the moon being down , it was the darkest of the summer night , that [we]2514-we were all three awake , when all of a sudden [we]2514-we heard just astern the rushing of the water , as though some keel were cleaving it , and dimly in the dark [we]2514-we saw a sail as of [a boat]676-a boat overhauling [us]2514-we . Close at hand there rang out a lamentable cry : O , are [ye]2600-ye there , [fellows of the Quest]2601-fellows of the quest ? O , help [me]0-i , [friends]404-friends ! save [me]0-i and deliver [me]0-i , who am snatched away to be cast into the hands of [[my]0-i mistress]4401-my mistress that was . Help [me]0-i , [Baudoin]115-baudoin , [Hugh]118-hugh , [Arthur]150-arthur ! Help ! help ! Then all [we]2514-we knew the voice of [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [Arthur]150-arthur leapt up , and would have been overboard in a trice had not [we]2514-we two held [him]150-arthur , and [he]150-arthur fought and cursed [us]2514-we well - favouredly , there is no nay thereto ; and meanwhile the wailing voice of [thee]2604-thee , [[my]0-i sister]1162-my sister , died out in the distance , and [the east]2606-the east grew grey , and dawn was come . Then spake [Baudoin]115-baudoin : [Arthur]150-arthur , [[my]0-i brother]2607-my brother , dost [thou]2608-thou not mark that this also was of the same sort of show as [those two others]2609-those two others , and [thou]2608-thou who wert so wise before ? It is but beguilings to bring the Quest to nought ; wherefore call to mind [thy]2608-thou manhood and [thy]2608-thou much wisdom ! And [we]2514-we admonished [him]150-arthur and rebuked [him]150-arthur till [he]150-arthur became quiet and wise again , but was sad and downcast and silent . But [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat sped on through the dawning , and when it was light [we]2514-we saw that [we]2514-we had the Isle of [Increase]112-increase unsought close aboard , and [we]2514-we ran ashore there just as the sun was rising . Fain were [we]2514-we then to get out of [the boat]850-the boat and feel earth under [our]2514-we feet . [We]2514-we took all [our]2514-we hards out of [the boat]850-the boat , and hid away under the roots of an old thorn a little mail wherein was [your]2613-ye raiment , [[my]0-i ladies]2614-my ladies , which [ye]2613-ye had lent to [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; then [we]2514-we did on [our]2514-we armour , and advised [us]2514-we of whereabout on [the isle]631-the isle [we]2514-we were , and [we]2514-we saw [the orchards and gardens]2616-the orchards and gardens before [us]2514-we , and [the great fair house]2617-the great fair house above all , even as [ye]2613-ye told [us]2514-we of them , [Birdalone]108-birdalone . Next , then , without more ado , [we]2514-we went [our]2514-we ways up through [the orchard]456-the orchard and [the gardens]2619-the gardens , and when [we]2514-we were well - nigh at the end of them , and in face of those many steps [ye]2613-ye spake of , [we]2514-we saw at the foot of [them]2616-the orchards and gardens [a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if [she]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming abode [our]2514-we coming]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming . When [we]2514-we drew nigh [we]2514-we saw that [she]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming was strong - looking , well - knit , white - skinned , yellow - haired , and blue - eyed , and might have been called [a fair woman]580-a fair woman , as to [her]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming shaping , save that [her]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming face was heavy , yet hard - looking , with thin lips and somewhat flagging cheeks , a face stupid , but proud and cruel . [She]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming hailed [us]2514-we as [we]2514-we came up , and said : [Men - at - arms]1749-men - at - arms , [ye]1749-men - at - arms be welcome to [[our]2514-we house]4667-our house , and [I]0-i bid [you]1749-men - at - arms to eat and drink and abide here . Then [we]2514-we louted before [her]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming , and bade [her]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming Hail ; and [Baudoin]115-baudoin said : [Lady]493-lady , [thy]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming bidding will [we]2514-we take ; yet have [we]2514-we an errand to declare ere [we]2514-we break bread with [thee]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming , lest when it is told [we]2514-we be not so welcome as [ye]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming tell [us]2514-we now . What is it ? said [she]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming . Said [Baudoin]115-baudoin : [This man]1669-this man here is called [the Green Knight]118-hugh , and [this the Black Squire]2626-this the black squire , and [I]0-i am [the Golden Knight]1811-the golden knight ; and now will [we]2514-we ask [thee]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming if [this isle]4486-this isle be called [the Isle of Increase Unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought ? Even so have [I]0-i called [it]4486-this isle , quoth [she]2620-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming , wherefore [I]0-i deem [none other]2629-none other will dare call it otherwise . It is well , [quoth Baudoin]115-baudoin ; but [we]2514-we have heard say that hereto had strayed [three dear friends of [ours]2514-we]2630-three dear friends of ours , [three maidens , who hight [Viridis]108-birdalone , [the friend of [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight]2632-the friend of the green knight , and [Atra]109-atra , who is [the Black Squire â€™s]2634-the black squire â€™s , and [Aurea]107-aurea , who is [[mine]0-i own friend]2635-mine own friend]2631-three maidens , who hight viridis , the friend of the green knight , and atra , who is the black squire â€™s , and aurea , who is mine own friend , so [we]2514-we have come to take [them]2630-three dear friends of ours [home]373-home with [us]2514-we , since [they]2630-three dear friends of ours have been so long away from [[their]2630-three dear friends of ours land]4578-their land and [their]2630-three dear friends of ours loves . Now if [they]2630-three dear friends of ours be [[thy]2638-thy friends]1815-thy friends [thou]2638-thy wilt perchance let [them]2630-three dear friends of ours go for love â€™s sake and the eking of friendship ; but if [they]2630-three dear friends of ours be [[thy]2638-thy captives]2640-thy captives , then are [we]2514-we well willing to pay [thee]2638-thy ransom , not according to [their]2630-three dear friends of ours worth , for no treasure heaped up might come nigh it , but according to [thy]2638-thy desire , [lady]493-lady . Laughed [the proud lady]2642-the proud lady scornfully and said : Big are [thy]2638-thy words , [Sir Knight]115-baudoin : if [I]0-i had [these maidens]2643-these maidens in [my]0-i keeping [I]0-i would give [them]2643-these maidens unto [you]115-baudoin for nothing , and deem that [I]0-i had the best of the bargain . But here are [they]2643-these maidens not . True it is that [I]0-i had here three thralls who were hight as [thou]2638-thy hast said ; but a while ago , not many days , [they]2643-these maidens transgressed against [me]0-i till [I]0-i chastised [them]2643-these maidens ; and then was [I]0-i weary of [them]2643-these maidens and would be quit of [them]2643-these maidens ; for [I]0-i need [no servants]2644-no servants [here]244-here , whereas [I]0-i [myself]0-i am enough for [myself]0-i . Wherefore [I]0-i sent [them]2643-these maidens away across [the water]347-the water to [[my]0-i sister]1162-my sister , who dwells in a fair place hight [the House under [the Wood]335-the wood]4835-the house under the wood ; for [she]1162-my sister needeth [servants]1091-servants , because [the earth]432-the earth there yieldeth nought save to [the tiller]2652-the tiller and [the herdsman]2653-the herdsman and [the hunter]2654-the hunter , while here all cometh unsought . With [her]1162-my sister may [ye]2655-ye deal , for what [I]0-i know , and buy [the maidens whom [ye]2655-ye prize so high]2656-the maidens whom ye prize so high ; though belike [ye]2655-ye may have to give [[her]1162-my sister other servants]2657-her other servants in [their]2657-her other servants place . For , indeed , a while ago [her]1162-my sister thrall fled from [her]1162-my sister and left [her]1162-my sister half undone , and it is said that [she]1162-my sister came hither in [her]1162-my sister shamelessness : but [I]0-i know not ; if [she]1162-my sister did , [she]1162-my sister slipped through [my]0-i fingers , or else [I]0-i would have made [her]1162-my sister rue [her]1162-my sister impudence . Now [meseemeth]2658-meseemeth , [Sir Knights]160-sir knights , here is enough of so small and foolish a matter ; and again [I]0-i pray [you]160-sir knights to enter [[my]0-i poor house]2659-my poor house , and take meat and drink along with [me]0-i , for [ye]160-sir knights be none the less welcome because of [your]160-sir knights errand , though it be a foolish one . Now would [Sir Baudoin]115-baudoin have answered wrathfully , but [Arthur]150-arthur plucked at [his]150-arthur skirt , and [he]150-arthur yeasaid [the lady]1145-the lady â€™s bidding , though somewhat ungraciously ; but that [she]1145-the lady heeded nought ; [she]1145-the lady took [Sir Baudoin]115-baudoin by the hand and led [him]115-baudoin up [the stately perron]2661-the stately perron , and thence came [we]2662-we into [a pillared hall]2663-a pillared hall , as fair as might be . And there on the dais was a table dight with dainty meats and drinks , and [the lady]1145-the lady bade [us]2662-we thereto , and [we]2662-we sat to it . Thereat was [the lady buxom and merry]2665-the lady buxom and merry : [Baudoin]115-baudoin scowled across the board ; [I]0-i was wary and silent ; but [Arthur]150-arthur was as blithe with [the lady]1145-the lady as [she]1145-the lady with [him]150-arthur ; nor did [I]0-i altogether marvel thereat , since [I]0-i knew [him]150-arthur wise of wit . But when [we]2662-we were done with the meal , [the lady]1145-the lady stood up and said : Now , [Sir Knights]2668-sir knights , [I]0-i will give [you]2668-sir knights leave ; but [this house]2669-this house is as [your]2668-sir knights own to roam through all [[its]2669-this house chambers]2670-its chambers and pleasure [you]2668-sir knights with its wonders and goodliness ; and when [ye]2668-sir knights are weary of [the house]311-the house , then is [the orchard]456-the orchard and [the garden]1076-the garden free to [you]2668-sir knights , and [all the isle wheresoever [ye]2668-sir knights will go]2674-all the isle wheresoever ye will go . And here in [this hall]2675-this hall is meat and drink for [you]2668-sir knights whenso [ye]2668-sir knights will ; but if [ye]2668-sir knights would see [me]0-i again today , then shall [ye]2668-sir knights meet [me]0-i where [ye]2668-sir knights first happened on [me]0-i eâ€™en now , at the foot of [the great perron]2676-the great perron . Then [she]0-i laid [her]0-i hand on [Arthur]150-arthur â€™s shoulder , and said : [[Thy]0-i big friend]2677-thy big friend may search out every nook in [this house]2669-this house , and [every bush in [the whole island]2680-the whole island]2679-every bush in the whole island , and if [he]2677-thy big friend find there [the maidens [he]2677-thy big friend spake of]2681-the maidens he spake of , one or all of [them]2681-the maidens he spake of , then are [they]2681-the maidens he spake of a gift from [me]0-i unto [him]2677-thy big friend . Therewith [she]0-i turned , and went out of [the hall]1193-the hall by a door in the side thereof ; and now already meseemed that though [the woman]237-the woman was hateful and thick - hearted and cruel , yet [she]0-i was become fairer , or seemed so , than when [we]2684-we first came on [her]0-i ; and for [my]0-i part [I]0-i pondered on what it might grow to , and fear of [her]0-i came into [my]0-i soul . Now spake [Baudoin]115-baudoin : [Fellows]149-fellows , let [us]2684-we get out into [the garden]1076-the garden at least ; for [this place]2247-this place is evil , and meseems [it]2247-this place smells and tastes of tears and blood , and [that evil wights that hate the life of [men]204-men]2687-that evil wights that hate the life of men are lurking in the nooks thereof . And lo , [[our]2684-we very [she]0-i - friend]2689-our very she - friend that was so kind and simple and dainty with [us]2684-we , there is , as it were , the image of [the dear maiden standing trembling and naked before the stupid malice of this lump of flesh]2690-the dear maiden standing trembling and naked before the stupid malice of this lump of flesh . So spake [he]115-baudoin , [Birdalone]108-birdalone . But [I]0-i said to [Arthur]150-arthur in a soft voice : And when shall [we]2684-we slay [her]0-i ? Said [he]150-arthur : Not until [we]2684-we have gotten from [her]0-i all that may be gotten ; and that is the living bodies of [[our]2684-we friends]1870-our friends . But come [we]2684-we forth . So did [we]2684-we , and came down to [the orchard]456-the orchard and did off [our]2684-we helms , and lay down under a big apple - tree which was clear of cover all round about , and so fell to [our]2684-we redes ; and [I]0-i asked [Arthur]150-arthur what [he]150-arthur deemed of the story of [our]2684-we loves having been carried to [the House under [the Wood]335-the wood]4835-the house under the wood , and if it might not be tried seeking thither ; but [he]150-arthur laughed and said : Never would [she]0-i have told [us]2684-we thereof had it been sooth : doubtless [[our]2684-we friends]1870-our friends are here on [this isle]4486-this isle , but , as [I]0-i deem , not in [the house]311-the house , else had not [the witch]394-the witch left all [the house]311-the house free for [us]2684-we to search into . Yea , said [I]0-i , but how if [they]1870-our friends be in [[her]0-i prison]1221-her prison ? Said [he]150-arthur : It is not hard to find out which is the prison of [so dainty a house]2701-so dainty a house as is yonder ; and when [we]2684-we had found it , soon should [we]2684-we have hit upon a way to break it , since [we]2684-we be three , and [stout fellows]2702-stout fellows enough . Nay , [I]0-i deem that [the lovelings]2703-the lovelings be stowed away in [some corner of [the isle]631-the isle]2704-some corner of the isle without [the house]311-the house , and that mayhappen [we]2684-we shall find [them]2703-the lovelings there ; and yet [I]0-i trow not before [we]2684-we have made guile meet guile , and overcome [the sorceress]2707-the sorceress . But come now , let [us]2684-we be doing , and begin to quarter [this little land as the kestrel doth [the water - meadow]2709-the water - meadow]2708-this little land as the kestrel doth the water - meadow ; and leave [we]2684-we [our]2684-we armour , lest [we]2684-we weary [us]2684-we , for [we]2684-we shall have no need for hard strokes . [We]2684-we hung up there on the tree helm and shield and hauberk , and all [our]2684-we defences , and went [our]2684-we ways quartering [the isle]631-the isle ; and the work was toilsome , but [we]2684-we rested not till the time was come to keep tryst with [the lady]1145-the lady ; and all that while [we]2684-we found no sign of [the darling ones]2712-the darling ones : and [the isle]631-the isle was everywhere [a meadow]4622-a meadow as fair as [a garden]2715-a garden , with little copses of sweet - growing trees here and there , and goodly brooks of water , but no tillage anywhere : wild things , as hart and buck and roe , [we]2684-we came upon , and smaller deer withal , but all unhurtful to [man]537-man ; but of herding was no token . Came [we]2684-we then back to [that lordly perron]2717-that lordly perron , and there , at the foot thereof , stood [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife , and received [us]2684-we joyously ; clad was [she]336-the witch - wife all gloriously in red scarlet broidered and begemmed ; [her]336-the witch - wife arms bare and [her]336-the witch - wife feet sandalled , and [her]336-the witch - wife yellow hair hanging down from under its garland ; and certainly it was so that [she]336-the witch - wife had grown fairer , and was sleek and white and well - shapen , and well - haired ; yet by all that , the visage of [her]336-the witch - wife was little bettered , and unto [me]0-i [she]336-the witch - wife was loathsome . Now the feast went much as the earlier meal had done ; and [Baudoin]115-baudoin was surly and Arthur blithe and buxom ; and nought befell to tell of , save that dishes and meats , and flasks and cups , and all things came upon the board as if they were borne thereon by [folk unseen]2719-folk unseen ; and thereat [we]2684-we wondered not much , considering in what [wonder - house [we]2684-we were]2720-wonder - house we were . But [the lady - witch]1158-the lady - witch looked on [us]2684-we and smiled , and said : [Knights]5590-knights , [ye]5590-knights marvel at the manner of [our]2684-we service , but call to mind that [we]2684-we told [you]5590-knights this morning that [we]2684-we were enough for [Ourselves]2684-we , and [we]2684-we have so dight [our]2684-we days here that whoso is [[our]2684-we friend]5433-our friend on [this Isle of Increase]2724-this isle of increase shall lack nothing . Fear not , therefore , to see [aught]2725-aught ugly in [[our]2684-we servants]2726-our servants as now unseen , if [their]2726-our servants shapes were made manifest unto [you]5590-knights . All things were [we]2684-we heedful to note at this banquet ; but when it was over , then came music into [the hall]1193-the hall from [folk unseen]2719-folk unseen , but not as if [the musicians]2729-the musicians were [a many , only belike some three or four]2730-a many , only belike some three or four . And thereat [the lady spake]2731-the lady spake , saying : [Knights]5590-knights , [ye]5590-knights may deem [[our]2684-we minstrels]2733-our minstrels but few , but such is [our]2684-we mind that [we]2684-we love not [our]2684-we music overloud , and for the most part only three sing or play unto [us]2684-we at one time . Thereafter [the lady]1145-the lady brought [us]2684-we to [fair chambers]5462-fair chambers , and [we]2684-we slept there in all ease , and [we]2684-we arose on the morrow and found [the lady]1145-the lady still blithe with [us]2684-we ; yet [I]0-i noted this , that [she]1145-the lady seemed to deal with [Arthur]150-arthur as if [she]1145-the lady saw [him]150-arthur now for the first time , and much [he]150-arthur seemed to be to [her]1145-the lady liking . Again [we]2684-we fared forth , and were no less diligent in searching [the isle]631-the isle than erst , and found nought ; and all went that day as before . On the morrow ( that is , the third day ) [the witch]394-the witch seemed to have somewhat more memory of [Arthur]150-arthur than erst , and even yet more liking of [him]150-arthur , so that [she]394-the witch reached out [her]394-the witch hand for [him]150-arthur to kiss , which needs must [he]150-arthur do , despite [his]150-arthur loathing of [her]394-the witch . When [we]2684-we had lain under the apple - tree a little while , [Baudoin]115-baudoin spake and said : Yesterday and the day before [we]2684-we searched [the open land]2739-the open land and found nought ; now today let [us]2684-we search [the house]311-the house , and if [we]2684-we find nought , then at least it shall lie behind [us]2684-we . [We]2684-we yeasaid it , and presently went back , and from [chamber]2741-chamber to chamber , and all was fair and goodly as might be , and [we]2684-we marvelled what would betide to it when [the witch]394-the witch was undone and [her]394-the witch sorcery come to an end . To [the Wailing Tower]2743-the wailing tower [we]2684-we came , and up the stairs , and found the door open of [the prison - chamber]2744-the prison - chamber , and all there as [thou]2745-thou hast told [us]2684-we , [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; only [we]2684-we opened the great coffer , whence [thou]2745-thou didst refrain [thee]2746-thee , and found it full of hideous gear truly , as fetters and chains , and whips and rods , and evil tools of [the tormentors]2747-the tormentors , and cursed it all and came away ; and [Arthur]150-arthur said : Lo [you]2746-thee , [this stupid one]2748-this stupid one ! How eager is [she]394-the witch to bid [us]2684-we what to do , and to tell [us]2684-we that [[our]2684-we ladies]2476-our ladies are not in [this evil house]2750-this evil house , since [she]394-the witch leaveth all open to [us]2684-we . Yet [we]2684-we went about [the house]311-the house without , and counted the windows heedfully to see that [we]2684-we had missed [no chamber]2752-no chamber , and found nought amiss ; and then [we]2684-we went in again and sought as low down as [we]2684-we might , to see if perchance some dungeon there were underground , but found nought save [a very goodly undercroft below [the great hall]1480-the great hall]2753-a very goodly undercroft below the great hall , which was little less fair than that which was above [it]1480-the great hall . So came the evening and the banquet , and the end of that day ; but [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife led [Arthur]150-arthur by the hand to the board , and afterwards to the chamber ere [we]2684-we slept . On the fourth day and the fifth it was no otherwise than erst ; and when [I]0-i fared to bed [I]0-i felt confused in [my]0-i head and sick of heart . The night of the next day ( the sixth ) , as [we]2684-we went to [[our]2684-we chambers]2756-our chambers , and [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife and [Arthur]150-arthur hand - inhand , [she]336-the witch - wife stayed [him]150-arthur a while , and spake eagerly to [him]150-arthur in a soft voice ; and as [he]150-arthur came up to [me]0-i afterwards [he]150-arthur said : To - night [I]0-i have escaped it , but there will not be escape for long . From what ? said I. [He]150-arthur said : From bedding [her]336-the witch - wife ; for now it has come to this , that presently [we]2684-we must slay [her]336-the witch - wife at once and have no knowledge of [[our]2684-we sweetlings]2758-our sweetlings , or [I]0-i must do [her]336-the witch - wife will . In such wise passed four more days , and it was the twelfth morning of [our]2684-we sojourn there , and [we]2684-we went forth on [our]2684-we search of [every mead and every covert of [the isle]631-the isle]2759-every mead and every covert of the isle , and all day [we]2684-we found nought to [our]2684-we purpose ; but as it grew toward sunset , and there grew great clouds in [the eastern ort]2761-the eastern ort , piled up and copper - coloured , [we]2684-we came over a bent on to [a little green dale watered by a clear brook]2762-a little green dale watered by a clear brook , and as [we]2684-we looked down into [it]2762-a little green dale watered by a clear brook [we]2684-we saw something shine amongst its trees ; so [we]2684-we hastened toward that gleam , and lo , amidst [the dale]4999-the dale , with [the brook]700-the brook running through [it]4999-the dale , [a strange garth [we]2684-we saw]2765-a strange garth we saw . For there was [a pavilion done of timber and board]2766-a pavilion done of timber and board , and gaily painted and gilded , and out from [that house]4456-that house was , as [it]4456-that house were , a great cage of thin gilded bars , both walls and roof , just so wide apart as [no one full - grown , carl or quean]2768-no one full - grown , carl or quean , could thrust through . Thitherward then ran [we]2684-we , shouting , for [we]2684-we saw at once that in [the said cage]2769-the said cage were [three women whose aspect was that of [our]2684-we sweetlings]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings , and presently [we]2684-we were standing by the said herse , reaching [our]2684-we hands out to [them]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings to come to [us]2684-we and tell [us]2684-we [their]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings tale , and that [we]2684-we would deliver [them]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings . But [they]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings stood together in the midst of [the said cage]2769-the said cage , and though [they]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings gazed piteously on [us]2684-we thence , and reached out [their]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings hands to [us]2684-we , [they]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings neither spake nor came to the herse to [us]2684-we ; so [we]2684-we deemed that [they]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings were bewitched , and [our]2684-we joy was dashed . Then [we]2684-we went all about [the cage]2772-the cage and [the pavilion]4413-the pavilion to find ingate , and found it not ; and then [the three of [us]2684-we]2774-the three of us together strove with the bars of the herse , and shook and swayed them , but it was all to no purpose . Moreover , while [we]2684-we were at this work the sun seemed to go out , and there came a heavy black mist rolling into [the dale]4999-the dale , and wrapped [us]2684-we about so that [we]2684-we saw not [each other]569-each other â€™s faces , and the bars of the herse were gone from [our]2684-we hands as [we]2684-we stood there . Then came rain and thunder and lightning on to the black night , and by the glare of the lightning [we]2684-we could see the leaves and grass of [the dale]4999-the dale , but neither herse nor [house]919-house nor [woman]1470-woman . So [we]2684-we abode there in the dark night , and the storm all bewildered [us]2684-we , till the rain and clouds drew off and it was calm fair starlight again , but clean gone was the golden cage and [they]2770-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings that stood therein ; and [we]2684-we turned sadly , and went [our]2684-we ways toward [the witch - house]2780-the witch - house . On the way said [Arthur]150-arthur : [Brethren]161-brethren , [this meseemeth]2318-this meseemeth is but a - going on with the shows which were played [us]2684-we on the water as [we]2684-we came hither ; but whether [she]2318-this meseemeth doth this but for to mock and torment [us]2684-we , or that [she]2318-this meseemeth would beguile [us]2684-we into deeming that [[our]2684-we friends]1870-our friends are verily here , [I]0-i wot not ; but tomorrow , [meseemeth]113-meseemeth , [I]0-i shall can to tell [you]161-brethren . Now came [we]2684-we to [the perron of [the house]311-the house]2783-the perron of the house , and there stood [the witch - wife under the stars]2785-the witch - wife under the stars to meet [us]2684-we . And when [she]2318-this meseemeth saw [us]2684-we , [she]2318-this meseemeth took hold of [Arthur]150-arthur by the hand and the arm to caress [him]150-arthur , and found that [he]150-arthur and [we]2684-we were drenched with the rain and the storm , as might well be deemed ; then [she]2318-this meseemeth bade [us]2684-we up to [[our]2684-we chambers]2756-our chambers to do on raiment which [she]2318-this meseemeth had dight for [us]2684-we , and [we]2684-we went thither , and found [our]2684-we garments rich and dainty indeed ; but when [we]2684-we came down into [the hall where [the witch]394-the witch abode [us]2684-we]2787-the hall where the witch abode us , [we]2684-we saw that [Arthur]150-arthur â€™s raiment was far the richest and daintiest . But [the witch]394-the witch ran to [him]150-arthur and cast [her]394-the witch arms about [him]150-arthur , and clipped and kissed [him]150-arthur before [the others]1287-the others , and [he]150-arthur suffered it . So sped the feast again . But when [they]1287-the others went to bed , [the said witch]2791-the said witch took [Arthur]150-arthur â€™s hand and spake a word unto [him]150-arthur , and led [him]150-arthur away , and [he]150-arthur went with [her]2791-the said witch as one nought loth ; but [we]2684-we twain were afraid lest [she]2791-the said witch should destroy [him]150-arthur when [she]2791-the said witch had had [her]2791-the said witch will of [him]150-arthur . Wherefore [we]2684-we waked through the more part of the night with [our]2684-we swords ready to hand . But when [we]2684-we were clad in the morn [he]150-arthur came unto [us]2684-we , [he]150-arthur also clad , and was downcast and shamefaced indeed , but safe and sound ; and [he]150-arthur said : Speak no word about [our]2684-we matter till [we]2684-we be out in the open air , for [I]0-i fear all things about [us]2684-we . So when [we]2684-we had gone forth and were under [the apple - tree]2792-the apple - tree once more , spake [Arthur]150-arthur : Now , [lords]1887-lords , am [I]0-i shamed for ever , for [I]0-i have become [the leman of this evil creature]2794-the leman of this evil creature ; but [I]0-i pray [ye]1887-lords not to mock [me]0-i ; and that the more as the same lot may happen on [you]1887-lords both , or either ; for [I]0-i can see for sure that [the wretch]2795-the wretch will weary of [me]0-i and desire one of [you]1887-lords two . Let it pass . [Somewhat]2796-somewhat have [I]0-i found out from [her]2795-the wretch , but not much ; first , that [she]2795-the wretch has forgotten [her]2795-the wretch first lie , to wit , how [she]2795-the wretch sent [[our]2797-our ladies]2476-our ladies to [the sister - witch]2799-the sister - witch ; for [I]0-i told [her]2795-the wretch of the golden cage , and how [we]2797-our had missed it in the storm ; and [she]2795-the wretch said : Though [I]0-i deem it a folly that [ye]0-i should seek these thralls , yet would [I]0-i help [you]0-i if [I]0-i might , since [ye]0-i are now become [[my]0-i dear friends]2800-my dear friends . Though , forsooth , when [ye]0-i meet [them]2800-my dear friends [I]0-i deem that [ye]0-i will find [them]2800-my dear friends sore changed to [you]0-i . For , as [I]0-i told [you]0-i , [they]2800-my dear friends fled away from [me]0-i , after [I]0-i had chastised [them]2800-my dear friends for a treason , into [the hidden places of [the isle]631-the isle]2801-the hidden places of the isle , whereas [they]2800-my dear friends had no keel to sail away hence . And [I]0-i cared not to follow [them]2800-my dear friends , as [I]0-i [myself]0-i am queen and lady of all things here , and am enough for [myself]0-i , save when love constraineth [me]0-i , [dear lord]2803-dear lord . Now , [my]0-i rede is that [ye]0-i seek [the golden cage]2804-the golden cage again and yet again , because [I]0-i deem that [these thralls]2805-these thralls have somehow learned some wisdom , and [they]2805-these thralls have enchanted [the said cage]2769-the said cage for a defence against [me]0-i , from whom [they]2805-these thralls might not hide as [they]2805-these thralls did from [you]0-i ; for of [me]0-i have [they]2805-these thralls stolen [their]2805-these thralls wizardry , and [I]0-i am [[their]2805-these thralls mistress]2807-their mistress therein . This , therefore , is the new lie of [her]0-i , and [my]0-i rede is that [we]2808-we heed it nought . For [my]0-i mind is that [she]0-i it is that hath made the appearance of [the cage]2772-the cage and [the women therein]2810-the women therein , and that [she]0-i hath [[our]2808-we poor friends]2811-our poor friends somewhere underneath [her]0-i hand . Now this [we]2808-we deemed most like ; yet whereas [we]2808-we had nought to do with the time , which , now that [we]2808-we had searched [the isle]631-the isle throughly , hung heavy on hand , [we]2808-we deemed it good to go to [the dale of the golden cage]2813-the dale of the golden cage again , though [we]2808-we looked not to find the cage there any more . But this betid , that [we]2808-we found [the little dale]2814-the little dale easily enough , and there stood the cage as [we]2808-we had seen [it]2772-the cage yesterday , but nought was there within [its]2772-the cage bright bars save the grass and the flowers , and the water of [the brook]700-the brook a - running . [We]2808-we loitered about [that place]2386-that place a while , and went back to [the house]311-the house in due time ; and to shorten the tale , [I]0-i shall tell that for many days it betid that [we]2808-we went every day to seek [the golden cage]2804-the golden cage , but after the first three days [we]2808-we saw [it]2804-the golden cage no more . Now began sadness and weariness to overcome [us]2808-we as the days and weeks wore , and belike [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife noted it that [we]2808-we were worse company than heretofore . And now on a day [Arthur]150-arthur bade [us]2808-we note that [the said witch]2791-the said witch was growing weary of [him]150-arthur , and [he]150-arthur bade [me]0-i look to it ; for , said [he]150-arthur , [she]2791-the said witch is turning [her]2791-the said witch face toward [thee]150-arthur , [brother]4710-brother . [My]0-i heart burned with rage at that word ; [I]0-i said nought , but made up [my]0-i mind that [I]0-i would try to bring the matter to an end . That same night befell what [Arthur]150-arthur had threatened ; for the feast being done in the evening , [the witch]394-the witch drew [me]0-i aside while the music was a - playing , and caressed [my]0-i hand and [my]0-i shoulder , and said : [I]0-i am yet wondering at [you]0-i [Champions]132-the champions , that [ye]0-i must needs follow after those three wretched thralls , whom never will [ye]0-i find , for [they]2823-them . need [ye]0-i not , but will flee from [you]0-i if [ye]0-i have sight of [them]2823-them , as [they]2823-them did that other day ; and therein they are scarce in the wrong , whereas [they]2823-them may well think that if [ye]0-i find [them]2823-them they should fall into [my]0-i hands ; for easily may [I]0-i take [them]2823-them any day that [I]0-i will , and then [I]0-i have a case against [them]2823-them , and may lawfully chastise [them]2823-them according to the law that has been given unto [me]0-i ; and then shall [they]2823-them be in grievous plight . Wherefore the rede [We]2824-we give unto [you]0-i three now is the rede of friendliness that [ye]0-i make [yourselves]0-i happy in [[Our]2824-we Island]2825-our island , and then will [We]2824-we do everything [We]2824-we may for [your]0-i pleasure and delight ; and if [ye]0-i will that [We]2824-we make [Ourselves]2824-we even fairer than now [We]2824-we be , that may be done , and shall be a reward unto [you]0-i for [your]0-i yielding and obedience . And if [ye]0-i will women thralls for [your]0-i pleasure , that also may be gotten for [you]0-i ; for [We]2824-we be not wholly without power in [these waters]2826-these waters , though [We]2824-we have no keel or ferry upon [them]2826-these waters . And now , [[thou]2827-you fair lad]2828-thou fair lad , [We]2824-we give [thee]2827-you this last word : [Ye]0-i Champions have been dwelling in [[Our]2824-we house]4667-our house a long while , and that while have ever striven to thwart [Us]2824-we . [We]2824-we now counsel [you]2827-you to make an end of it , and it shall be better for [you]2827-you . [She]2830-her seemed to [my]0-i eyes prouder and stupider than ever erst , despite [her]2830-her golden hair and white skin and lovely limbs ; and [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that now must [we]2824-we destroy the evil of [that house]4456-that house even if [we]2824-we died for it , or else [we]2824-we were all undone ; withal [I]0-i saw somewhat of truth thrusting up through [her]2830-her much lying , and [I]0-i deemed , even as [Arthur]150-arthur did , that [she]2830-her had [[our]2824-we friends]1870-our friends under [her]2830-her band somewhere . Nought else betid that night ; but on the morrow [we]2824-we went forth and strayed on till [we]2824-we were come into [the southernmost quarter of [the isle]631-the isle]2833-the southernmost quarter of the isle , and not very far from [the water]347-the water [we]2824-we came upon a wood or big thicket which was new to [us]2824-we . So [we]2824-we entered [it]2836-it , and as [we]2824-we went and noted the wild things of the wood going hither and thither , [we]2824-we espied afar off the shape of [a man going amidst the thicket]2837-a man going amidst the thicket ; wherefore [we]2824-we went warily towards [him]2837-a man going amidst the thicket , lest [he]2837-a man going amidst the thicket should see [us]2824-we and flee from [us]2824-we ; and when [we]2824-we drew a little nigher [we]2824-we saw it was [a woman]235-a woman , though [she]235-a woman was clad as [a hunter , with legs naked to above the knee]2839-a hunter , with legs naked to above the knee . [She]235-a woman had a quiver at [her]235-a woman back and a bow in [her]235-a woman hand , and [her]235-a woman coat was black of hue . Belike now [she]235-a woman heard [our]2824-we going amongst the dry leaves , for [she]235-a woman turned [her]235-a woman face to [us]2824-we , and lo ! it was the face of [Atra]109-atra . When [she]235-a woman saw [us]2824-we , [she]235-a woman gave a shrill cry , and fell to running at [her]235-a woman swiftest away from [us]2824-we , and [we]2824-we followed all [we]2824-we might , but [we]2824-we could not over - run [her]235-a woman , though [we]2824-we kept [her]235-a woman in sight ever , till [we]2824-we had run all through the wood , and before [us]2824-we was the sheer side of [a rocky hill]2840-a rocky hill and the mouth of [a cave therein]2841-a cave therein , and by the said mouth who should there be but [Aurea]107-aurea and [Viridis]108-birdalone , as [we]2824-we thought , clad in gold and in green , but the fashion of [their]2842-their raiment not otherwise than Atra â€™s . [Their]2842-their bows were bended and [they]2842-their had shafts in [their]2842-their hands , and as [we]2824-we came out of the thicket into the open lawn before [the cave]2843-the cave , [Viridis]108-birdalone nocked a shaft and aimed at [us]2824-we and drew , and the shaft flew over [my]0-i head ; therewith mocking laughter came from [them]2842-their , and [they]2842-their ran into [the cave]2843-the cave . Speedily [we]2824-we ran up to [it]2843-the cave , but when [we]2824-we came [home thither]2845-home thither , there was [the sheer hillside]2846-the sheer hillside , but never a cave nor an opening . Dismayed were [we]2824-we thereat ; but more dismayed had [we]2824-we been but that [we]2824-we deemed that all this was but a cheat and a painted show put upon [us]2824-we by [the witch]394-the witch to back up [her]394-the witch lying . Nevertheless [we]2824-we fared the next day to seek the wood and the cave in the sheer rock , but nowise might [we]2824-we find either wood or cave . Now it was the night of the day hereafter , as [we]2824-we went to [[our]2824-we chambers]2756-our chambers , that [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife took [me]0-i by the hand and led [me]0-i apart , and said [me]0-i many soft things of [her]336-the witch - wife accursed lust , whereof [I]0-i will not say one again . But the upshot of it all was that [she]336-the witch - wife would bring [me]0-i to [[her]336-the witch - wife chamber]4893-her chamber and [her]336-the witch - wife bed . And whereas [I]0-i was determined what to do , and had [my]0-i war - sword by [my]0-i side , [I]0-i naysaid [her]336-the witch - wife not , but made [her]336-the witch - wife good countenance . And when [we]2824-we came to [[her]336-the witch - wife chamber]4893-her chamber , which was full gloriously dight , and fragrant as with the scent of the roses and lilies of mid - June , [she]336-the witch - wife bade [me]0-i to lie in [her]336-the witch - wife bed of gold and ivory and [she]336-the witch - wife would be with [me]0-i anon . So [I]0-i unclad [myself]0-i and laid [me]0-i down , but [I]0-i drew forth [my]0-i sword , and laid the ancient naked blade betwixt [my]0-i side and [her]336-the witch - wife place . Anon [she]336-the witch - wife cometh back again unclad , and would step into the bed ; but [she]336-the witch - wife saw the sword and said : What is this , [Champion]162-champion ? Said [I]0-i : These edges are the token of sundering between [us]2824-we , for there is a spell on [me]0-i , that with [no woman]746-no woman may [I]0-i deal , save with [mine]0-i only love , but [I]0-i shall do [her]336-the witch - wife mortal scathe ; so beware by the token of the grey edges of battle . [She]336-the witch - wife drew aback , and was as a spiteful and angry cat , and there was no loveliness in [her]336-the witch - wife ; and [she]336-the witch - wife said : [Thou]2853-thou liest , and [thou]2853-thou hatest [me]0-i ; see [thou]2853-thou to it , both for [thyself]2854-thyself and [thy]2853-thou loveling . And [she]336-the witch - wife turned about and strode out of [the chamber]292-the chamber ; but [I]0-i arose and clad [myself]0-i in haste , and took [my]0-i naked sword in [my]0-i hand . But before [I]0-i went , [I]0-i looked around , and espied an ambry fashioned in the wall of the bed - lane , and the door was half open ; and [the said ambry]2856-the said ambry was wrought of the daintiest , all of gold and pearl and gems ; and [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i : Herein is some treasure , and this is a tide of war . So [I]0-i opened the ambry , and within [it]2856-the said ambry was even more gloriously wrought than without ; and there was nought therein , save a little flask of crystal done about with bands of gold set with great and goodly gems . So [I]0-i took the said flask and went [my]0-i ways hastily to [[my]0-i own chamber]2857-my own chamber , and there [I]0-i looked at the said flask and took out the stopple ; and there was a liquor therein , white like to water , but of a spicy smell , sweet , fresh , and enheartening . So [I]0-i yet thought this was some great treasure , and that much hung upon it , could [I]0-i find out unto what use it might be put . And [I]0-i said : To - morrow [we]2858-we will put it to the proof . Then [I]0-i put the said flask under [my]0-i pillow , and laid [my]0-i sword by [my]0-i side and slept , and was not ill - content so far . But on the morrow , when [I]0-i met [[my]0-i fellows]2859-my fellows , [they]2859-my fellows asked [me]0-i how [I]0-i had sped , and [I]0-i told [them]2859-my fellows , Well , and that [we]2858-we would talk the matter over under [our]2858-we tree of counsel . So [we]2858-we went down into [the hall]1193-the hall , where [we]2858-we met [the witch - lady]2861-the witch - lady ; and [I]0-i looked for it that [she]2861-the witch - lady would be angry and fierce with [me]0-i ; but it went far otherwise ; for [she]2861-the witch - lady was blithe and buxom , and abounding in endearments more than [I]0-i could away with . But this [I]0-i noted , that [her]2861-the witch - lady eyes wandered , and [her]2861-the witch - lady speech faltered at whiles , and ever [she]2861-the witch - lady seemed to be seeking somewhat ; and withal that [her]2861-the witch - lady caressing hands were seeking if they could aught stowed away in the bosom of [my]0-i coat . But all was nought , for as [we]2858-we came to the door of [the hall]1193-the hall [I]0-i gave [Baudoin]115-baudoin the flask to guard until [we]2858-we should come to [[our]2858-we apple - tree of rede]2863-our apple - tree of rede . Wherefore the she - wolf went red and white by turns , and fumed , and fretted [her]2861-the witch - lady bedizenments with unrestful hands , and when [she]2861-the witch - lady should let [us]2858-we go [our]2858-we ways , [she]2861-the witch - lady lingered and looked back oft , and was loth to depart ere [she]2861-the witch - lady had gotten what [she]2861-the witch - lady lacked , and that , forsooth , was the said flasket . But when [we]2858-we were without [the house]311-the house , [I]0-i bade [[our]2858-we fellows]1859-our fellows go with [me]0-i to another place than [the wonted apple - tree of rede]2866-the wonted apple - tree of rede , and [they]1859-our fellows understood [my]0-i word , and [I]0-i led [them]1859-our fellows to [a little grassy plain without [the orchard]456-the orchard]2867-a little grassy plain without the orchard , where was no covert for a wide space about [it]2867-a little grassy plain without the orchard , nought but the one linden - tree under which now [we]2858-we sat . There [I]0-i told [them]1859-our fellows all the tale of the last night and of the flasket , and put before [them]1859-our fellows all that was in [my]0-i mind to do that evening at the banquet , and [they]1859-our fellows both of [them]1859-our fellows yeasaid it . But what it was , that shall [ye]2869-ye hear anon when [we]2858-we carried the matter through ; but [I]0-i bade [Baudoin]115-baudoin still carry the flasket till the evening . Thereafter [we]2858-we spake of other matters ; but soon [we]2858-we had good cause to rejoice that [we]2858-we had not talked [our]2858-we talk under the apple - tree ( whereas [I]0-i doubted not that [the witch]394-the witch would spy upon [us]2858-we there ) , for not long had [we]2858-we been at [our]2858-we talk ere , looking that way , [we]2858-we saw the evil creature by the hedge of [the orchard]456-the orchard and gazing over at [us]2858-we . [We]2858-we arose then , and came to [her]394-the witch as if nought had happened ; and [she]394-the witch bade [us]2858-we walk [the garden]1076-the garden with [her]394-the witch , and [we]2858-we yeasaid it , and went with [her]394-the witch , and paced about amidst the flowers and lay on the blossomed grass . [Forsooth]108-birdalone , both to [her]394-the witch and to [us]2858-we the time hung heavy on hand . And meseemed that the sleekness and fairness of [her]394-the witch body was worsened since yesterday , and [she]394-the witch was pale and haggard , and [her]394-the witch eyes were wandering and afraid . Now [she]394-the witch bade [us]2858-we come a little further into [the garden]1076-the garden and eat a morsel at noon ; and [we]2858-we arose , and [she]394-the witch brought [us]2858-we to where were vines trellised all about and overhead , so that it was like [a fair green cloister]2874-a fair green cloister ; and there was a board laid and spread with many dainties of meat and drink . And [she]394-the witch bade [us]2858-we sit . Verily [we]2858-we had but little stomach to that dinner ; and [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , Poison ! poison ! and even so [[my]0-i fellows]2859-my fellows deemed , as afterwards [they]2859-my fellows told [me]0-i . And [I]0-i saw [Baudoin]115-baudoin loosen [his]115-baudoin sword in the sheath , and [I]0-i knew that [his]115-baudoin mind was to smite at once if [he]115-baudoin saw aught amiss . And [I]0-i , who sat next to [the witch]394-the witch , laid [my]0-i hand on a little dagger which [I]0-i wore at [my]0-i girdle . [She]394-the witch also saw this , and turned as pale as death , and sat trembling before [us]2858-we ; and whatso [we]2858-we ate or drank at that board under the rustling vine - leaves , [she]394-the witch gave unto [us]2858-we with [her]394-the witch own hand ; and then [we]2858-we wotted full surely that [she]394-the witch had meant [our]2858-we deaths there and then , but was cowed by the fierce eyes of [Baudoin]115-baudoin and the threat of [my]0-i hand . [Withal]117-withal it seemed that [she]394-the witch might not bear it to sit there long amongst [us]2858-we . [She]394-the witch rose up and smiled on [us]2858-we as ghastly as a corpse , and gave [us]2858-we leave , and went hurrying into [the house]311-the house . And right glad [we]2858-we were to be at rest from [her]394-the witch . Yet as [we]2858-we [ourselves]2858-we durst not go far away from [the house]311-the house , lest some new thing might happen , neither could [she]394-the witch leave [us]2858-we quite alone , but thrice again that afternoon at some turn of [the garden]1076-the garden , or [orchard]2880-orchard , or [meadow]2881-meadow , [we]2858-we came upon [her]394-the witch wan face and eyes full of all hate and staring pride , and [she]394-the witch enforced [her]394-the witch to smile upon [us]2858-we , and turned away with some idle word . At last the sun began to sink , and [we]2858-we went to [the perron of [the house]311-the house]2783-the perron of the house , and found [her]394-the witch standing to meet [us]2858-we in [her]394-the witch wonted way . But when [we]2858-we came up [she]394-the witch gave no hand to [any one of [us]2858-we]2884-any one of us but went up the stairs before [us]2858-we , and [we]2858-we followed with no word spoken . There was [the hall]1193-the hall with the lordly service on the board , and the wax - candles lighted all about , and the great vault of stone fair and stately over [it]1193-the hall . [We]2858-we went to the dais and the board and sat down , [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife in [her]336-the witch - wife gold and ivory chair at the board â€™s end , and [I]0-i at [her]394-the witch right hand and looking down [the hall]1193-the hall , [[my]0-i two fellows]2888-my two fellows facing [me]0-i , with [their]2888-my two fellows backs to the clear of [the hall]1193-the hall . There [we]2858-we sat , and the meats and drinks were before [us]2858-we as dainty as ever erst ; but [we]2858-we put forth no hand to [them]2890-them , but sat staring at each other for some two minutes it might be , and [the witch]394-the witch looked from one to the other of [us]2858-we , and quaked that [her]394-the witch hands shook like palsy . Then [I]0-i rose up and put [my]0-i hand to [my]0-i bosom ( for [Baudoin]115-baudoin had given [me]0-i the flasket ere [we]2858-we came to [the perron]2892-the perron ): [I]0-i spake in a loud voice , and it sounded wild and hard in [the goodly hall]2893-the goodly hall : [[My]0-i lady]603-my lady , [I]0-i said , [thou]2895-thou art looking but pale now , and sick and downcast . Drink now to [me]0-i out of this precious flasket , and [thou]2895-thou shalt be whole and well . And therewith [I]0-i held the flasket aloft ; but [her]603-my lady face changed horribly ; [she]603-my lady sprang up in [her]603-my lady chair and reached out [her]603-my lady arm to clutch at the flasket , screaming like an eagle therewith . But [I]0-i thrust [her]603-my lady back into the chair with [my]0-i left hand ; and therewith arose [Baudoin]115-baudoin and [Arthur]150-arthur , and caught [her]603-my lady by the shoulders , and bound [her]603-my lady fast to the chair with cords that [they]2896-they had gotten thereto . But when [she]603-my lady got [her]603-my lady breath [she]603-my lady yelled out : Ah , now shall all tumble together , [[my]0-i proudful house]2897-my proudful house and [I]0-i under it ! Loose [me]0-i , [traitors]2898-traitors ! loose [me]0-i , [fools]5283-fools ! and give [me]0-i one draught of the water of might , and then shall [I]0-i tell [you]5283-fools all , and [ye]5283-fools shall go free with [your]5283-fools thralls if [ye]5283-fools will . Ah ! [ye]5283-fools will not loose [me]0-i ? [ye]5283-fools will not ? Well then , at least [ye]5283-fools , [the fools]2900-the fools , shall be under it , and [they]2900-the fools also , [the she - traitors]2901-the she - traitors , [the scourged and tormented fools that might not save [themselves]2900-the fools from [me]0-i]2902-the scourged and tormented fools that might not save themselves from me . O loose [me]0-i ! loose [me]0-i ! [thou]2903-thou in whose arms [I]0-i have lain so many a night , and give [me]0-i to drink of the proud water of might ! So [she]0-i yelled ; and now had all the fairness gone from [her]0-i body : flaggy and yellow were [her]0-i limbs , and [she]0-i looked all over as [her]0-i face , a lump of stupid and cruel pride , and [her]0-i words lost meaning and changed into mere bestial howling .
