An hour after noon [they]6098-they rested in [a little dale of [the downland]6104-the downland]6109-a little dale of the downland where was [a pool and three thorn - bushes thereby]6111-a pool and three thorn - bushes thereby ; and when [they]6098-they had lighted down , [the old man]1380-the old man knelt before [Birdalone]108-birdalone and took [her]108-birdalone hand , and swore [himself]1380-the old man [[her]108-birdalone man]5681-her man to do [her]108-birdalone will , whatso it were ; and then [he]1380-the old man stood up and bade [[his]1380-the old man sons]3034-his sons do likewise ; so [they]6098-they two knelt before [her]108-birdalone in turn , somewhat shy and abashed , for all that [they]6098-they were [such stout , bold fellows]6115-such stout , bold fellows , and found it hard to take [her]108-birdalone hand , and then when [they]6098-they had it in [theirs]6098-they , hard to let it go again . A score of miles and five [they]6098-they rode that day , and had no roof over [them]6098-they at night save the naked heaven , but to [Birdalone]108-birdalone that was but little scathe : [they]6098-they made a shift to have some fire by [them]6098-they , and [the three men]6116-the three men sat long about it that even while [Birdalone]108-birdalone told [them]6116-the three men somewhat of [her]108-birdalone life ; and as [she]108-birdalone told of [the House under the Wood]4835-the house under the wood and the Great Water , [Gerard]173-gerard had some inkling of whereabouts it was ; but was nought so sure , because , as abovesaid in this tale , seldom did any from the world of [men]204-men venture in [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw , or know of [the Great Water from [its]6119-the great water from its banks that gave unto the forest banks that gave unto [the forest]6120-the forest]6119-the great water from its banks that gave unto the forest . In like wise [they]6098-they rode the next day , and came at eventide to [a thorp in [a fair little dale of the downland]6122-a fair little dale of the downland]6121-a thorp in a fair little dale of the downland , and there [they]6098-they guested with [the shepherd - folk]6123-the shepherd - folk , who wondered much at the beauty of [Birdalone]108-birdalone , so that at first [they]6098-they scarce durst venture to draw nigh unto [her]108-birdalone until [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons had had some familiar converse with [them]6098-they ; then indeed [they]6098-they exceeded in kindness toward [them]6098-they , in [their]6098-they rough upland fashion , but ever found it hard to keep [their]6098-they eyes off [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and that the more after [they]6098-they had heard the full sweetness of [her]108-birdalone voice ; whereas [she]108-birdalone sang to [them]6098-they certain songs which [she]108-birdalone had learned in [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , though it made [her]108-birdalone heart sore ; but [she]108-birdalone deemed [she]108-birdalone must needs pay [that kindly folk]6126-that kindly folk for [their]6126-that kindly folk guestful and blithe ways . And thereafter [they]6098-they sang to the pipe and the harp [their]6098-they own downland songs ; and this [she]108-birdalone found strange , that whereas [her]108-birdalone eyes were dry when [she]108-birdalone was singing the songs of love of [the knighthood]6127-the knighthood , the wildness of the shepherd - music drew the tears from [her]108-birdalone , would [she]108-birdalone , would [she]108-birdalone not . [Homelike]6128-homelike and dear seemed [the green willowy dale]6129-the green willowy dale to [her]108-birdalone , and in the night ere [she]108-birdalone slept , and [she]108-birdalone lay quiet amidst of [the peaceful people]6130-the peaceful people , [she]108-birdalone could not choose but weep again , for pity of the bitter - sweet of [her]108-birdalone own love , and for pity of [the wide world]6131-the wide world withal , and all the ways of its many folk that lay so new before [her]108-birdalone . Chapter III ~ [They]6098-they Come to [the City of the Five Crafts]6070-the city of the five crafts , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone Meets with [the Poor - Wife]247-the poor - wife [They]6098-they made not so much way that [they]6098-they came to [the Five Crafts]67-the five crafts on the fourth day , but lay under the bare heavens in a dale below [the big swell of [the downland]6104-the downland]6134-the big swell of the downland , whereof [Gerard]173-gerard spake . But betimes in the morning [Birdalone]108-birdalone arose and stirred up [[her]108-birdalone men]6136-her men , and [they]6136-her men gat to horse , and rode [the hill]1081-the hill before [them]6136-her men till [they]6136-her men came on to the crest thereof . Then [Birdalone]108-birdalone cried aloud with joy to see [the lovely land]6138-the lovely land before [her]108-birdalone , and the white walls and [the towers of [the great city]6140-the great city]6139-the towers of the great city , whereas [Greenford]39-greenford was but small beside [it]39-greenford . So [they]6098-they rode down into [the frank]6141-the frank , and entered the gates of [the city]6142-the city a little after noon , and again was [Birdalone]108-birdalone in all amaze at the going to and fro in [the streets]3007-the streets and the thronging of [the markets]6144-the markets , and [the divers folk]6145-the divers folk , as [chapmen]6146-chapmen and [men - at - arms]1749-men - at - arms , and [craftsmen]6148-craftsmen and [lords]1887-lords , who used [the said city]6069-the said city ; and to say sooth , somewhat [her]108-birdalone heart sank within [her]108-birdalone , and it seemed to [her]108-birdalone that it would be hard and troublous to have to deal with [so much folk]6151-so much folk , and that [they]6151-so much folk must needs go past [her]108-birdalone on the right hand and the left without heeding [her]108-birdalone life . Howsoever , [Gerard]173-gerard , who knew [the city]6142-the city , brought [her]108-birdalone to [a fair hostel]6153-a fair hostel , where [she]108-birdalone was well lodged , [she]108-birdalone and [[her]108-birdalone men]6136-her men . Straightway , then , before [she]108-birdalone went out into [the streets]3007-the streets again , [she]108-birdalone fell to getting together what [she]108-birdalone had of fine broidered work and of fair script , and to finishing what [she]108-birdalone had unfinished . And [she]108-birdalone sent forth [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons to find out where was the market for such goods , and if [she]108-birdalone would have leave to sell the same therein , or anywhere in [the town]305-the town ; and [Gerard]173-gerard found [the hall of [the embroiderers]6159-the embroiderers]6158-the hall of the embroiderers , and therein [the master of the craft]6160-the master of the craft , and [he]173-gerard received the carle courteously when [he]173-gerard heard that there was fine work come to [town]3028-town , and did [him]173-gerard to wit that [none in any such craft]6162-none in any such craft might have freedom of [the market]314-the market save by leave of [the guild of the craft]6164-the guild of the craft ; but , said [he]173-gerard , [the guilds]6165-the guilds were open - handed and courteous , and were nowise wo nt to refuse the said leave , were the work good and true ; and [he]173-gerard bade [Gerard]173-gerard withal tell [[his]173-gerard mistress]6166-his mistress that [she]6166-his mistress were best to bring samplings of [her]6166-his mistress work to [the Guildhall]6167-the guildhall so soon as [she]6166-his mistress might . So the very next day went [Birdalone thither]108-birdalone , and found [the master]2080-the master [a well - looked tall man of some five - and - forty winters]6169-a well - looked tall man of some five - and - forty winters , who looked on [her]6166-his mistress from the first as if [he]2080-the master deemed it were no ill way of wearing the time . To [this man]1669-this man [she]6166-his mistress showed [her]6166-his mistress work , and though [he]2080-the master found it not easy to take [his]2080-the master eyes off [Birdalone]108-birdalone [herself]6166-his mistress , yet when [he]2080-the master looked at [her]6166-his mistress handiwork , [he]2080-the master found it better than very good , and [he]2080-the master said to [her]6166-his mistress : [Damsel]5201-damsel , here is what will be sought for at a great price by [the great lords]6172-the great lords and [ladies of [the land]198-the land]6173-ladies of the land , and [the rich burgesses]6175-the rich burgesses , and especially by [the high prelates]6176-the high prelates ; and so much of it as [thou]6166-his mistress hast a mind to do is so much coined gold unto [thee]6166-his mistress ; and now [I]2080-the master see [thee]6166-his mistress what [thou]6166-his mistress art , [I]2080-the master were fain that [thou]6166-his mistress gathered good to [thee]6166-his mistress . But as diligent as [thou]6166-his mistress mayst be , [thou]6166-his mistress hast but one pair of hands , wonderful soothly , and yet but one pair . [He]2080-the master broke off at that word , for [he]2080-the master was verily staring at [her]6166-his mistress hands , and longing to see more of [her]6166-his mistress arms than the wrists only , so that [he]2080-the master scarce knew what [he]2080-the master was saying . Then [he]2080-the master turned red and said : Soothly [I]2080-the master wot that [no other hands save [thine]6178-thine]6177-no other hands save thine may do such needlework , or make the draughts for [them]6178-thine . But [thou]6166-his mistress wilt need [women]420-women - [servants]1091-servants to help [thee]6166-his mistress , both in dighting [the house]311-the house for [thee]6166-his mistress ( for this big old carle here will be scarce meet thereto ) and as [apprentices]6182-apprentices to help [thee]6166-his mistress about the work itself ; and if [thou]6166-his mistress wilt , [I]2080-the master shall seek the best ones out for [thee]6166-his mistress . Moreover [I]2080-the master must tell [thee]6166-his mistress , that though [I]2080-the master know for sure how that [no woman in [the world]417-the world]6183-no woman in the world may work such needlework as thine , yet whiles there cometh hither [a woman of middle age]6185-a woman of middle age , [a woman worn by troubles , pious , meek , and kind]6186-a woman worn by troubles , pious , meek , and kind ; and by [St. Lucia]176-st. lucia ! now [I]2080-the master look on [thee]6166-his mistress again , [she]6166-his mistress might be somewhat like unto [thee]6166-his mistress , were [she]6166-his mistress young and fresh - looking and strong as [thou]6166-his mistress art . Now [this woman]412-this woman [I]2080-the master say , and thereat [I]2080-the master marvel , doeth needlework that is somewhat after the manner of thine , and which seemed to [us]6188-our excellent till [I]2080-the master had seen thine . Good livelihood [she]6166-his mistress earneth thereby , and is diligent therein ; but [she]6166-his mistress hath no heart to get [apprentices]6182-apprentices , or be made one of [[our]6188-our guild]6190-our guild , both of which were lawful to [her]6166-his mistress as to [thee]6166-his mistress , [lovely damsel]6191-lovely damsel . But now [I]2080-the master shall counsel [her]6166-his mistress to be made of [[our]6188-our guild]6190-our guild along with [thee]6166-his mistress , if [thou]6166-his mistress wilt have it so , and then may [ye]6166-his mistress both have [three apprentices]6193-three apprentices each , and may make in [[our]6188-our city]6194-our city [a goodly school]6195-a goodly school , so that [[our]6188-our guild]6190-our guild shall be glorified thereby , for there will be none such work in [the world]417-the world . How sayest [thou]6166-his mistress ? [She]6166-his mistress thanked [him]2080-the master much , and yeasaid [him]2080-the master , and thought in [her]6166-his mistress heart that such work which would keep [her]6166-his mistress hands and [her]6166-his mistress head both busy , would solace the grief of [her]6166-his mistress heart , and wear away the time , that [she]6166-his mistress might live till hope might peradventure arise in [her]6166-his mistress . Then said [the master]2080-the master : There is one thing else , that is , [[thy]6166-his mistress dwelling - place]6199-thy dwelling - place ; and if [thou]6166-his mistress wilt [I]2080-the master shall hire [thee]6166-his mistress [a house in [the street of the Broiderers]6201-the street of the broiderers]6200-a house in the street of the broiderers , [a goodly one]6202-a goodly one : sooth to say , that same is [mine]2080-the master own , so [thou]6166-his mistress mayst deem that [I]2080-the master tell [thee]6166-his mistress hereof to [mine]2080-the master own gain ; and that may be ( and [he]6166-his mistress reddened therewith ) ; but there is this in it , that if [thou]6166-his mistress lackest money [I]2080-the master shall let [thee]6166-his mistress live therein without price till [thou]6166-his mistress shalt have earned more than enough to pay [me]2080-the master . [Birdalone]108-birdalone thanked [him]6166-his mistress well , but [she]108-birdalone did [him]6166-his mistress to wit that [she]108-birdalone was nowise penniless ; and presently [she]108-birdalone departed well pleased , though [she]108-birdalone deemed that [the said master]6203-the said master was well - nigh more friendly than might be looked for . And the next day [he]6166-his mistress came to [her]108-birdalone in [the hostelry]6204-the hostelry , and without more ado brought [her]108-birdalone to [the house in [the street of the Broiderers]6201-the street of the broiderers]6205-the house in the street of the broiderers , and [she]108-birdalone found [it]6205-the house in the street of the broiderers fair and well plenished , and so [she]108-birdalone fell to work to get all things ready . Now the next week was the day appointed when [she]108-birdalone should be received into [[the broiderers]6207-the broiderers â€™[2080-the master] guild]6208-the broiderers â€™ guild , and the day before came [the master]2080-the master aforesaid to see [Birdalone]108-birdalone . Sooth to say , [he]2080-the master had not failed to come to see [her]108-birdalone every day , on one pretence or another , since the first day [they]3072-they had met , but ever [he]2080-the master did to [her]108-birdalone with all honour and simply . But on this day [he]2080-the master brought with [him]2080-the master [the woman]237-the woman skilful of [her]237-the woman hands , to show [her]237-the woman unto [Birdalone]108-birdalone , who received [her]237-the woman gladly , and thereafter [Master Jacobus]177-jacobus left [them]3072-they alone together . [The said woman]3074-the said woman looked worn and aged indeed , but was not of more than five - and - forty winters even by seeming , after the first look at [her]3074-the said woman ; [she]3074-the said woman was somewhat tall and well - knit , [her]3074-the said woman face well shapen , and [her]3074-the said woman hair yet goodly . There was a kind look in the eyes of [her]3074-the said woman , as if [she]3074-the said woman might love anyone with whom [she]3074-the said woman lived that would be kind to [her]3074-the said woman . Meek , or rather over - meek , of mien [she]3074-the said woman was , and it seemed of [her]3074-the said woman that [she]3074-the said woman had been sore scared and oppressed one while or another . So when [Master Jacobus]177-jacobus was gone , [Birdalone]108-birdalone set [her]3074-the said woman down on the settle beside [her]3074-the said woman , and spake to [her]3074-the said woman full sweetly and kindly , and [the woman]237-the woman spake little in turn save answering simply to [her]3074-the said woman questions . [Birdalone]108-birdalone asked where [she]3074-the said woman was kinned , and [she]3074-the said woman answered : In Utterhay . Then said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : Within these last few days [I]0-i have heard [that town]3076-that town named twice or thrice , and never before , as [meseemeth]3077-meseemeth ; and yet , hearing the name from [thy]3078-thy mouth , it seemeth to stir something in [me]0-i , as if [I]0-i had been [there]215-there one time and longed to be [there]215-there again . Is there aught in the place whereof [folk]4521-folk tell wide about , so that [I]0-i might have heard it told of and not noted it at the time ? Nay , [lady]493-lady , said [the dame]403-the dame , save perchance that [it]3076-that town is on the verge of [a very great and very evil wood]3084-a very great and very evil wood , otherwise [it]3076-that town was once [a merry town]3085-a merry town and of much resort from [the country - side]4792-the country - side . [Birdalone]108-birdalone looked on [her]403-the dame , and saw that the tears were coming from [her]403-the dame eyes and running down [her]403-the dame cheeks as [she]403-the dame spake ; so [she]108-birdalone said to [her]403-the dame : Why dost [thou]3087-thou weep , [mother]729-mother ? Is there aught [I]0-i may do to assuage [thy]3087-thou grief ? Said [the dame]403-the dame : [Thou]3087-thou art so kind to [me]0-i , and [thy]3087-thou voice is so dear and sweet , that [I]0-i can not choose but weep . Meseems it is because love of [thee]3087-thou hath taken [mine]0-i heart , and therewith is blended memory of past sorrow of [mine]0-i . [Thou]3087-thou askest [me]0-i if [thou]3087-thou mayest do aught to assuage [my]0-i grief ; [dear lady]3090-dear lady , [I]0-i am not grieved now , that has gone by ; nay , now [I]0-i am more than not grieved , [I]0-i am made happy , because [I]0-i am with [thee]3087-thou . But since [thou]3087-thou art so debonair with [me]0-i , [I]0-i will ask [thee]3087-thou to do somewhat for [me]0-i ; and that is , to tell [me]0-i of [thy]3087-thou life gone by ; [I]0-i mean , [sweet young damsel]3091-sweet young damsel , of [thy]3087-thou life when [thou]3087-thou wert [a little child]3092-a little child . Then [Birdalone]108-birdalone kissed [her]3090-dear lady and said : It goes to [my]0-i heart that [thou]3087-thou lovest [me]0-i ; for soon as [I]0-i set eyes on [thee]3087-thou [my]0-i heart went out to [thee]3087-thou ; and now belike [we]3093-we shall be [dear friends]1316-dear friends ; and that is a thing that shall avail [me]0-i much , to have [a friend who is so much older than [I]0-i , so that nought can come between [us]3093-we , of the love of [men]204-men and other griefs]3095-a friend who is so much older than i , so that nought can come between us , of the love of men and other griefs . [Yea]3097-yea , now , said [the dame]403-the dame , smiling somewhat sadly ; now do [I]0-i see the water standing in thine eyes , and [thy]3087-thou voice quavers . Is it so , [[thou]3087-thou lovely kind damsel]3099-thou lovely kind damsel , that [thou]3087-thou hast been grieved by love of [a man]217-a man ? Who then may prevail in love if [thou]3087-thou prevail not ? And [she]403-the dame fell to fondling [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s hand ; but [Birdalone]108-birdalone said : It is over - long to tell of all [my]0-i life , [mother]729-mother , though [I]0-i be so young ; but now [I]0-i will do as [thou]3087-thou badest [me]0-i , and tell [thee]729-mother somewhat of [my]0-i days when [I]0-i was little . And therewith [she]108-birdalone fell to telling [her]729-mother of [her]108-birdalone days in [the House under the Wood]4835-the house under the wood , and [the witch]394-the witch and [her]108-birdalone surliness and grimness , and of [her]108-birdalone love of the wild things , and how [she]108-birdalone waxed there . And [she]108-birdalone spake a long while , for the memory of those days seemed to lead [her]108-birdalone along , as though [she]108-birdalone verily were alive now in them ; and [the woman]237-the woman sat before [her]108-birdalone , gazing on [her]108-birdalone lovingly , till [Birdalone]108-birdalone stayed [her]108-birdalone tale at last and said : Now have [I]0-i told [thee]729-mother more than enough of a simple matter , and a life that was as that of a wild creature of [the woods]450-the woods . Now shalt [thou]729-mother , [mother]729-mother , tell [me]0-i somewhat of [thee]729-mother , and what was [thy]729-mother grief of [Utterhay]1-utterhay : for [thou]729-mother shalt find that the telling thereof shall solace [thee]729-mother . Ah ! so think [young folk]3107-young folk , said [the woman]237-the woman sadly , because there are many days left for [them]3107-young folk to hope in . But though the telling of [my]0-i sorrow be a fresh sorrow to [me]0-i , yet shalt [thou]729-mother hear it . It is but of the loss of [[my]0-i babe]3109-my babe ; but [she]237-the woman was of all [babes the fairest and the sweetest]3110-babes the fairest and the sweetest . Then [she]237-the woman fell to telling [Birdalone]108-birdalone all that concerning [the witch]394-the witch at [Utterhay]1-utterhay and [the poor - wife]247-the poor - wife that [ye]3113-ye have heard in the beginning of this book , until the time when [she]237-the woman left [the house]311-the house to buy meat for [the witch]394-the witch ; for [she]237-the woman [herself]237-the woman was [the said poor - wife]3116-the said poor - wife . And then [she]237-the woman told how [she]237-the woman came back again and found [[her]237-the woman guest]3117-her guest gone and [the child withal]3118-the child withal ; and though [she]237-the woman had wept for love of [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [she]237-the woman wept not at telling of this grief , but told it as a tale which had befallen some other one . And [she]237-the woman said : And so when [I]0-i had done running up and down like a wild thing , and asking of [the neighbours]2040-the neighbours with lack of breath and fierceness of speech who had taken [[my]0-i child]907-my child away from [me]0-i ; and when [I]0-i had gone up to the wood and even some way into it , and when [I]0-i had wandered up and down again , and night was falling , [I]0-i came back at last again to [[my]0-i poor house]2659-my poor house so weary with [my]0-i woe , that [I]0-i scarce knew what had befallen [me]0-i . And there upon the board lay the victual and drink which [I]0-i had brought , and the money which [the witch]394-the witch had given unto [me]0-i ; and despite of grief , hunger flamed up in [me]0-i at the sight , and [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i on to it and ate and drank , and so came to [myself]0-i , that is , to [my]0-i grief . But the next day [I]0-i ran about hither and thither , and wearied [folk]4521-folk with [my]0-i asking and [my]0-i woe ; but it was all of none avail . [The child]238-the child was gone away from [me]0-i . There is little more to tell of [me]0-i , [sweet lady]3125-sweet lady . If [I]0-i were to live , needs must [I]0-i take the poor price of [[my]0-i little one]265-my little one , to wit , [the witch]394-the witch â€™s money , and deal with [folk]4521-folk for [my]0-i livelihood ; wherefore [I]0-i bought [me]0-i cloth and silks , having now the wherewithal , and set to work on broidery , for even then was [I]0-i [a cunning needle - woman]3129-a cunning needle - woman . So were [God]114-god and the saints good to [me]0-i , and inclined [the folk]228-the folk to [me]0-i , that [they]228-the folk were good and piteous , and [I]0-i lacked not work nor due livelihood ; but after a while [I]0-i wearied of [Utterhay]1-utterhay , where [[my]0-i dear child]3131-my dear child should have been running about before [my]0-i feet ; and having by this time gotten a little money together , and being exceeding deft in [my]0-i craft , [I]0-i came on hither to live , and , praise be to [St. Ursula]178-st. ursula ! [I]0-i have found it easy to live : and praise be to All - hallows withal that [I]0-i have found [thee]3132-thou , who art so kind and lovely ; and [thou]3132-thou by seeming of the very age [[my]0-i child]907-my child should be if [she]907-my child be living : or how old art [thou]3132-thou , [dear lady]3090-dear lady ? [Birdalone]108-birdalone laid [her]108-birdalone hand on [her]108-birdalone breast , and [she]108-birdalone was turned pale , but [she]108-birdalone said in a low voice : [I]0-i deem that [I]0-i am of twenty summers . Then [they]3135-they both sat silent , till [Birdalone]108-birdalone might master the fluttering of [her]108-birdalone heart , and [she]108-birdalone said : Now meseems [I]0-i have a memory even earlier than those [I]0-i told [thee]3136-thee erst . [A woman]235-a woman took [me]0-i out of a basket and set [me]0-i on the back of an ass , and [I]0-i looked about , and [I]0-i was in a grassy lawn of [the woods]450-the woods ; and [I]0-i saw a squirrel run up a tree - trunk before [me]0-i , and wind round the tree and hide [him]3139-him ; and then [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i hands and cried out to [him]3139-him ; and then came [the woman]237-the woman unto [me]0-i , and gave [me]0-i wood - strawberries to eat out of [her]237-the woman hand . Brake out [the poor - wife]247-the poor - wife thereat , pale and trembling : Tell [me]0-i now , [[my]0-i child]907-my child , hast [thou]907-my child any memory of what [the woman]237-the woman was who set [thee]907-my child on the ass and gave [thee]907-my child the strawberries ? [Birdalone]108-birdalone looked on [her]247-the poor - wife , and scanned [her]247-the poor - wife face closely , and then shook [her]247-the poor - wife head , and said : Nay , it was not [thou]907-my child , [mother]729-mother . Nay , surely ; nay , surely , said [the woman]237-the woman ; but think again . Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , speaking slowly : Was it [[my]0-i mistress]4401-my mistress then ? [She]237-the woman was [a tall woman]3147-a tall woman , somewhat thin and bony , with goodly red hair and white - skinned , but thin - lipped . Quoth [the poor - wife]247-the poor - wife : No , no ; it is of no use ; nought such was [she]237-the woman . Then [Birdalone]108-birdalone looked up and said eagerly : Yea , but it was [her]237-the woman other shape belike : therein was [she]237-the woman [a tall woman , dark - haired , hook - nosed , and hawk - eyed , as if of thirty summers]3149-a tall woman , dark - haired , hook - nosed , and hawk - eyed , as if of thirty summers ; [a stark woman]3150-a stark woman . Hast [thou]907-my child seen such ? dost [thou]907-my child remember [her]237-the woman ? [The woman]237-the woman sprang up and cried out , and was like to have fallen , but [Birdalone]108-birdalone arose and held [her]237-the woman in [her]108-birdalone arms and comforted [her]237-the woman , and set [her]237-the woman in [her]108-birdalone seat again and knelt before [her]237-the woman ; and presently [the poor - wife]247-the poor - wife came to [herself]247-the poor - wife and said : [[My]0-i child]907-my child , [thou]907-my child sayest do [I]0-i remember [her]237-the woman ; how shall [I]0-i ever forget [her]237-the woman ? [she]237-the woman was [the thief who stole [[my]0-i child]907-my child]3154-the thief who stole my child . Therewith [she]247-the poor - wife slid from off [her]247-the poor - wife seat , and knelt by [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and stooped low down on the floor as if [the tall maiden]3156-the tall maiden were but [a little one]3157-a little one , and [she]247-the poor - wife fell to kissing [her]237-the woman and patting [her]237-the woman , [her]237-the woman face and [her]237-the woman hands , and all about ; and said , sobbing and yet smiling : Suffer [me]0-i a little , [[my]0-i child]907-my child , [[mine]0-i own lovely child]3159-mine own lovely child ! For in good sooth [I]0-i am [[thy]907-my child mother]323-thy mother , and it is long since [I]0-i have seen [thee]907-my child : but hearken , when [I]0-i come quite to [myself]0-i [I]0-i shall pray [thee]907-my child not to leave [me]0-i yet awhile , and [I]0-i shall pray [thee]907-my child to love [me]0-i . [Birdalone]108-birdalone clipped and kissed [her]907-my child , and said : [I]0-i love [thee]907-my child dearly , and never , never shall [I]0-i leave [thee]907-my child . Then [they]3161-they stood up , and [the mother]252-the mother took [Birdalone]108-birdalone by the shoulders , and held [her]108-birdalone a little aloof , and devoured [her]108-birdalone with [her]252-the mother eyes ; and [she]252-the mother said : [Yea]3163-yea , [thou]3164-thou hast grown tall , and belike wilt grow no taller : and how fair and lovely [thou]3164-thou hast grown ; and [thou]3164-thou that [wert]3165-wert born in [[a poor man]3166-a poor man â€™s house]3167-a poor man â€™s house ! no wonder that any should covet [thee]3164-thou . And [I]0-i , [I]0-i wonder if ever [I]0-i was as fair as [thou]3164-thou art ; forsooth many called [me]0-i fair for a little while ; and now behold [me]0-i ! Nay , [child]283-child and darling , let not [thy]3164-thou face grow downcast , for now shall [I]0-i know nought more of fear and grief ; and is it not like that [I]0-i shall grow fairer of flesh , and shapelier , in the happy days [we]3169-we shall dwell together ? And therewith [she]252-the mother took [her]3164-thou to [her]252-the mother arms , and it seemed as if [she]252-the mother might never have enough of clipping and embracing [her]3164-thou ; and [she]252-the mother would look at [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s hands and [her]108-birdalone feet and [her]108-birdalone arms , and stroke them and caress them ; and [she]252-the mother wondered at [her]108-birdalone body , as if [she]108-birdalone had been [a young mother]3170-a young mother eaten up with the love of [[her]108-birdalone firstborn]3171-her firstborn . And as for [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [she]108-birdalone was as glad of [[her]108-birdalone mother]318-her mother as might be ; and yet in [her]108-birdalone heart [she]108-birdalone wondered if perchance [one of [the fellowship]2477-the fellowship]3173-one of the fellowship might stray that way , and be partaker in [her]108-birdalone joy of [this newfound dear friend]3175-this newfound dear friend ; and [she]108-birdalone said , might it be [Viridis]108-birdalone ; but in [her]108-birdalone inmost heart , though [she]108-birdalone told it not to [herself]108-birdalone , [she]108-birdalone longed that [the Black Squire]119-arthur might find [her]108-birdalone out at last . Chapter IV ~ Of the Love of [[Gerard]173-gerard â€™s Sons]3176-gerard â€™s sons and of [Jacobus]177-jacobus for [Birdalone]108-birdalone Now dwelt [Birdalone]108-birdalone in rest and peace when [she]108-birdalone had been taken into the guild along with [[her]108-birdalone mother]318-her mother , and [they]3178-they had taken [the due apprentices]3179-the due apprentices to [them]3178-they ; and [they]3178-they began to gather much of goods to [them]3178-they , for of fine broidery there was little done in the Five Crafts , and none at all that could be put beside [their]3178-they work , either for beauty of the draught of it , or for skill of handiwork . [She]108-birdalone declared unto [all folk]5415-all folk how that [the poor - wife]247-the poor - wife ( who had to name [Audrey]179-audrey ) was [[her]108-birdalone very mother]3182-her very mother , from whom [she]108-birdalone had been stolen in [her]108-birdalone youngest days ; but [she]108-birdalone told none any tale of how [she]108-birdalone was stolen . And [the twain]3183-the twain dwelt together in the greatest loving - kindness ; and it was with [Audrey]179-audrey as [she]108-birdalone had forecast , that now [her]179-audrey days were happy , and [she]179-audrey living in all ease and content , that the goodliness of [her]179-audrey youth came back to [her]179-audrey , and [she]179-audrey became [a fair woman]580-a fair woman as for [her]179-audrey years ; and therewith it grew to be clear that [the two]2249-the two were so much alike one to [the other]250-the other , that [all]881-all might see that [they]2249-the two were [mother]729-mother and [daughter]3189-daughter . [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard two sons]3057-his two sons [she]179-audrey maintained yet as [[her]179-audrey men]6136-her men ; and not only were [they]2249-the two of much use to [her]179-audrey in fetching and carrying , but also true it is that [her]179-audrey beauty was so manifest , that [she]179-audrey whiles needed [a stout lad]3192-a stout lad weaponed at [her]179-audrey back when [she]179-audrey was in [the streets]3007-the streets or amidst the throng of [the market]314-the market ; and many were [they]2249-the two , and [whiles of the highest]3195-whiles of the highest , who craved love of [her]179-audrey , [some with honour]3196-some with honour , and [some with lack of it]3197-some with lack of it . Of these , forsooth , were but two that anywise troubled [her]179-audrey ; and the most trouble was this , that [she]179-audrey might not fail to see that the love of [her]179-audrey had entered into the hearts of the two [Gerardsons]180-the gerardsons , [Robert]174-robert and [Giles]175-giles gerardson ; so that times were when [she]179-audrey deemed [she]179-audrey must even send [them]3198-their away , but when it came to the point [she]179-audrey had not the heart thereto ; though none other remedy there seemed , so sorely as [their]3198-their souls were wounded by longing for [her]179-audrey . It is not to be said that [they]3198-their ever spake to [her]179-audrey thereof , or wittingly wearied [her]179-audrey with signs of love ; but [they]3198-their could not so easily cover it up but that it was ever before [her]179-audrey eyes . But [she]179-audrey suffered it all for friendship â€™s sake and for [their]3198-their true service , and in all friendliness did what [she]179-audrey might to solace [their]3198-their grief . [Forsooth]108-birdalone so good and true [she]179-audrey found that [father]1419-father - kind , and [the young men so goodly and kind]3200-the young men so goodly and kind , that [she]179-audrey said to [herself]179-audrey , had [she]179-audrey not [another man lying in [her]179-audrey heart]3201-another man lying in her heart , [she]179-audrey might well have chosen one of those twain for [her]179-audrey very speech - friend and [true lover]3202-true lover . The second wooer that troubled [her]179-audrey was [the master]2080-the master , [Jacobus]177-jacobus , who , when but three months were worn of [her]179-audrey dwelling in [[her]179-audrey house]3204-her house , did all openly crave [her]179-audrey love and offer [her]179-audrey marriage , [he]2080-the master being [a man unwedded]3205-a man unwedded . Sore was [her]179-audrey heart that [she]179-audrey must needs gainsay [him]2080-the master , so kind and courteous as [he]2080-the master had been to [her]179-audrey at [their]3206-their first coming together ; though this indeed is sooth , that straightway , so soon as [he]2080-the master saw [her]179-audrey , [he]2080-the master fell into the captivity of [her]179-audrey love . Howsoever , gainsay [him]2080-the master [she]179-audrey needs must , and [he]2080-the master took the naysay so hardly that [he]2080-the master was scarce like [a man before [her]179-audrey]3207-a man before her , and wept and prayed and lamented many times over , till [she]179-audrey wearied of it , and well - nigh fell to loathing [him]2080-the master . So that it came to this at last , that one day [she]179-audrey spake to [him]2080-the master and said that [she]179-audrey might no longer bear it , but must seek [another house]3208-another house and leave [his]2080-the master . There then was the to - do , for [he]2080-the master fell on [his]2080-the master knees before [her]179-audrey , and kissed [her]179-audrey feet , would [she]179-audrey , would [she]179-audrey not , and cried out in [his]2080-the master grief , till at last for pure weariness of [his]2080-the master folly [she]179-audrey gave way unto [him]2080-the master , and said that [she]179-audrey would still abide [there]215-there ; whereon [he]2080-the master rose up from [her]179-audrey and went away with all the grief run off [him]2080-the master for that time , and as glad [a man]217-a man to look on as [you]3211-you might see on a summer â€™s day . But the next morning [he]2080-the master came unto [her]179-audrey again , and [she]179-audrey thinking all was begun afresh , made [him]2080-the master no glad countenance ; but [he]2080-the master stood up before [her]179-audrey and spake friendly , and said how that [she]179-audrey was in the right of it , and that if [they]3212-they both dwelt in [one house]3213-one house together [they]3212-they were like to have but a weary time of it , both [she]179-audrey and [he]2080-the master . But , said [he]2080-the master , [I]0-i will not that [thou]3214-thou shouldst depart out of [this house]2669-this house , for a goodly one it is , and full meet for [thee]179-audrey ; it is for [me]0-i to depart , and not for [thee]179-audrey . [I]0-i tell [thee]179-audrey , forsooth , that [I]0-i had from the first meant [this house]2669-this house as a gift from [me]0-i to [thee]179-audrey . And therewith [he]2080-the master drew from [his]2080-the master pouch a scroll , which was a deed of gift of [the said house]372-the said house , duly sealed and attested , and [he]2080-the master gave it into [her]179-audrey hands ; but [she]179-audrey was sore moved thereat , and at the demeanour of [him]2080-the master that morning , and [she]179-audrey let the scroll fall to the floor and wept for pity of [him]2080-the master , and reached out both [her]179-audrey hands , and [he]2080-the master kissed them , and then [her]179-audrey lips also , and sithence [he]2080-the master sat down beside [her]179-audrey . But [she]179-audrey said : Alas ! that [thou]179-audrey wilt give [me]0-i what [I]0-i may not take , and wouldst have of [me]0-i what [I]0-i may not give . But now [he]2080-the master waxed hotter , and said : This once [I]0-i command [thee]179-audrey to do [my]0-i will , and take [my]0-i gift . It will be nought to [my]0-i gain if [thou]179-audrey take it not ; for [I]0-i may not live in [this house]2669-this house when [thou]179-audrey art gone from [it]2669-this house ; and [I]0-i swear by [All - hallows]5184-all - hallows that [I]0-i will not let any have it to hire , nor will [I]0-i sell it , since [thou]179-audrey hast made it holy by dwelling therein . Yet was [she]179-audrey sore moved by [his]2080-the master generous fashion , and [she]179-audrey said : [I]0-i will take [thy]2080-the master gift then , and live here in honour of [thee]2080-the master and [thy]2080-the master friendship ; for well [I]0-i wot [thou]179-audrey hadst no mind to buy [me]0-i with [thy]2080-the master gift . So [she]179-audrey spake , and [he]2080-the master stood up stark and stern , and so departed , and kissed [her]179-audrey not again ; though meseems [she]179-audrey would have suffered [him]2080-the master had [he]2080-the master offered it . Nay , belike had [he]2080-the master at that moment pressed [his]2080-the master wooing somewhat masterfully , it is not so sure but [she]179-audrey might have yeasaid it , and suffered [him]2080-the master to [we]3220-we d [her]179-audrey and lead [her]179-audrey to bed ; though it would have gone ill both with [him]2080-the master and with [her]179-audrey thereafter . Thenceforth dwelt [Birdalone]108-birdalone with [[her]179-audrey mother]318-her mother and [[her]318-her mother maidens]3222-her maidens and [[her]318-her mother men]6136-her men in [that house]4456-that house , and it became famous in the Five Crafts because of [her]179-audrey beauty and [her]179-audrey wisdom , which minished not , but waxed day by day ; but therewithal as the time wore , waxed [her]179-audrey longing and sadness . But all this [she]179-audrey hid in [her]179-audrey own heart , and was debonair to all about [her]179-audrey , and so good to [poor folk]278-poor folk that [none]1359-none had a word save of blessing on [her]179-audrey beauty and [her]179-audrey wisdom . Chapter V ~ Of the Death of [Audrey]179-audrey , Mother to [Birdalone]108-birdalone . [She]179-audrey is Warned in A Dream to Seek [the Black Squire]119-arthur , and is Minded to Depart [the City of the Five Crafts]6070-the city of the five crafts , and Seek Again [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest Thus dwelt [Birdalone]108-birdalone in [the Five Crafts]6090-the five crafts in such rest and peace as [her]179-audrey heart would let [her]179-audrey ; and dear and good friends [she]179-audrey had about [her]179-audrey ; [[her]108-birdalone mother]318-her mother first , whose love and desire for love of [her]318-her mother made all things soft and dear unto [her]318-her mother . [Gerard]173-gerard and [the Gerardsons]180-the gerardsons were next , who were ever faithful and true unto [her]179-audrey , and deft both of hand and of mind , so that [they]3231-they wrought many things for [her]179-audrey avail . Then came [the master]2080-the master , [Jacobus]177-jacobus , who held [himself]2080-the master unwedded for [her]179-audrey sake , and though [he]2080-the master no longer dwelt in [the same house]3233-the same house with [her]179-audrey , might scarce endure to miss the sight of [her]179-audrey for two days running : [a dear friend [she]179-audrey deemed [him]2080-the master]3234-a dear friend she deemed him , as forsooth [he]2080-the master was , though whiles [he]2080-the master tormented and wearied [her]179-audrey , and belike had wearied [her]179-audrey more , but for the sorrow which lay on [her]179-audrey own heart , whereof it came that [she]179-audrey might not think of [any man]4683-any man as of one who might be [a lover]532-a lover , and so felt safe even with [so kind a friend]3237-so kind a friend and so stubborn in [his]2080-the master love as was [this one]385-this one . Moreover [he]2080-the master never again craved love of [her]179-audrey in so many words , but only in [his]2080-the master goings and comings so did , that it was clear how [he]2080-the master had [her]179-audrey , and the love of [her]179-audrey , ever in [his]2080-the master heart . Wore thus a five years ; and then came a sickness on [the city]6142-the city , and [many died thereof]3240-many died thereof ; and the said sickness entered into [[Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s house]3241-birdalone â€™s house , and slew [Audrey]179-audrey [[her]179-audrey mother]318-her mother , but spared all else therein . Thereby at the first was [Birdalone]108-birdalone so overwhelmed that [she]108-birdalone might heed nought , neither [her]108-birdalone craft nor [[her]108-birdalone friends]1305-her friends , nor the days to come on [the earth]432-the earth for [her]108-birdalone . And moreover when [she]108-birdalone came more to [herself]108-birdalone , which was not for many days , and asked why [[her]108-birdalone friend]433-her friend [Jacobus]177-jacobus had not been to see [her]108-birdalone the last days , [she]108-birdalone was told that [he]177-jacobus also was dead of the pestilence ; and [she]108-birdalone sorrowed for [him]177-jacobus sorely , for [she]108-birdalone loved [him]177-jacobus much , though not in the way [he]177-jacobus would . And now did [[the city]6142-the city and land of [the Five Crafts]6090-the five crafts]3247-the city and land of the five crafts begin to look unfriendly to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone fell to thinking that [she]108-birdalone must needs depart thence , as [she]108-birdalone well might do , whereas [she]108-birdalone had foison of goods : and at first it was in [her]108-birdalone mind to go with [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons unto [Utterhay]1-utterhay ; but then [she]108-birdalone deemed the thought of [[her]108-birdalone mother]318-her mother , and how [she]108-birdalone would be ever thinking of the loss and the gain , and the loss once more stood in the way ; and [she]108-birdalone turned one thing and another over in [her]108-birdalone mind , and might not face it . On a night , as [she]108-birdalone slept , came to [her]108-birdalone dreams of [her]108-birdalone days in [the House under the Wood]4835-the house under the wood ( as very seldom betid ) , and [the witch - wife]336-the witch - wife was speaking to [her]108-birdalone in friendly fashion ( as for [her]108-birdalone ) and blaming [her]108-birdalone for fleeing away , and was taunting [her]108-birdalone with the failure of [her]108-birdalone love , and therewith telling [her]108-birdalone how fair [a man]217-a man and lovesome was [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , and what a loss [she]108-birdalone had of [him]217-a man ; and [Birdalone]108-birdalone was hearkening and weeping for tenderness â€™ sake , while [the witch]394-the witch was unto [her]108-birdalone neither fearful nor irksome , and forsooth nought save a mouthpiece for words that both grieved [Birdalone]108-birdalone and yet were an eager pleasure unto [her]108-birdalone . But in the midst thereof , and ere the dream had time to change , [Birdalone]108-birdalone awoke , and it was an early morning of later spring , and the sky was clear blue and the sun shining bright , and the birds singing in [the garden]1076-the garden of [the house]311-the house , and in [the street]273-the street was the sound of [the early market - folk]6213-the early market - folk passing through [the street]273-the street with [their]6213-the early market - folk wares ; and all was fresh and lovely . [She]108-birdalone awoke sobbing , and the pillow was wet with [her]108-birdalone tears , and yet [she]108-birdalone felt as if something strange and joyous were going to betide [her]108-birdalone , and for joy of the love of life the heart beat fast in [her]108-birdalone bosom . [She]108-birdalone arose all darling naked as [she]108-birdalone was , and went to the window and looked out on the beauty of [the spring]6215-the spring , while the sound of the market - wains brought to [her]108-birdalone mind the thought of the meads , and [the streams of [the river]1845-the river]6216-the streams of the river , and [the woodsides]6218-the woodsides beyond [the city]6142-the city ; and [she]108-birdalone fell a - longing for [them]6220-them , as a while [she]108-birdalone knelt on the window - seat , half dreaming and asleep again , till the sun came round that way , and its beams fell upon [her]108-birdalone bosom and [her]108-birdalone arms ; and [she]108-birdalone stood up and looked on the fairness of [her]108-birdalone body , and a great desire took hold of [her]108-birdalone heart that it might be loved as it deserved by [him]6221-him whom [she]108-birdalone desired . And thus [she]108-birdalone stood [there]215-there till [she]108-birdalone became ashamed , and hastened to do on [her]108-birdalone raiment ; but even as [she]108-birdalone was about it , it came upon [her]108-birdalone that what [she]108-birdalone had will to do was to seek to [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and find out where was [her]108-birdalone love if there [he]6221-him were not , and so to seek [him]6221-him [the world]417-the world over till [she]108-birdalone found [him]6221-him . And such a flood of joy possessed [her]108-birdalone when [she]108-birdalone thought this , and so eager to begone [she]108-birdalone was , that [she]108-birdalone deemed every minute wasted till [she]108-birdalone were on [the road]1797-the road . Nevertheless , in a while , when [her]108-birdalone mind was steadied , [she]108-birdalone knew that [she]108-birdalone had somewhat to do ere [she]108-birdalone might be gone , and that here , as oft , it would be more haste less speed . So [she]108-birdalone abode a little , and then came into [[her]108-birdalone hall]4862-her hall duly dight , and found [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons there to serve [her]108-birdalone ; and [she]108-birdalone brake [her]108-birdalone fast , and bade [them]3034-his sons sit by [her]108-birdalone at table , as oft [she]108-birdalone did ; and [she]108-birdalone spake to [them]3034-his sons of this and that , and [Gerard]173-gerard answered lightly again ; but [the two Gerardsons]6228-the two gerardsons looked at [one another]1858-one another , as though [they]6228-the two gerardsons would speak and ask a question from time to time , but forbore because [they]6228-the two gerardsons durst not . But [Gerard]173-gerard looked on [them]3034-his sons , and deemed [he]173-gerard wotted what was in [their]3034-his sons minds ; so at last [he]173-gerard spake : [[Our]6228-the two gerardsons lady]477-our lady , both [I]108-birdalone , and meseemeth [[my]108-birdalone sons]6086-my sons also , deem that there is some tidings toward which are great unto [thee]477-our lady ; for thine eyes sparkle , and the red burns in [thy]477-our lady cheeks , and thine hands may not be quiet , nor [thy]477-our lady feet abide in one place ; wherefore [I]108-birdalone see that [thou]477-our lady hast something in [thy]477-our lady mind which strives to be forth of it . Now [thou]477-our lady wilt pardon [us]6228-the two gerardsons , [[our]6228-the two gerardsons dear lady]6232-our dear lady , that [we]6228-the two gerardsons ask concerning this , because it is in [our]6228-the two gerardsons love for [thee]477-our lady that [we]6228-the two gerardsons speak , lest there be some change toward which shall be a grief to [some of [us]6228-the two gerardsons]6233-some of us . [[My]108-birdalone men]6234-my men , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , flushing red , sooth it is that there is a change at hand , and [I]108-birdalone shall tell [you]6234-my men straightway what it is . Years ago [I]108-birdalone told [you]6234-my men that [I]108-birdalone was fleeing from [[my]108-birdalone friends]1795-my friends ; now the change hath betid that [I]108-birdalone would seek [them]1795-my friends again ; and needs must [I]108-birdalone leave [the Five Crafts]6090-the five crafts behind to do so . And moreover there is this ill word to be said , which [I]108-birdalone will say at once , to wit , that when [I]108-birdalone am but a little way gone from the Five Crafts [I]108-birdalone must wend the other deal of [my]108-birdalone journey birdalone , as [my]108-birdalone name is . [All those three]6237-all those three sat silent and aghast at that word , and [the young men]1982-the young men grew pale ; but after a while spake [Gerard]173-gerard : [[Our]1982-the young men lady]477-our lady most well - beloved , this word which [thou]6240-thou hast spoken , to wit , that [thou]6240-thou needest [us]1982-the young men no longer , [I]108-birdalone have looked to hear any time this five years ; and praise be to [the saints that it hath come late and not soon]6241-the saints that it hath come late and not soon . Now there is no more to be said but that [thou]6240-thou tell [us]1982-the young men what is [thy]6240-thou will that [we]1982-the young men should do . [Birdalone]108-birdalone hung [her]108-birdalone head awhile for sorrow of sundering from [these men]5229-these men ; then [she]108-birdalone looked up and said : It seemeth , [[my]108-birdalone friends]1795-my friends , as if [ye]5229-these men deem [I]108-birdalone have done [you]5229-these men a wrong in sundering [our]1982-the young men fellowship ; but all [I]108-birdalone may say hereon is to pray [you]5229-these men to pardon [me]108-birdalone , that [I]108-birdalone needs must go alone on [my]108-birdalone quest . And now what [I]108-birdalone would have [you]5229-these men do , is first of all to fetch hither [a notary and scrivener]6244-a notary and scrivener , that [he]6244-a notary and scrivener may draw up a deed of gift to [you]5229-these men , [Gerard]173-gerard and [Gerardsons]180-the gerardsons , of [this house]2669-this house and all that is therein , saving what money [I]108-birdalone may need for [my]108-birdalone journey , and gifts such as [I]108-birdalone shall bid [you]5229-these men to be given to [[my]108-birdalone workwomen]6246-my workwomen . [Ye]5229-these men must needs [yeasay]6247-yeasay this , or [ye]5229-these men are forsworn of [your]5229-these men behest to do [my]108-birdalone will . But furthermore , [I]108-birdalone will have [you]5229-these men to let [the workwomen of mine]6248-the workwomen of mine ( and [the head one ruling]6249-the head one ruling ) to hire [the aforesaid house]6250-the aforesaid house , if so [they]6248-the workwomen of mine will ; for now are [they]6248-the workwomen of mine skilled , and may well earn good livelihood by the work . But the next work is simple ; it is to furnish for [me]108-birdalone the array of [a young man]6251-a young man , with such armour as [I]108-birdalone may easily bear , to dight [me]108-birdalone for [[my]108-birdalone road]6252-my road . Forsooth [ye]5229-these men wot that not unseldom do [women]420-women use the custom of going arrayed like [men]204-men , when [they]420-women would journey with hidden head ; and [ye]5229-these men may happen upon such gear as hath been made for [such a woman]6255-such a woman rather than [any man]4683-any man ; but [thou]6257-thou shalt get [me]108-birdalone also a short bow and a quiver of arrows , for verily these be [my]108-birdalone proper weapons that [I]108-birdalone can deal with deftly . Now [my]108-birdalone last command is that , when all is done , maybe tomorrow , or maybe the next day , [ye]5229-these men bring [me]108-birdalone out of [the city]6142-the city and the frank of the Five Crafts , and bring [me]108-birdalone somewhat on [my]108-birdalone way over [the downs]6259-the downs , for [loth]6260-loth am [I]108-birdalone to part from [you]5229-these men ere needs must . Then [they]5229-these men knelt before [her]6255-such a woman and kissed [her]6255-such a woman hands , and [they]5229-these men were full of grief ; but [they]5229-these men saw that so it had to be . Thereafter [Gerard]173-gerard spake with [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons apart , and in a while came to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and said : [[Our]5229-these men lady]477-our lady , [we]5229-these men will do [your]6255-such a woman will in all wise ; but [we]5229-these men shall tell [thee]6255-such a woman , that the Five Crafts will look but strange to [us]5229-these men when [thou]6255-such a woman art gone , and that [we]5229-these men have a mind to betake [us]5229-these men to [Utterhay]1-utterhay and the land of [[our]5229-these men kindred]6263-our kindred . Wherefore [we]5229-these men pray [thee]6255-such a woman to give [this house that hath been so dear to [us]5229-these men]6264-this house that hath been so dear to us unto [[thy]6255-such a woman workwoman]6265-thy workwoman and [[her]6265-thy workwoman mates]6266-her mates ; for [we]5229-these men need it not , nor the hire thereof , but shall do well enough with what money or good [thou]6255-such a woman mayst give [us]5229-these men . Is this according to [thy]6255-such a woman will , or have [I]108-birdalone spoken rashly ? [She]108-birdalone said : [Ye]6255-such a woman are good and ungreedy , and [I]108-birdalone bless [you]6255-such a woman for it ; be it as [ye]6255-such a woman will ; and this the more , as [I]108-birdalone were fain that [ye]6255-such a woman go to [Utterhay]1-utterhay ; for whiles [I]108-birdalone have deemed that [I]108-birdalone [myself]108-birdalone am drawn thitherward , wherefore it may be that [we]5229-these men shall meet again in [that place]2386-that place . And when [she]108-birdalone had so spoken , [she]108-birdalone might not refrain [her]108-birdalone tears ; and [the Gerardsons]180-the gerardsons turned away , for [they]180-the gerardsons were ashamed , both that [they]180-the gerardsons should see [her]108-birdalone weep , or [she]108-birdalone [them]180-the gerardsons . But at last [she]108-birdalone called to [them]180-the gerardsons and said : Now make [we]5229-these men the speediest end [we]5229-these men may of this , for sorry work is the tarrying of farewell ; so [I]108-birdalone pray [you]180-the gerardsons , [[my]108-birdalone friends]1795-my friends , to go about the work [I]108-birdalone have bidden [you]180-the gerardsons . So all was done as [she]108-birdalone would , and the day after the morrow was [Birdalone]108-birdalone abiding the coming of [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons with the horses ; and despite of the sundering of [friends]404-friends and the perils that belike lay before [her]108-birdalone , [the world]417-the world seemed fair to [her]108-birdalone , and life beginning anew . And [she]108-birdalone made no doubt that [she]108-birdalone would soon be at [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and there find all things much as [she]108-birdalone had left [them]6273-them ; and there at least would be the welcome of [[her]108-birdalone dear friend]6274-her dear friend [Viridis]108-birdalone . Chapter VI ~ Of the Sundering of [Birdalone]108-birdalone from [Gerard]173-gerard and [[His]173-gerard Sons]3034-his sons Presently were the horses come with [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone gat to horse amongst [them]6273-them . [She]108-birdalone was armed in a light hauberk , and over it a long and loose surcoat that came down beneath the knee of [her]108-birdalone ; and a sallet [she]108-birdalone had upon [her]108-birdalone head , wide but light , so that not very much of [her]108-birdalone face was to be seen . [She]3255-she had made up [her]3255-she mind to this tale upon [the road]1797-the road , when [she]3255-she was among [folk]4521-folk , that [she]3255-she was under a vow not to do off [her]3255-she helm for a seven days â€™[108-birdalone] space . Withal [she]3255-she had covered up the lovely shapeliness of [her]3255-she legs with long boots of deer - leather , and [her]3255-she surcoat was wide - sleeved ; [she]3255-she was well hidden , and whereas [she]3255-she was [a tall and strong woman]3256-a tall and strong woman , [she]3255-she might well pass for [a young man]6251-a young man , slender and fair - faced . [She]3255-she was girt with a good sword , and [Gerard]173-gerard had gotten [her]3255-she [a strong horseman]3258-a strong horseman â€™s bow and a quiver full of arrows , wherewith , as aforesaid , [she]3255-she knew well how to deal ; wherefore [she]3255-she was by no means without defence . So [they]3259-they went [their]3259-they ways through [the streets]3007-the streets and out - a - gates ; and it must be said , that were not [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s thoughts turned toward [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and what [she]108-birdalone should meet [there]215-there , [her]108-birdalone heart had been somewhat sore at leaving [the city]6142-the city which had cherished [her]108-birdalone so well these years past ; nay , as it was , the shadow of the southern gate , as [she]108-birdalone past thereunder , smote somewhat cold upon [her]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone silently bade farewell to [the City of the Five Crafts]6070-the city of the five crafts with some sorrow , though with no fear . Forth [they]3259-they rode then through [the frank]6141-the frank and up on to [the shepherd country]3266-the shepherd country , and whereas [their]3259-they horses were of the best , and [they]3259-they had no sumpter - beast with [them]3259-they till [they]3259-they came to [Upham]66-upham , where [they]3259-they must needs have victual , [they]3259-they made but five days of it to [the place where [the road]1797-the road turned aside from [the country of Mostwyke]3269-the country of mostwyke]3267-the place where the road turned aside from the country of mostwyke . There then [they]3259-they drew rein , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone lighted down from [her]108-birdalone horse , and [they]3259-they all , and [they]3259-they lay upon the grass and ate and drank together . But when [they]3259-they were done , [spake Birdalone]108-birdalone and said : [Dear friends]1316-dear friends , this is the hour and the place when [we]3259-they must needs part ; for [ye]1316-dear friends shall go back again to [Five Crafts]3271-five crafts , and do what [I]0-i have bidden of [you]1316-dear friends , and do [your]1316-dear friends will , and wend [your]1316-dear friends ways with [your]1316-dear friends livelihood unto [Utterhay]1-utterhay . But as for [me]0-i , [I]0-i must go [my]0-i ways first unto [Greenford]39-greenford , and thence to seek [[my]0-i friends from whom erst [I]0-i was fleeing when [ye]1316-dear friends first became [my]0-i friends]3272-my friends from whom erst i was fleeing when ye first became my friends . Now perchance [ye]1316-dear friends will say that [I]0-i have taken [you]1316-dear friends up in [my]0-i need , and cast [you]1316-dear friends aside at [my]0-i pleasure ; but [I]0-i may only say that there be at present two deals of [my]0-i life , and of one of them have [ye]1316-dear friends been partakers , and of the other [ye]1316-dear friends may not be . Forsooth that is a grief unto [me]0-i , as [I]0-i suppose unto [you]1316-dear friends is it a greater one . But unto [me]0-i also were it heavier but that [my]0-i heart tells [me]0-i it shall not ever be so ; for as [I]0-i said to [you]1316-dear friends some days agone , [I]0-i have a hope that [we]3273-we shall yet meet again , be it in [Utterhay]1-utterhay or in [some other place]3274-some other place . And now [I]0-i pray [you]1316-dear friends to pardon [me]0-i wherein [I]0-i may have done amiss unto [you]1316-dear friends , and begrudge it not that there be others , who indeed were first - comers in regard to [you]1316-dear friends , and whom [I]0-i love better than [you]1316-dear friends ; for of [your]1316-dear friends truth and [your]1316-dear friends good - will and loving - kindness will [I]0-i bear witness wheresoever [I]0-i may be . Then spake [Gerard]173-gerard : Do [ye]1316-dear friends speak , [[my]0-i sons]6086-my sons ; for [I]0-i have no grudge against [her]3276-her , nor aught to bewail [me]0-i as to [her]3276-her , save , it may be , that [I]0-i am now so well on in years that it may well befall that [I]0-i shall not live till the time of the meeting in [Utterhay]1-utterhay . But [I]0-i will pray [thee]1316-dear friends this , [dear lady]3090-dear lady , that if [thou]3278-thou come to the place where [I]0-i lie dead [thou]3278-thou wilt kiss [my]0-i burial - stone , and sing due masses for [me]0-i . Nay , [she]3276-her said , but this is the worst shall betide betwixt [us]3279-us . Then spake [Robert Gerardson]174-robert : [I]0-i am not deft of speech , but this parting makes [me]0-i bold to say this : that from the time when first [I]0-i set eyes on [thee]1316-dear friends [I]0-i have loved [thee]1316-dear friends in such wise that never mayst [thou]3278-thou love [me]0-i as much as [I]0-i love [thee]1316-dear friends , if [thou]3278-thou hast anywhere , as [I]0-i deem [thou]3278-thou hast , [a lover of [thy]3278-thou body , whom [thou]3278-thou lovest]3280-a lover of thy body , whom thou lovest . Now [I]0-i have seen that for a long while [thou]3278-thou hast known this , and hast ever because of it been as meek and kind with [me]0-i as [thou]3278-thou mightest be . And this hath partly grieved [me]0-i the more , because it hath eked [my]0-i longing for [thee]1316-dear friends ; and yet it hath comforted [me]0-i the more , because it hath made [me]0-i deem better of [thee]1316-dear friends , and deem [thee]1316-dear friends worthier of worship and holier ; therefore have [thou]1316-dear friends all [my]0-i blessing for it . And now [I]0-i know that [thou]3278-thou sunderest from [us]3281-we that [thou]3278-thou mayst go seek [thy]3278-thou very bodily lover ; and [I]0-i say , that if the sundering had been for any lighter cause , grieved at heart should [I]0-i have been ; but since it is even so , once more [I]0-i bless [thee]1316-dear friends , and ever shall [I]0-i be happy in the thought of [thee]1316-dear friends ; and if ever [we]3281-we meet again , still shalt [thou]3278-thou find [me]0-i as now [I]0-i am in heart and in soul . [She]0-i turned to [him]3282-he , not dry - eyed , and said : [I]0-i know that what [thou]3278-thou sayest is sooth ; and [thou]3278-thou hast guessed right as to [my]0-i goings ; and [I]0-i take [thy]3278-thou blessing with love and joy . Then were [they]3283-they silent ; but [Giles Gerardson]175-giles gerardson was struggling with words , for [he]3282-he was slow to speech ; at last [he]3282-he said : [I]0-i say much as saith [[my]0-i brother]2607-my brother : but see [thou]1316-dear friends , [[our]3281-we lady]477-our lady , how ill it had gone if [thou]3278-thou hadst loved one of [us]3281-we with an equal love ; woe worth the strife then ! But now [I]0-i will crave this of [thee]1316-dear friends , that [thou]3278-thou kiss [me]0-i on the lips , now whenas [we]3281-we part ; and again , that [thou]3278-thou wilt do as much when first [we]3281-we meet again hereafter . And [I]0-i tell [thee]1316-dear friends right out , that if [thou]3278-thou gainsay this , [I]0-i shall deem it unfriendly in [thee]1316-dear friends , and that those lovely words which [thou]3278-thou didst speak eâ€™en now were but words alone , and that [thou]3278-thou art not as true as [I]0-i have deemed [thee]1316-dear friends . [She]0-i laughed amidst [her]0-i tears , and said : [Dear lad]3286-dear lad , doom [me]0-i not till [I]0-i have been found guilty ! [I]0-i shall nowise naysay [thee]1316-dear friends this , for [I]0-i love [thee]1316-dear friends , and now and ever shalt [thou]3278-thou be unto [me]0-i as [a brother]3287-a brother , [thou]3278-thou and [Robert]174-robert also ; for even so have [ye]1316-dear friends done by [me]0-i . But [thou]3278-thou wottest , [dear lad]3286-dear lad , that whiles and again must [sister]181-sister sunder from [brother]4710-brother , and even so it has to be now . Then [they]3290-they sat silent all four ; and thereafter [Birdalone]108-birdalone arose and did off [her]108-birdalone sallet , and kissed and embraced [Gerard]173-gerard and [[his]173-gerard sons]3034-his sons , and bade [them]3290-they farewell , and [she]108-birdalone and [the young men]1982-the young men wept . Then [she]108-birdalone armed [herself]108-birdalone and gat to horse , and went [her]108-birdalone ways towards [Greenford]39-greenford , having nought with [her]108-birdalone but the raiment and arms that [her]108-birdalone body bore , and [her]108-birdalone horse , and some gold pieces and gems in a little pouch . So rode [she]108-birdalone ; and [the others]1287-the others turned back sadly toward [the Five Crafts]6090-the five crafts . Chapter VII ~ [Birdalone]108-birdalone Cometh to [Greenford]39-greenford , and Hears of [the Wasting of [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest]69-the wasting of the castle of the quest Now came [Birdalone]108-birdalone riding into [Greenford]39-greenford an hour before sunset on a day of the latter end of May ; and [she]108-birdalone had no doubt but to go straight to [the hostelry]6204-the hostelry , and that the less as [she]108-birdalone had not abided [there]215-there before , as hath been told . To [them]3298-them that served [her]108-birdalone [she]108-birdalone told the tale of [her]108-birdalone vow , that [she]108-birdalone might not do off [her]108-birdalone sallet that seven days ; and [some]213-some trowed [her]108-birdalone , and [some]213-some deemed [her]108-birdalone [a woman]235-a woman , but whereas [she]108-birdalone seemed by [her]108-birdalone raiment to be of condition [none]1359-none meddled with [her]108-birdalone . Moreover , as [she]108-birdalone told [her]108-birdalone intent to ride on betimes in the morning , it mattered the less unto [them]3298-them : withal [she]108-birdalone gave out that [she]108-birdalone came from foreign parts , as sooth it was . In the evening [she]108-birdalone sat in [the hall]1193-the hall , and with [her]108-birdalone were [three chapmen]3304-three chapmen travelling with [their]3304-three chapmen wares , and [two good men of [the town]305-the town]3305-two good men of the town sitting ; and [they]3298-them were talking together , and were courteous and blithe , and amidst [their]3298-them talk [they]3298-them threw many a glance at [the slim and fair young squire]3307-the slim and fair young squire , as [Birdalone]108-birdalone seemed , and were fain to speak unto [him]3307-the slim and fair young squire , but refrained [them]3298-them for courtesy â€™s sake . For [her]108-birdalone part , [Birdalone]108-birdalone longed sore to ask [them]3298-them somewhat of [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , but the words clave to [her]108-birdalone throat for very fear ; and [she]108-birdalone sat restless and ill at ease . However at last said [a townsman]3309-a townsman to [a chapman]3310-a chapman : Art [thou]3311-thou for [the Red Hold]42-the red hold , [Master Peter]183-master peter , when [thou]3311-thou art done here ? [Birdalone]108-birdalone turned very pale at that word ; and [Master Peter spake]183-master peter : [Yea]3312-yea , surely , [neighbour]3313-neighbour , if [the folk]228-the folk leave aught in [my]0-i packs for [others]4825-others to buy . [He]183-master peter spake in a jovial voice , as if [he]183-master peter were merry , and [the others]1287-the others all laughed together , as though [they]1287-the others were well pleased and in good contentment . And now , deemed [Birdalone]108-birdalone , would be [her]108-birdalone time to speak if [she]108-birdalone would learn aught ; so [she]108-birdalone constrained [herself]108-birdalone at last , and spake , though in a quavering voice : Meseems then , [masters]3317-masters , [this good town]3318-this good town is thriving as now ? This [I]0-i ask because [I]0-i am a stranger in [these parts]3319-these parts this long while , and now [I]0-i am come back hither fain were [I]0-i to find [the land]198-the land in good peace ; for [I]0-i may chance to take up [[my]0-i abode hereby]3321-my abode hereby . [The goodmen]3322-the goodmen turned to [her]108-birdalone and smiled kindly when [they]3322-the goodmen heard the sweetness of [her]108-birdalone voice ; and [one of [them]3322-the goodmen]3323-one of them said : [Sir of the sallet]3324-sir of the sallet , [ye]3324-sir of the sallet shall be content with the peace in [this land]1250-this land , and the thriving of [[its]1250-this land folk]3326-its folk ; the very villeins hereabout live as well as franklins in [most lands]3327-most lands , and [the yeomen and vavassours]3328-the yeomen and vavassours are clad as if [they]3328-the yeomen and vavassours were [knights of [[a good lord]3330-a good lord â€™s household]3331-a good lord â€™s household]3329-knights of a good lord â€™s household . Forsooth [[their]3328-the yeomen and vavassours houses]3332-their houses are both goodly and easy to enter ; and well is that , whereas there lacks never good meat and drink on the board therein . And moreover [[their]3328-the yeomen and vavassours women]3333-their women are for ever seeking whatso is fair and goodly , whatso is far - fetched and dear - bought , whereof [we]3334-we chapmen also thrive , as [thou]3335-thou mayst well deem . Ah ! it is [a goodly land]3336-a goodly land now ! [The others]1287-the others nodded and smiled . But [Birdalone]108-birdalone spake , hardening [her]108-birdalone heart thereto for very need : Belike then there is a change of days here , for when [I]0-i last knew of [the land]198-the land there was little peace therein . And that will not be so long agone , said [a townsman]3309-a townsman , smiling , for [I]0-i doubt [we]3334-we should see no grey hair in thine head if [thy]3335-thou sallet were off it . [Birdalone]108-birdalone reddened : It will be some five years agone , said [she]108-birdalone . [Yea]3340-yea , yea , said [the townsman]3341-the townsman , [we]3334-we were beginning to end the unpeace then , and it was the darkest hour before the dawn ; for five years agone [we]3334-we and [the good knights of the Castle of the Quest]3342-the good knights of the castle of the quest were lying before the walls of [the Red Hold]42-the red hold . Forsooth [we]3334-we cleared out that den of devils then and there . What betid unto it after [ye]3341-the townsman won it ? said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone trembled withal . Said [the townsman]3341-the townsman : Heard [ye]108-birdalone never of [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , [a very valiant knight]3345-a very valiant knight , since [thou]3346-thou sayest that [thou]3346-thou hast known [this country - side]1740-this country - side ? [She]108-birdalone bowed a yeasay , for this time [she]108-birdalone found it hard to speak . Well , said [the townsman]3341-the townsman , [we]3334-we held garrison in [the Red Hold]2256-the red hold for some three months , and thereafter [we]3334-we craved of [him]1325-the black squire to come and be [[our]3334-we captain]3350-our captain therein ; for , even after the Hold was won , there was yet a sort of runagates that haunted [the country - side]4792-the country - side , [men who had no craft save lifting and slaying]3352-men who had no craft save lifting and slaying . And forsooth [we]3334-we knew [this Lord Arthur]184-this lord arthur for the keenest and deftest of [men - at - arms]1749-men - at - arms ; so [he]184-this lord arthur yeasaid [our]3334-we asking , and did all [he]184-this lord arthur might herein , and forsooth that was all there was to do ; for [he]184-this lord arthur was ever in the saddle , and at the work . [Forsooth]108-birdalone [he]184-this lord arthur was not [a merry man]3354-a merry man , save when [he]184-this lord arthur was at [his]184-this lord arthur busiest ; and little [he]184-this lord arthur spake in [hall]3355-hall or [chamber]2741-chamber , else had [he]184-this lord arthur been better beloved . But at least by [no man]534-no man better might [the land]198-the land have been served . There was silence a little , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone waxed deadly pale ; then [she]108-birdalone strove with [herself]108-birdalone and said : [Thou]3359-thou sayest [he]184-this lord arthur was and [he]184-this lord arthur was ; is [he]184-this lord arthur dead then ? Said [the townsman]3341-the townsman : Not to [our]3361-our knowledge . When [he]184-this lord arthur had brought [the land]198-the land into good peace , which is some three years and a half agone , [he]184-this lord arthur went [his]184-this lord arthur ways from [the Red Hold all alone]3363-the red hold all alone , and [we]3361-our saw [him]184-this lord arthur no more . But [some folk]3364-some folk deem that [he]184-this lord arthur hath entered into religion . [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s heart sickened , and [she]108-birdalone thought to [herself]108-birdalone that now all was to begin again ; yet [she]108-birdalone felt that the worst was over since [he]184-this lord arthur was not dead , and [she]108-birdalone was able to think what [she]108-birdalone should do . So [she]108-birdalone said : Mayhappen [he]184-this lord arthur hath gone back to [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest ? Nay , nay , said [the townsman]3341-the townsman , that may not be ; for waste is [that house]4456-that house now ; there is none dwelleth there , save , it may be , now and again [a wandering carle or carline]3368-a wandering carle or carline abideth there a day or two . Said [Birdalone]108-birdalone : How hath that befallen ? or where is gone [Sir Hugh]118-hugh , [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight ? Said [the townsman]3341-the townsman : [We]3371-we knew [the Green Knight]118-hugh well ; frank and free and joyous was [he]118-hugh ; [all men]212-all men loved [him]118-hugh ; and [[his]118-hugh lady]1377-his lady and speech - friend , [none]1359-none ever saw [a lovelier]3375-a lovelier , and as kind as was [he]118-hugh . But [we]3371-we might not keep [them]3376-them with [us]3371-we ; [they]3376-them are gone into [[their]3376-them own country]3377-their own country . [Sir Hugh]118-hugh left [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest some three months after [the Black Squire]119-arthur came to [us]3371-we for [captain]5654-captain , and [he]118-hugh gave over [the castle]1534-the castle to [Sir Geoffrey of Lea]164-sir geoffrey of lea , [an old and wise man of war]6015-an old and wise man of war . But not many months thereafter [we]3371-we heard that [he]118-hugh also had departed , leaving it ungarnished of [men]204-men ; and [we]3371-we deem that the cause thereof is that something uncouth is seen and heard therein , which [folk]4521-folk may not endure . Is it not so , [[my]0-i masters]3384-my masters ? [They]3384-my masters all yeasaid that , and the talk went on to other matters . As for [Birdalone]108-birdalone , though [her]108-birdalone hope to come amongst [friends]404-friends was so utterly overthrown , yet [she]108-birdalone saw not what to do save to go [her]108-birdalone ways to [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and see if perchance [she]108-birdalone might find any tidings there . And [she]108-birdalone said to [herself]108-birdalone , that if the worst came to the worst , [she]108-birdalone would [herself]108-birdalone dwell [there]215-there as [an hermit of love]3388-an hermit of love ; or , maybe , to face those uncouth things and see if any tidings might be compelled out of them . Chapter VIII ~ [Birdalone]108-birdalone Cometh to [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest , Heareth the Tale Thereof from [Leonard]130-leonard , and Departeth Thence by [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat [She]108-birdalone arose betimes on the morrow , and was out of [Greenford]39-greenford so soon as the gates were open , and at first made all speed that [she]108-birdalone might toward [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest ; and nothing hindered [her]108-birdalone , for [the land]198-the land was verily in good peace , and [she]108-birdalone might have come [there]215-there if [she]108-birdalone would before sunset , for all whom [she]108-birdalone met furthered [her]108-birdalone . But as the day waned [her]108-birdalone courage waned with it , so that at last [she]108-birdalone stayed some six miles short of [the house]311-the house , and craved shelter at [[a yeoman]3395-a yeoman â€™s stead there]3396-a yeoman â€™s stead there , which was granted [her]108-birdalone with all kindness ; and [they]3395-a yeoman made much of [her]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone told [them]3395-a yeoman [her]108-birdalone vow of the sallet , and [they]3395-a yeoman deemed nought save that [she]108-birdalone was [a young man]6251-a young man . [She]108-birdalone departed early in the morning with [their]3395-a yeoman God - speed , and while the day was yet young came into [the meadows]1769-the meadows before [the castle]1534-the castle , and saw the towers thereof rising up before [her]108-birdalone : then [she]108-birdalone checked [her]108-birdalone horse , and rode on no faster than a foot â€™s pace ; yet as slow as [she]108-birdalone might ride , needs must [she]108-birdalone get to the gate while the day was yet young .
