[[My]0-i friends]1795-my friends , this might indeed well be ; but [thou]3852-thou , [Birdalone]110-birdalone , hast told [me]0-i the whole tale , and how that there be wrongs to be forgiven which can not be made right , and past kindness to be quickened again , and coldness to be kindled into love , and estrangement into familiar friendship ; and meseems that the sight of [your]3834-your bodies and [your]3834-your hands made manifest to the eyes of [them]3843-your friends may do somewhat herein . Yet if otherwise [ye]3834-your think , then so let it be , and go [ye]3834-your back to [the House under [the Wood]4-the wood]4835-the house under the wood , and in three days â€™ time [I]504-one will bring [you]3834-your [[your]3834-your friends]3843-your friends all safe and sound . Now [they]1795-my friends both said that [they]1795-my friends would not for aught that [they]1795-my friends should have no hand in the deliverance of [them]1795-my friends ; so [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife said : Come with [me]504-one , and [I]504-one shall lead [you]3834-your to [the place of [your]3834-your ambush]7082-the place of your ambush . Then all [they]1795-my friends went on together , and fared a long way west , and toward the place where erst [they]1795-my friends two had found [Arthur]195-spake arthur ; and at last , two hours before sunset , [they]1795-my friends came to where was a glade or way between the thickets , which was as it were a little beaten by the goings of [man - folk]7083-man - folk . And [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife did [them]1795-my friends to wit , that [the evil folk aforesaid]7085-the evil folk aforesaid had so used it and beaten it , that it might just look as if [folk]4521-folk were wo nt to pass that way , whereas it was not very far from [[their]4521-folk chiefest haunt]7087-their chiefest haunt and stronghold . A little on the north side of this half - blind way , and some ten yards through the thicket , the ground fell away into [a little dale]7088-a little dale , the bottom whereof was plain and well grassed , and watered by [a brook]7089-a brook . Thither [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife brought the twain ; and when [they]1795-my friends all stood together on [the brook - side]7091-the brook - side , [she]504-one said to [them]1795-my friends : [Dear friends]1316-dear friends , this is [[your]1795-my friends woodland house]7093-your woodland house for this time , and [I]504-one rede [you]1795-my friends go not forth of [it]7093-your woodland house , lest [ye]1795-my friends happen upon [any of [those evil men]7095-those evil men]7094-any of those evil men ; for nought have [ye]1795-my friends to fear from any save [them]7095-those evil men . Here amidst these big stones , which make , see [ye]1795-my friends , as [it]7096-it were [a cavern]7097-a cavern , have [I]504-one stowed victual for [you]1795-my friends ; and armour therewithal , because , though both of [you]1795-my friends are in a manner armed , yet who knoweth where a shaft drawn at a venture may reach . And from the said stones [she]504-one drew forth two very fair armours , helm and hauberk , and leg and arm wards ; and they were all of green , and shone but little , but were fashioned as [no smith of man - folk]7098-no smith of man - folk could have done the like . This is thine , [Sir Arthur]150-arthur , said [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife , and [thou]1795-my friends wilt wear it like as it were silk ; and this thine , [[my]504-one child]907-my child , and [thou]1795-my friends art strong enough to bear such light gear . And [I]504-one charge [you]1795-my friends both to do on this gear presently , nor do it off till [ye]1795-my friends have achieved the adventure . And now this is the last word : here is a horn of oliphant which [thou]1795-my friends shalt wear about [thy]1795-my friends neck , [Birdalone]110-birdalone ; and if [thou]1795-my friends be sore bestead , or [thy]1795-my friends heart faileth [thee]1795-my friends , blow in it , yet not before the onfall ; and then , whether [thou]1795-my friends blow much or little , [thou]1795-my friends shalt be well holpen . Now be not downcast if nought befall to - night or tomorrow , or even the day after ; but if the third day be tidingless , then at sunset burn a hair of [my]504-one head , [Birdalone]110-birdalone , and [I]504-one will come to [you]1795-my friends . And now farewell ! for [I]504-one have yet to do in this matter . With that [she]504-one kissed [Birdalone]110-birdalone fondly and embraced [Arthur]150-arthur , and went [her]504-one way ; and those twain abode in [the dale]4999-the dale , and slept and watched by turns , and all was tidingless till the morrow â€™s dawn ; neither was there aught to tell of on that day and the night that ended it . Chapter XXXII ~ Of the Fight in [the Forest]84-the forest and the Rescue of [Those Friends]7102-those friends from [the Men of the Red Company Light]7103-the men of the red company light was growing on the dawn of the next day , and the colours of things could be seen , when [Birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night]7104-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night , stood still and hearkened , deeming that [she]7104-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night could hear some noise that was neither the morning wind in the tree - boughs nor the going of the wild things anear them in the wood . So [she]7104-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night did off [her]7104-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night helm to hear the better , and stood thus a little ; then [she]7104-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night turned about and stooped down to [Arthur]150-arthur , who was yet sleeping , and put forth a hand to rouse [him]150-arthur . But or ever [she]7104-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night touched [him]150-arthur , broke forth a sound of big and rough voices and laughter , and amidst it two shrieks as of [women]420-women . [Arthur]150-arthur heard it , and was on [his]150-arthur feet in a moment , and helmed , and [he]150-arthur caught up [his]150-arthur bended bow and cast on the quiver ( for [Birdalone]110-birdalone was already weaponed ) , and without more words [they]7106-they went forth swiftly up [the bank]1035-the bank and through the thicket till [they]7106-they were looking on the half - blind way , but under cover , and there was nothing before [them]7106-they as yet . There [they]7106-they stayed and hearkened keenly . There were no more shrieks of [women]420-women , nor heard [they]7106-they any weapon clash , but the talking and laughter of [men]204-men went on ; and at last [they]3858-they heard [a huge and grim whoop of many men]7110-a huge and grim whoop of many men together ; and then thereafter was less sound of talking , but came the jingle as of arms and harness ; and [Arthur]150-arthur whispered in [Birdalone]110-birdalone â€™s ear : Stand close ! [they]3859-three big weaponed men have gotten to horse , and will be coming [our]7106-they way . Nock an arrow . And even so did [he]150-arthur . Therewith [they]3858-they heard clearly the riding of [men]204-men , and in less than five minutes â€™[504-one] space [they]3858-they saw [three big weaponed men]3859-three big weaponed men riding together , clad in red surcoats , and [they]3859-three big weaponed men were so nigh that [they]3858-they heard the words of [their]3859-three big weaponed men speech . [One]504-one said to [the other]250-the other : How long shall [the knight]1813-the knight hold out , think [ye]250-the other ? Oh , a week maybe , said [the other]250-the other . Meseems it was scathe that [we]3864-we stayed not a while to pine [him]1813-the knight , said [the first man]5565-the first man . Nay , said [the second]3866-the second , [we]3864-we be over - heavy laden with bed - gear to tarry . And [they]3859-three big weaponed men all laughed thereat , and so went on out of hearing . But then came four on together , whereof one , [a gaunt , oldish man]3867-a gaunt , oldish man , was saying : It is not so much how long [we]3864-we shall be getting there , but what shall betide when [we]3864-we get [there]215-there . For this is not like lifting a herd of neat , whereof sharing is easy , but with this naked - skinned , two - legged cattle , which forsooth [ye]3869-ye can eat and yet have , there may well be strife over the sharing . And look to it if it hath not begun already : [we]3864-we must needs dismount [three of [[our]3864-we best men]3871-our best men]3870-three of our best men that [these white - skinned bitches]3872-these white - skinned bitches forsooth may each have a horse to [herself]3873-herself , or else would [they]3859-three big weaponed men be fighting as to which should have [a damsel of [them]3859-three big weaponed men before [him]1813-the knight on the saddle]3874-a damsel of them before him on the saddle : curse [the fools]2900-the fools ! Laughed out [they]3859-three big weaponed men who were about [him]1813-the knight , and [one young man]3876-one young man cast a jeer at [him]1813-the knight the meaning whereof [they]3859-three big weaponed men might not catch , and again [they]3859-three big weaponed men laughed ; and that deal passed on . And next came a bigger rout , a half score or so , and [they]3859-three big weaponed men also laughing and jeering ; but amidst [them]3859-three big weaponed men , plain to see riding a - straddle , [their]3859-three big weaponed men ankles twisted together under the horses â€™ bellies , [their]3859-three big weaponed men hands bound behind [them]3859-three big weaponed men , first [Atra]109-atra , black - clad as erst ; then [Aurea]107-aurea , in a gown of wheat - colour ; then [Viridis]108-birdalone , green - clad . [Atra]109-atra rode upright , and looking straight before [her]109-atra ; [Aurea]107-aurea hung [her]107-aurea head all [she]107-aurea might , and [her]107-aurea long red hair fell about [her]107-aurea face ; but [Viridis]108-birdalone had swooned , and was held up in the saddle by one of [the caitiffs on each side of [her]3877-her]7112-the caitiffs on each side of her . [They]7113-they were but little disarrayed , save that [some felon]7114-some felon had torn the bosom of [Viridis]108-birdalone â€™[108-birdalone] gown , and dragged down the cloth so that [her]3877-her left shoulder was bare . [Arthur]150-arthur looked , and drew at the caitiff who went afoot beside [Atra]109-atra , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone at [him]150-arthur who went by [Viridis]108-birdalone , for [she]108-birdalone wotted whitherward [Arthur]150-arthur â€™s shaft would be turned . The loose of the two bows made but one sound ; [both men]3878-both men fell stark dead , and [the others]1287-the others huddled together a moment , and then ran toward the thicket on either hand , and [they]1287-the others who ran north , two of [them]1287-the others saw not [Arthur]150-arthur , because of [his]150-arthur green armour , ere [they]1287-the others felt the death which lay in [his]150-arthur sword . And then [he]150-arthur brake out amidst [them]1287-the others , and there were three of [them]1287-the others on [him]150-arthur , yet for no long while , whereas [their]1287-the others weapons bit not on the armour of [the Faery]4682-the faery , and [his]150-arthur woodland blade sheared leather and ring - mail to the flesh and the bone : mighty were [his]150-arthur strokes , and presently [all three]1397-all three were wallowing on [the earth]432-the earth . Even therewith [the seven who had passed on]3883-the seven who had passed on had turned back and were come on [him]150-arthur a - horse - back ; and hard had it gone with [him]150-arthur , despite of [his]150-arthur might and [his]150-arthur valour and the trustiness of [Habundia]97-habundia â€™s mail . But meanwhile [Birdalone]108-birdalone had run to [Viridis]108-birdalone , who had fallen a dead weight aside of [her]108-birdalone horse , and lay half hanging by the bonds of [her]108-birdalone ankles . [Birdalone]108-birdalone swiftly cut the cords both of [her]108-birdalone feet and [her]108-birdalone hands , and drew [her]108-birdalone off [her]108-birdalone horse as best [she]108-birdalone might , and laid [her]108-birdalone down on the grass ; and then ran to [Arthur]150-arthur sword aloft , just as [his]150-arthur new battle was at point to begin . But as [she]108-birdalone ran it came into [her]108-birdalone mind in a twinkling that [her]108-birdalone sword would be but weak , and the horn hung about [her]108-birdalone neck . Then [she]108-birdalone stayed [her]108-birdalone feet , and set the horn to [her]108-birdalone lips and blew ; and the oliphant gave forth a long singing note which was strange to hear . But while it was yet at [her]108-birdalone lips one of the caitiffs was upon [her]108-birdalone , and [he]150-arthur cried out : [Hah the witch]3884-hah the witch , [the accursed green witch]3885-the accursed green witch ! and fetched [her]108-birdalone a great stroke from [his]150-arthur saddle , and smote [her]108-birdalone on the helm ; and though [his]150-arthur sword bit not on that good head - burg , [she]108-birdalone fell to the ground unwitting . Yet was not [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife â€™s promise unavailing , for even while the voice of the horn was in the air , the way and thickets were alive with [men - at - arms]1749-men - at - arms , green - clad as those twain , who straightway fell on [the caitiffs]3888-the caitiffs , and with [Arthur]150-arthur to help , left not one of [them]3888-the caitiffs alive . Then went some to [Viridis]108-birdalone , and raised [her]108-birdalone up , and so dealt with [her]108-birdalone that [she]108-birdalone came to [herself]108-birdalone again ; and the like [they]3889-they did by [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [she]108-birdalone stood , and looked about confusedly , but yet saw this , that [they]3889-they had gotten the victory . [Some]213-some went withal to [Aurea]107-aurea , and cut [her]108-birdalone bonds and took [her]108-birdalone off [her]108-birdalone horse and set [her]108-birdalone on [the ground]5349-the ground ; and [she]108-birdalone was all bewildered , and knew not where [she]108-birdalone was . But [Arthur]150-arthur , when [he]150-arthur saw [Birdalone]108-birdalone on [her]108-birdalone feet , and unhurt by seeming , went to [Atra]109-atra , and cut [her]109-atra bonds and loosed [her]109-atra , and set [her]109-atra on [the earth]432-the earth , all without a word , and then stood before [her]109-atra shyly . Came the colour back into [her]109-atra face therewith , and [she]109-atra flushed red , for [she]109-atra knew [him]150-arthur despite [his]150-arthur outlandish green war - harness , and [she]109-atra reached out [her]109-atra hand to [him]150-arthur , and [he]150-arthur knelt before [her]109-atra and took [her]109-atra hand and kissed it . But [she]109-atra bent over [him]150-arthur till [her]109-atra face was anigh [his]150-arthur , and [he]150-arthur lifted up [his]150-arthur face and kissed [her]109-atra mouth . And [she]109-atra drew aback a little , but yet looked on [him]150-arthur earnestly , and said : [Thou]3893-thou hast saved [my]0-i life , not from death indeed , but from a loathsome hell ; [I]0-i may well thank [thee]150-arthur for that . And O , if [my]0-i thanks might be fruitful to [thee]150-arthur ! And [her]109-atra bosom heaved , and the sobs came , and the tears began to run down [her]109-atra cheeks . And [he]150-arthur hung [his]150-arthur head before [her]109-atra . But in a while [she]109-atra left weeping , and turned about [her]109-atra face and looked round [the field of deed]3894-the field of deed ; and [she]109-atra said : Who is [yonder]3895-yonder [slim green warrior who hath even now knelt down by [Viridis]108-birdalone]3896-slim green warrior who hath even now knelt down by viridis ? Is it not [a woman]235-a woman ? [Arthur]150-arthur reddened : [Yea]3898-yea , said [he]150-arthur ; it is [Birdalone]108-birdalone . [Thy]108-birdalone love ? [she]109-atra said . [He]150-arthur said swiftly : [Yea]3898-yea , and [[thy]3898-yea friend]4800-thy friend , and this time [[thy]3898-yea deliverer]3900-thy deliverer . So it is , [she]109-atra said . It is five years since [I]0-i beheld [her]109-atra . [My]0-i heart yearns for [her]109-atra ; [I]0-i shall rejoice at the meeting of [us]3901-they . [She]109-atra was silent , and [he]150-arthur also a while ; then [she]109-atra said : But why tarry [we]3901-they here in idle talk when [he]150-arthur is yet bound , and in torment of body and soul ; [he]150-arthur the valiant , and [the kind]3902-the kind and [the dear brother]3903-the dear brother ? Come , tarry for no question . And [she]109-atra stepped out swiftly along [the green road]5544-the green road going westward , and [Arthur]150-arthur beside [her]109-atra ; and as [they]3901-they went by [Viridis]108-birdalone , lo ! [Aurea]107-aurea had wandered unto [them]3901-they , and now was [Birdalone]108-birdalone unhelmed and kissing and comforting [her]109-atra . Then cried out [Atra]109-atra : Keep up [thine]3905-thine heart , [Viridis]108-birdalone ! for now [we]3901-they go to fetch [thee]109-atra [[thy]109-atra man]2954-thy man safe and sound . So [they]3901-they went but a little way on the green road ere [they]3901-they came to [Sir Hugh]118-hugh bound hard and fast to a tree - bole , and [he]118-hugh naked in [his]118-hugh shirt , and hard by lay the bodies of two stout carles with [their]3901-they throats cut ; for [these honest men]3907-these honest men and [the two felons who had betrayed [them]3907-these honest men]3908-the two felons who had betrayed them were all the following wherewith [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight had entered [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw . And as it fell , [the traitors]3910-the traitors had been set to watch while [the others]1287-the others slept ; and sleeping [the caitiffs]3888-the caitiffs found [them]3910-the traitors , and slew [the said men - at - arms]3913-the said men - at - arms at once , but bound [Hugh]118-hugh to a tree that [he]118-hugh might be the longer a - dying ; since [none]1359-none looked for any but [[their]3901-they own folk]3915-their own folk to pass by that way . All this [they]3901-they heard afterwards of [Hugh]118-hugh . But now [the said Hugh]3916-the said hugh heard [men]204-men going , and [he]118-hugh opened [his]118-hugh eyes , and saw [Atra]109-atra and [a man - at - arms]3918-a man - at - arms with [her]109-atra ; and [he]118-hugh cried out : Hah , what is this now , [sister]773-sister ? a rescue ? [Yea]3920-yea , [she]109-atra said , and look [thou]3921-thou on the face of [the rescuer]3922-the rescuer ; and there is another hard by , and [she]773-sister is [a woman]235-a woman . Therewith was [Arthur]150-arthur on [him]118-hugh and cutting [his]118-hugh bonds , and when [he]118-hugh was loose [they]3924-they fell into [each other]569-each other â€™s arms , and [Hugh]118-hugh spake : Now then at last doth life begin for [me]0-i as [I]0-i willed it ! And hast [thou]3926-thou [[my]0-i sweet [she]3928-she - fellow]3927-my sweet she - fellow , [Birdalone]108-birdalone , with [thee]3926-thou ? Yea , said [Arthur]150-arthur . How good is that ! said [Hugh]118-hugh . And yet , if it might but be that [Baudoin]115-baudoin were yet alive for [us]3929-they to seek ! Then [he]118-hugh laughed and said : These be but sorry garments wherewith to wend along with [dear and fair ladies]3930-dear and fair ladies , [brother]4710-brother ! Nay , said [Arthur]150-arthur , that may soon be amended , for yonder , where sword met sword , lieth raiment abundantly on the grass . Fie on it ! said [Hugh]118-hugh , laughing ; shall [I]0-i do on [me]0-i the raiment of [those lousy traitors]3932-those lousy traitors ? Not [I]0-i , by the rood ! [Thou]3933-thou must seek further for [my]0-i array , [dear lad]3286-dear lad ! So [they]3929-they all laughed , and were glad to laugh together . But [Atra]109-atra said : It is easier even than that , for [thine]3935-thine own fair garments and weapons shall [we]3929-they find if [we]3929-they seek them . Sooth to say there was none left to bear [them]3936-them off , save it were [this man]1669-this man , or [Birdalone]108-birdalone [[his]1669-this man mate]2982-his mate . With that word [she]109-atra looked kindly on [Arthur]150-arthur , and again [they]3929-they laughed all three ; though forsooth [they]3936-them were well - nigh weeping - ripe ; one for joy , and that was [Hugh]118-hugh ; one for memory of the days gone by ; and one for the bitterness of love that should never be rewarded ; albeit dear even unto [her]109-atra was the meeting of [friends]404-friends and the glory of forgiveness and the end of enmity . Chapter XXXIII ~ [Viridis]108-birdalone Telleth the Tale of [Their]3929-they Seeking Now came [they]3929-they back to where were [the three others]3940-the three others , and [Viridis]108-birdalone was quite come to [herself]108-birdalone and ran to meet [[her]108-birdalone man]5681-her man , and [he]5681-her man took [her]108-birdalone in [his]5681-her man arms and caressed [her]108-birdalone sweetly ; and then [he]5681-her man turned to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and spared no sign of friendly love to [her]108-birdalone ; and [Arthur]150-arthur , for [his]150-arthur part , did so much for [Aurea]107-aurea and [Viridis]108-birdalone . No long tale there was between [them]3929-they for that while , for [they]3929-they would busk [them]3929-they to be gone . But first [they]3929-they dug a grave for [those two poor men who had been slain by [the felons]3943-the felons]3942-those two poor men who had been slain by the felons , and prayed for [them]3942-those two poor men who had been slain by the felons . As for [the caitiffs who lay slain there]3944-the caitiffs who lay slain there , one score and two of [them]3944-the caitiffs who lay slain there , [they]3929-they left [them]3944-the caitiffs who lay slain there for the wolves to devour , and the tearing of the kites and crows ; nor meddled [they]3929-they with any of [their]3929-they gear or weapons . But [they]3929-they speedily found [Hugh]118-hugh â€™s raiment , and [his]118-hugh pouch , wherein was money good store ; and [they]3929-they found also rings and ouches and girdles , which had been torn from the damsels in the first rage of [their]3929-they taking . First though , when [they]3929-they had gathered together such horses as [they]3929-they needed , and let the rest run wild , [Birdalone]108-birdalone brought [[her]108-birdalone [she]108-birdalone - friends]1744-her she - friends down into [the dale]4999-the dale , and did [them]1744-her she - friends to bathe in [a pool of the stream]3947-a pool of the stream , and tended [them]1744-her she - friends as if [she]108-birdalone were [[their]1744-her she - friends tire - woman]3948-their tire - woman , so that [they]1744-her she - friends were mightily refreshed ; and [she]108-birdalone made garlands for [them]1744-her she - friends of the woodland flowers , as eglantine and honeysuckle ; and [herself]108-birdalone , [she]108-birdalone bathed [her]108-birdalone , and did not on [her]108-birdalone battle - gear again , but clad [her]108-birdalone body in [[her]108-birdalone woman]3949-her woman â€™s array . Then [she]108-birdalone brought forth victual and wine from [[Habundia]97-habundia â€™s store]3950-habundia â€™s store , and set it out on [the stream - side]6977-the stream - side ; and thereafter [she]108-birdalone went up the bent to the green way and fetched down [Hugh]118-hugh and [Arthur]150-arthur , and brought [them]1744-her she - friends to [the ladies]1877-the ladies , and bade [them]1877-the ladies note how trim and lovely [they]1744-her she - friends were gotten again , and again it could scarce be but that kisses and caresses were toward ; and in all content and love [they]1744-her she - friends took [their]1744-her she - friends breakfast , though bitter - sweet unto [Atra]109-atra had been the holding of [her]109-atra hand by [Arthur]150-arthur and the kissing of [her]109-atra cheek , albeit not for worlds had [she]108-birdalone foregone it . So there [they]1744-her she - friends abode merrily for some three hours , whereas the day was yet young ; and [they]1744-her she - friends asked and told [each other]569-each other much , so that the whole tale , both of [the seekers]3769-the seekers from [the world]417-the world and of [the seekers]3769-the seekers from [the water - side]351-the water - side , came out little by little . Now of the last [ye]3958-ye have heard what there is to tell , but for the others [Viridis]108-birdalone took up the tale , as erst [she]108-birdalone did with the dealings of [the Knights of the Quest]3959-the knights of the quest in [the Isle of Increase Unsought]17-the isle of increase unsought ; and it seemed by [her]108-birdalone tale that [Hugh]118-hugh and [the ladies]1877-the ladies , though [they]1744-her she - friends were living happily and prosperously in [the land of [the Green Mountains]85-the green mountains]3961-the land of the green mountains , wherein [Hugh]118-hugh had wealth enow , yet the thought both of [Arthur]150-arthur and of [Birdalone]108-birdalone would not out of [their]1744-her she - friends minds , and often it was that [they]1744-her she - friends thought of [them]1744-her she - friends , not as [friends]404-friends think of friends of whom [they]404-friends are content to know that [they]404-friends are yet alive and most - like thriving , but as [friends]404-friends think of friends whose absence cuts a shard out of [their]1744-her she - friends lives , so that [they]404-friends long to see [them]1744-her she - friends day by day . Wherefore it came to this at last , after much talk hereof , that [Hugh]118-hugh left [his]118-hugh possessions and [[his]118-hugh children]3964-his children ( for [he]118-hugh had [two women]3965-two women - bairns born of [Viridis]108-birdalone ) in the keeping of [trusty folk]3966-trusty folk , and took with [him]118-hugh [Viridis]108-birdalone [[his]118-hugh wife]3967-his wife , and [Aurea]107-aurea and [Atra]109-atra , and [they]3968-they set out to seek those twain [the world]417-the world over till [they]3968-they should find [them]1744-her she - friends . And first by the rede of [Atra]109-atra [they]3968-they fared to [Greenford]39-greenford , and there tarried a month , and sought tidings of many , and heard a word here and there whereby [they]3968-they deemed that [Birdalone]108-birdalone had passed therethrough some little time before . So [they]3968-they went thence to [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and found [it]4707-the castle of the quest in such plight as [ye]3971-ye have heard , and it went sore to [their]3968-they hearts to behold it and to be there . But therewithal [they]3968-they happed upon [Leonard]139-birdalone [the priest]1677-the priest , and [he]139-birdalone was rejoiced beyond measure to see [them]3968-they , and told [them]3968-they all that [ye]3971-ye have heard concerning [Birdalone]108-birdalone â€™s coming thither and departing thence ; and [he]139-birdalone told [them]3968-they therewith about those hauntings and sendings in [the hall of [the castle]1534-the castle]5956-the hall of the castle , and that [they]3968-they came to an end the very day that [Birdalone]108-birdalone departed thence in [the Sending Boat]823-the sending boat . Yet for the last three days there had been visions therein ; but being questioned [he]139-birdalone was loth to tell [thereof]3976-thereof , so [they]3968-they forbore [him]139-birdalone a while . At these tidings [they]3968-they were sore moved , and [they]3968-they talked the matter over betwixt [themselves]3968-they ( and [Leonard]139-birdalone also was in [their]3968-they redes ) , and [they]3968-they must needs deem that either [Birdalone]108-birdalone was cast away , or that [she]108-birdalone had come to [[her]108-birdalone old dwelling]3977-her old dwelling , [the House under [the Wood]335-the wood]4835-the house under the wood , and belike had fallen into the hands of [the witch]394-the witch once more , and thereat were [they]3968-they sore downcast ; and yet somewhat it was , that [they]3968-they had heard sure tidings of [her]108-birdalone ; though meanwhile of [Arthur]150-arthur had [they]3968-they heard nought . While [they]3968-they talked this over , [Atra]109-atra , who had been somewhat silent , spake and said : Here are [we]3968-they brought to a stop with the first tidings which [we]3968-they have heard , whereas [we]3968-they know no manner of wending [the Great Water]13-the great water . This seemeth evil , but let [us]3968-they not be cast down , or die redeless . [Ye]3981-ye have heard of what sayeth Sir Leonard of these hauntings in [the hall]1193-the hall , and how that [they]3968-they have come back again , wherefore why should [we]3968-they not sleep in [the hall]1193-the hall this night , those of [us]3968-they at least who have not so much fear as not to note [them]3968-they well , to see if [we]3968-they may draw any avail from [them]3968-they ? How say [ye]3981-ye ? For [my]0-i part [I]0-i will try the adventure , whatever may come of it . Now [they]3968-they all yeasaid it , though [Aurea]107-aurea was somewhat timorous , albeit [she]107-aurea would not be parted from [the others]1287-the others ; so when night came there [they]3968-they made [their]3968-they beds and lay down ; and the end of it was , that a little before midnight [Atra]109-atra waked [the others]1287-the others , and did [them]1287-the others to wit that by [her]109-atra deeming something was toward ; and presently [they]3968-they were all four as wide awake as ever [they]3968-they were in [their]3968-they lives ; and next , without any sound that was strange , there came the image of [a woman on to the dais]3986-a woman on to the dais , clad in green like to [an huntress of ancient days]3987-an huntress of ancient days , [her]109-atra feet sandalled , [her]109-atra skirts gathered up into [her]109-atra girdle , so that [her]109-atra legs were naked ; [she]109-atra had a quiver at [her]109-atra back , and a great bow in [her]109-atra hand . Now to all of [them]3968-they save [Atra]109-atra this appearance seemed to be the image of [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; but [she]109-atra told [[her]109-atra fellows]3988-her fellows afterwards , that to [her]109-atra it seemed not to be altogether [Birdalone]108-birdalone , but rather [some other one most like unto [her]109-atra , as it were [[her]109-atra twin - sister]3990-her twin - sister]3989-some other one most like unto her , as it were her twin - sister . Gazed the image kindly and sweetly on [them]3968-they , so that [they]3968-they beheld it without fear ; and it seemed to [them]3968-they that it gave forth speech ; yet not so much that the sound of words was in the air about and smote [their]3968-they ears , as that the sense of words reached the minds of [them]3968-they . And this was the tale of it : [Ye]3991-ye , who are seeking the lost , have done well to come hither , and now shall [ye]3991-ye do well to wend the straightest way to [the dwelling of [the wildwood]512-the wildwood]3992-the dwelling of the wildwood , and that is by way of [the western verge of Evilshaw the forest]3994-the western verge of evilshaw the forest . [Greenford]39-greenford is on the way . [Way - leaders [ye]3991-ye shall get]3995-way - leaders ye shall get ; be wise , yet not prudent , and take [them]3995-way - leaders ye shall get , though [they]3995-way - leaders ye shall get be evil , and [your]3991-ye luck may well avail . Therewith the image vanished away as it had come , and [Leonard]139-birdalone , who with [the others]1287-the others took the appearance for an image of [Birdalone]108-birdalone , said that it was such as [he]139-birdalone had seen it the three last days . So [they]3968-they lay not down again , but departed for [Greenford]39-greenford without tarrying , and rode the other end of the short night through till [they]3968-they came to [Greenford]39-greenford . But [Leonard]139-birdalone would not with [them]3968-they ; and [Hugh]118-hugh behight [him]139-birdalone , if [he]139-birdalone lived and did well , to come back somehow to [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]4707-the castle of the quest , and so redo it that [it]4707-the castle of the quest should be no longer desolate . So to [Greenford]39-greenford [they]3968-they came , and spared not to do [folk to wit]3998-folk to wit that [they]3968-they would ride a pilgrimage in [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw , and were fain of [way - leaders]3999-way - leaders ; and there [they]3968-they dwelt a day or two , and [many]4000-many would let [them]3968-they of that journey , which , said [they]3968-they , was rather deadly than perilous only . But on the third day came to [Sir Hugh]118-hugh [two stout carles well weaponed , who said that [they]4001-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough knew well all the ways that led to [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough]4001-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough , and [they]4001-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough offered [themselves]4001-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough for a wage to [Sir Hugh]118-hugh . Now [these said carles]4002-these said carles were not over fair of favour , but seemed somewhat of ribalds , nor would [Sir Hugh]118-hugh have taken [them]4002-these said carles to service in [[his]118-hugh house at [home]373-home]4003-his house at home ; but [he]118-hugh called to mind that it were more prudence than wisdom to spoil [his]118-hugh journey and lose the occasion of finding [[his]118-hugh dear friends]4005-his dear friends for the hasty judgment of [a man]217-a man â€™s face and demeanour , wherefore [he]118-hugh waged [these two men]4007-these two men , and [they]4007-these two men set out for [the western edges of [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw]4008-the western edges of evilshaw . [Many towns]4009-many towns and thorps [they]4007-these two men passed through , and everywhere , when [men]204-men knew whither [they]204-men were bound , [they]204-men letted [them]204-men all [they]204-men might in words ; but little heed [they]4007-these two men paid thereto , whereas [they]4007-these two men were all fixed in [their]4007-these two men rede that nought was to be done save the finding of [[their]4007-these two men friends]2925-their friends , and that [their]4007-these two men life - days were spoiled if [they]204-men found [them]204-men not . And moreover , [each one of [them]4007-these two men]1918-each one of them , but especially [Atra]109-atra and [Viridis]108-birdalone , had dreams of the night from time to time , wherein [they]4007-these two men seemed to see [the green - clad woman]4013-the green - clad woman , were [she]4013-the green - clad woman [Birdalone]108-birdalone or another , beckoning and bidding [them]4007-these two men to enter [the Wood of Evilshaw]86-the wood of evilshaw . As to [those two way - leaders withal]4014-those two way - leaders withal , whether it were that [they]4007-these two men got used to [their]4007-these two men faces , or that [their]4007-these two men ways and manners were nought uncourteous or fierce , [they]4007-these two men doubted [them]4007-these two men less and less as time wore ; all save [Viridis]108-birdalone , whose flesh crept when [they]4007-these two men drew anigh [her]108-birdalone , as will betide one who comes across an evil - looking creeping thing . As for [Atra]109-atra , [she]109-atra now began to heed little the things about [her]109-atra , as if [her]109-atra heart were wholly set on the end of the journey . But now at last were [they]4007-these two men come so far that [they]4007-these two men had no choice but to use [the said way - leaders]4015-the said way - leaders , for [they]4007-these two men were gotten to [the edge of [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw]4016-the edge of evilshaw . So [they]4007-these two men entered [it]4016-the edge of evilshaw , and [those two]4775-those two led [them]4007-these two men by half - blind ways and paths amongst the thickets , and fumbled never with [the road]1797-the road . Five days [they]4007-these two men went thus , and on the fifth evening [they]4007-these two men lay down to sleep in [the wood]335-the wood , and it was the turn of [those two hirelings]4020-those two hirelings to keep watch and ward , and [they]4007-these two men woke not the next morn save with the hands of the Red Felons at [their]4007-these two men throats , so that [Hugh]118-hugh was bound , and [[his]118-hugh two trusty men who came with [him]118-hugh from [the Green Mountains]85-the green mountains]4021-his two trusty men who came with him from the green mountains were slain before a stroke might be struck . This was the end of [Viridis]108-birdalone â€™ tale , save that [she]108-birdalone told how that it was [she]108-birdalone that had uttered those two shrieks which [Arthur]150-arthur and [Birdalone]108-birdalone had heard from the thicket ; and that [she]108-birdalone had so done when [the two false way - leaders]7115-the two false way - leaders laid hold of [her]108-birdalone to drag [her]108-birdalone away from [[her]108-birdalone man]5681-her man , who stood there before [her]108-birdalone bound to a tree that [he]5681-her man might perish there , whereon [the two caitiffs]7117-the two caitiffs had smitten [her]108-birdalone into unwit that [they]7117-the two caitiffs might have no more of [her]108-birdalone cries . Now when all this had been told , and [they]7117-the two caitiffs had abided awhile in [the fair little dale]7118-the fair little dale , and had said many kind endearing words of friendship , [they]7117-the two caitiffs went up on the green way again , and took what of the horses [they]7117-the two caitiffs needed and trussed [their]7117-the two caitiffs goods thereon ( and [Birdalone]108-birdalone would not leave that brave armour which [Habundia]97-habundia had given [her]108-birdalone ) , and [they]7117-the two caitiffs dight [others]4825-others for [their]7117-the two caitiffs home - riding , and the rest [they]7117-the two caitiffs turned loose into [the woods]450-the woods , and so rode [their]7117-the two caitiffs ways , [Birdalone]108-birdalone going ever with [Atra]109-atra , and [Arthur]150-arthur by [Aurea]107-aurea ; but [Viridis]108-birdalone must needs have [Hugh]118-hugh within reach of [her]108-birdalone hand all the way . Good speed [they]7117-the two caitiffs made , so that ere the night had fallen on [them]7117-the two caitiffs , though the sun was set , [they]7117-the two caitiffs â€˜[108-birdalone] had come to [the House under [the Wood]335-the wood]4835-the house under the wood ; and there again was joy and wondering of [the new - comers]2393-the new - comers , and merry feasting on such simple victuals as were there , and good - night and rest in all contentment in [the house where erst had [Birdalone]108-birdalone tholed so many griefs and fears]4025-the house where erst had birdalone tholed so many griefs and fears . On the next day , [they]4026-they arose and were glad , and it was to [them]4026-they as if the sun of the early summer had arisen for nought save to shine on [their]4026-they happy day . And [they]4026-they went about from place to place whereas tidings had befallen [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; and [she]108-birdalone served [them]4026-they one and all as if [she]108-birdalone were [[their]4026-they handmaid]4027-their handmaid , and [they]4026-they loved [her]108-birdalone and caressed [her]108-birdalone , and had been fain to do all [her]108-birdalone will did [they]4026-they but know it . In this wise wore day after day till [June]92-june began to wane , and then on a time came [Hugh]118-hugh unto [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and spake unto [her]108-birdalone and said : All [we]4028-we have been talking together , and [I]0-i am sent to ask [thee]108-birdalone what is in [thy]108-birdalone mind as to abiding here or going elsewhither . For now that [we]4028-we be come together again , not for [all the kingdoms of [the world]417-the world]4029-all the kingdoms of the world would [we]4028-we sunder again ; and above all , [none of [us]4028-we]4031-none of us would leave [thee]108-birdalone , O [[my]0-i sister]1162-my sister . But if [thou]4033-thou wilt come with [me]0-i to [[our]4028-we land under [the Green Mountains]4035-the green mountains]4034-our land under the green mountains , there is for [thee]108-birdalone [a pleasant place]4036-a pleasant place and [a fair dwelling]4037-a fair dwelling , and honour from all folk , and [our]4028-we love that shall never leave [thee]108-birdalone ; and [I]0-i , and [Arthur]150-arthur [[my]0-i brother]2607-my brother , [we]4028-we shall win fame together amongst [the knighthood]6127-the knighthood , and [thou]4033-thou shalt be proud and glad both of [him]2607-my brother and of [me]0-i . [She]1162-my sister said : And if [I]0-i may not go with [thee]108-birdalone thither , what other way is there to escape the sundering ? Said [Hugh]118-hugh : This , that [thou]4033-thou choose in [[the world]417-the world what land liketh [thee]4033-thou for [a dwelling - place]4042-a dwelling - place]4041-the world what land liketh thee for a dwelling - place , and [we]4028-we will go with [thee]4033-thou and leave [thee]4033-thou never , and [thou]4033-thou shalt be [[our]4028-we lady]477-our lady and [queen]4044-queen . Then [he]118-hugh laughed and said : Yet , [[our]4028-we lady]477-our lady , [I]0-i have left behind [me]0-i under [the Green Mountains]4035-the green mountains certain things which [I]0-i love , as [two fair women - children]4047-two fair women - children , and [a squire or two whose fathers]4048-a squire or two whose fathers served [[my]0-i fathers]4374-my fathers , and whose children [I]0-i would should serve [[my]0-i children]4050-my children . And moreover [I]0-i have left there certain matters of avail , [my]0-i wealth and livelihood to wit . Wilt [thou]4033-thou begrudge it if [I]0-i must needs go fetch these , and bring [them]4051-them to [the land where [thou]4033-thou dwellest , through whatever peril [we]4028-we may have to face]4052-the land where thou dwellest , through whatever peril we may have to face ? Dear art [thou]4033-thou , [she]4053-she said , and [[my]0-i very friend]4054-my very friend , but tell [me]0-i : how sorry wouldst [thou]4033-thou be to leave [[thine]4033-thou own land]4055-thine own land and follow after [me]0-i for the sake of [one who is neither thine own true love nor of [thy]4033-thou kindred]4056-one who is neither thine own true love nor of thy kindred ? Said [he]4054-my very friend : Not so sorry that [I]0-i should grudge against [thee]4053-she thereafter . Moreover if that much of sorrow came to [me]0-i , [I]0-i should deem it not ill , lest [I]0-i grow so over - happy that the luck rise up against [me]0-i and undo [me]0-i . [She]4053-she said , smiling on [him]4054-my very friend kindly : Meseems that [I]0-i am over - happy , whereas [I]0-i have such dear cherishing of [noble friends]4057-noble friends . But now [I]0-i will tell [thee]4053-she all , and maybe [thou]4053-she wilt love [me]0-i the less for the telling . In [these woods]7050-these woods here , and [lady]493-lady and [mistress of [them]7050-these woods]4060-mistress of them , dwelleth [one who is not of the race of [Adam]96-adam]4061-one who is not of the race of adam . And [she]4053-she helped and cherished [me]0-i and gave [me]0-i wisdom when [I]0-i was tormented and accursed , and [she]4053-she it was who saved [me]0-i from [the evil witch]4062-the evil witch , and gave [me]0-i the good hap to meet [your]4053-she loves and to fetch [you]4053-she to [their]4063-their helping ; and twice hath [she]4053-she saved [me]0-i from mortal peril otherwise . And [she]4053-she hath found [me]0-i [my]0-i love , [[thy]4053-she brother]4064-thy brother [Arthur]150-arthur , and delivered [him]150-arthur from unwit and wanhope ; and [she]4053-she it is who drew all [you]4053-she hither unto [us]4065-us , and who delivered [you]4053-she from [the felons who had mastered [you]4053-she]4066-the felons who had mastered you . And [I]0-i have sworn unto [her]4053-she that [I]0-i would never wholly sunder [me]0-i from [her]4053-she ; and how shall [I]0-i break [mine]0-i oath and grieve [her]4053-she , even had [I]0-i the will thereto , as [God]114-god wot [I]0-i have not ? And [she]4053-she wept therewith . But [Hugh]118-hugh kissed [her]4053-she and said : [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [[my]0-i dear]1824-my dear , why weepest [thou]4053-she ? Didst [thou]4053-she not hear [my]0-i word , that [[thy]4053-she people]4068-thy people should be [[my]0-i people]4069-my people , and [[thy]4053-she land]4070-thy land [[my]0-i land]7048-my land , and that whither [thou]4053-she goest [I]0-i will go ? Dost [thou]4053-she not trow [me]0-i then ? Or how deemest [thou]4053-she [I]0-i may tear [[thy]4053-she friend]4800-thy friend Viridis from [thee]4053-she , when [she]4800-thy friend hath just found [thee]4053-she ? But tell [me]0-i , hast [thou]4053-she in [thy]4053-she mind any dwelling - place other than this ? Yea , [she]4800-thy friend said : [I]0-i may not depart very far from [this forest of Evilshaw]4073-this forest of evilshaw lest [I]0-i grieve [my]0-i wisdom - mother overmuch . But if [one]504-one go westward through [the wood]335-the wood , [he]504-one shall happen at last , when [he]504-one cometh forth of [it]335-the wood , on [a good town hight Utterhay]6087-a good town hight utterhay , which lieth on the very edge thereof . There was [I]0-i born , and there also [I]0-i look to find [three dear and trusty friends to whom [I]0-i owe return of [their]4077-three dear and trusty friends to whom i owe return of their much kindness much kindness]4077-three dear and trusty friends to whom i owe return of their much kindness . [It]6087-a good town hight utterhay is [a noble town in a pleasant land]4078-a noble town in a pleasant land , and [thou]4079-thou and [[my]0-i lord]2039-my lord [Arthur]150-arthur may well win both honour and worship and lordship there . And wholly [I]0-i trust in [thy]4079-thou word that [thou]4079-thou wilt not grudge against [me]0-i for dragging [thee]4079-thou thither . Therewith [she]0-i gave [him]150-arthur [her]0-i hand , smiling on [him]150-arthur , though there was yet trouble in [her]0-i face . But [he]150-arthur took the hand and held it , and laughed merrily and said : Lo now ! how good it is for [friends]404-friends to take counsel together ! What better may [we]4082-we do than go with [thee]4079-thou thither ? And how greatly will [Viridis]108-birdalone rejoice when [she]108-birdalone heareth of this . Now will [I]0-i go and tell [her]108-birdalone and [the others]1287-the others . Go then , [dear lad]3286-dear lad , [she]0-i said ; but as to the matter of [thy]4079-thou fetching [[thy]4079-thou children]4085-thy children and livelihood hither , that may be not so hard nor so perilous as [thou]4079-thou deemest ; and [thou]4079-thou shalt go about it whenso [thou]4079-thou wilt , and the sooner the better , and [we]4082-we shall abide [thee]4079-thou here as long as need may be . And therewith [he]150-arthur went [his]150-arthur ways to tell [Viridis]108-birdalone and the others of this rede which [they]4086-they had come to between [them]4086-they . Chapter II ~ [Birdalone]108-birdalone Taketh Counsel with [Her]108-birdalone Wood - Mother Concerning the Matter of [Sir Hugh]118-hugh On that same day went [Birdalone]108-birdalone to [the Oak of Tryst]11-the oak of tryst and called [[her]108-birdalone wood - mother]900-her wood - mother to [her]108-birdalone , and [she]900-her wood - mother came glad and smiling , and kissed and embraced [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and said unto [her]900-her wood - mother : Now [I]0-i see that [thou]4079-thou art well content with this last matter [I]0-i have done for [thee]4079-thou , whereas [thou]4079-thou art come to crave a new gift of [me]0-i . How knowest [thou]4079-thou that ? said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , laughing . Said Habundia : Wouldst [thou]4079-thou have come to [me]0-i so soon otherwise from out of all that happiness ? [I]0-i have come to tell [thee]4079-thou of [my]0-i rede , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and to ask [thee]4079-thou if [thou]4079-thou art like - minded with [me]0-i thereon . Said [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife : And what is [thy]4079-thou rede , [[my]0-i child]907-my child ? [Wood - mother]1619-wood - mother , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , [we]4091-we deem that it were good for [us]4091-we all to go down into [Utterhay]1-utterhay where [I]0-i was born , and to take up [our]4091-we abode therein . Said [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife : This rede [I]0-i praise , and even so would [I]0-i have counselled [you]1619-wood - mother to do ; but [I]0-i abided to see if it should come from out of [thy]4079-thou breast , and now even so it hath done ; wherefore [I]0-i understand [thy]4079-thou wisdom and rejoice in [thee]4079-thou . And now crave [thy]4079-thou boon , [[my]0-i child]907-my child , and [thou]4079-thou shalt have it without fail . Yea , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone , that will [I]0-i , and the more that it is a simple one and easy for [thee]4079-thou to do . [Thou]4079-thou knowest that [Hugh the Green Knight]118-hugh hath come with [[my]0-i she - friends]4094-my she - friends seeking [us]4095-us all the way from under [the Green Mountains]85-the green mountains , and [he]118-hugh hath left there goods that [he]118-hugh needs must have and folk whom [he]118-hugh loves ; and now [he]118-hugh would go back thither , and fetch all that away hither , and see to [his]118-hugh matters as soon as may be . And [I]0-i would have [thee]4079-thou counsel [us]4095-us what to do , whether to build a barque , as perchance [we]4095-us may get it done , and sail [the lake therein]4096-the lake therein to [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest or thereabout]4097-the castle of the quest or thereabout , and thence to ride to [[his]118-hugh land]4098-his land ; or else to take [thy]4079-thou guidance and safe - conduct through [the wood]335-the wood , and to bring [[his]118-hugh folk]1328-his folk back the same way . Said [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife : As to the way by water , [I]0-i may help [you]4102-you little therein , and meseemeth that way be many traps and wiles and many perils . Wherefore [I]0-i bid [you]4102-you try it not , but let [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight come up hither to this tree tomorrow before noon , all horsed and armed and arrayed , and there shall [he]1341-the green knight find [three men armed in green gear]4104-three men armed in green gear , horsed well , and leading two sumpter - beasts with [them]4104-three men armed in green gear ; and [they]4104-three men armed in green gear shall be [his]1341-the green knight until [he]1341-the green knight giveth [them]4104-three men armed in green gear back unto [me]0-i . But if [he]1341-the green knight doubteth any thing betwixt [the wood]335-the wood â€™s end and under [the Green Mountains]85-the green mountains , let [him]1341-the green knight wage what [folk]4521-folk [he]1341-the green knight will besides , for these [[my]0-i men]6234-my men will have money enough of [his]1341-the green knight with [them]4104-three men armed in green gear . But by no means let [him]1341-the green knight send [them]4104-three men armed in green gear away till [he]1341-the green knight hath done with [the wood]335-the wood altogether , both betwixt here and [the western dwelt - land]4109-the western dwelt - land , and here and [Utterhay]1-utterhay , save [thou]4110-thou be with [him]1341-the green knight . But while these be with [him]1341-the green knight , both [he]1341-the green knight and whatsoever money [he]1341-the green knight bringeth shall be sure from all peril whiles [they]4104-three men armed in green gear be in [the wood]335-the wood . Now , [[my]0-i child]907-my child , was not this the boon [thou]4110-thou camest up hither to ask of [me]0-i ? [Yea]4113-yea verily , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; yet also [I]0-i came up hither to praise [thee]4110-thou and thank [thee]4110-thou and love [thee]4110-thou . And [she]4110-thou threw [herself]4110-thou into [Habundia]97-habundia â€™s arms and kissed and caressed [her]4110-thou , and [Habundia]97-habundia [her]4110-thou in like wise . Spake [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife : [Thou]559-the wood - wife art [the beloved child of [my]0-i wisdom]4115-the beloved child of my wisdom ; and now [I]0-i see of [thee]4110-thou that [thou]4110-thou wilt be faithful and true and loving unto [me]0-i unto the end . And [I]0-i think [I]0-i can see that [thou]4110-thou and [[thy]4110-thou man]2954-thy man shall do well and happily in Utterhay ; and [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight also and [[thy]4110-thou she - friends]6291-thy she - friends . And whatsoever [thou]4110-thou wilt of [me]0-i that [I]0-i may do for [thee]4110-thou or [[thy]4110-thou friends]1815-thy friends , ask it freely , and freely shalt [thou]4110-thou have it . But this [I]0-i will bid [thee]4110-thou , that the while [the Green Knight]1341-the green knight shall be gone about [his]1341-the green knight matter , [thou]4110-thou shalt come hither to [me]0-i often ; and [[thy]4110-thou friends]1815-thy friends also [thou]4110-thou shalt bring to [me]0-i , that [I]0-i may see [them]1815-thy friends and talk to [them]1815-thy friends and love [them]1815-thy friends . And specially shalt [thou]4110-thou bid [Atra]109-atra unto [me]0-i ; for meseems [she]109-atra is so wise already that [I]0-i may learn [her]109-atra more wisdom , and put that into [her]109-atra heart which may solace [her]109-atra and make [her]109-atra to cease from fretting [her]109-atra own heart , and from grief and longing overmuch . And [I]0-i were fain to reward [her]109-atra in that [she]109-atra hath forborne to grudge against [thee]4122-thee and to bear [thee]4122-thee enmity . For [I]0-i know , [[my]0-i child]907-my child , not from [mine]0-i own heart , but from the wisdom [I]0-i have learned , how hardly [the children of [Adam]96-adam]551-the children of adam may bear to have that which [they]551-the children of adam love taken away from [them]551-the children of adam by another , even if [they]551-the children of adam [themselves]551-the children of adam might in the long last have wearied of it and cast it away [their]551-the children of adam own selves . Go now , [[my]0-i child]907-my child , and do [[thy]4122-thee friend]4800-thy friend to wit what [I]0-i will do for [him]4800-thy friend . Therewith [they]4127-they parted , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone fared [home]373-home to [the house]311-the house , and found [the fellowship of [them]4127-they all sitting by [the brookside]4131-the brookside , and talking sweetly together in all joy and hope of what [their]4127-they life should be in [the new land whereto [Birdalone]108-birdalone would lead [them]4127-they]4132-the new land whereto birdalone would lead them]4130-the fellowship of them all sitting by the brookside , and talking sweetly together in all joy and hope of what their life should be in the new land whereto birdalone would lead them . Straightway then [she]108-birdalone told [them]4127-they of [Hugh]118-hugh and [his]118-hugh journey , and how well [he]118-hugh should be guarded in [the wood]335-the wood both coming and going . And [they]4127-they thought that right good , and [they]4127-they thanked [her]108-birdalone and praised [her]108-birdalone , and took [her]108-birdalone into [their]4127-they talk , and [she]108-birdalone sat down by [them]4127-they happily . Chapter III ~ Of the Journeying Through [the Forest of Evilshaw]83-the forest of evilshaw Unto [the Town of Utterhay]4134-the town of utterhay On the morrow in due time [Birdalone]108-birdalone , going afoot , led [Sir Hugh]118-hugh , all - armed and horsed , to [the Oak of Tryst]11-the oak of tryst , and there [they]4127-they found [the three men - at - arms]4135-the three men - at - arms , well - weaponed and in green weed , abiding [them]4135-the three men - at - arms . [They]4127-they did obeisance to [Sir Hugh]118-hugh , and [he]118-hugh greeted [them]4127-they , and then without more ado [he]118-hugh kissed [Birdalone]108-birdalone and went [his]118-hugh ways with [his]118-hugh way - leaders , but [Birdalone]108-birdalone turned back to [the house]311-the house and [[her]108-birdalone friends]1305-her friends . Next day [Birdalone]108-birdalone brought [[her]108-birdalone three [she]108-birdalone - friends]4138-her three she - friends unto [the Trysting Oak]4139-the trysting oak , and showed [them]4138-her three she - friends to [the wood - mother]925-the wood - mother , and [she]925-the wood - mother was kind and soft with [them]4138-her three she - friends ; and both [Aurea]107-aurea and [Viridis]108-birdalone were shy with [her]108-birdalone , and as if [they]4138-her three she - friends feared [her]108-birdalone , but [Atra]109-atra was frank and free , and spake boldly . And thereafter when [Birdalone]108-birdalone went to meet [[her]108-birdalone wood - mother]900-her wood - mother , [Atra]109-atra would go with [her]108-birdalone if [she]108-birdalone were asked , and at last would go alone , when [she]108-birdalone found that [Habundia]97-habundia was fain of [her]108-birdalone coming , so that there were not many days when [they]4142-they met not ; and [the wood - wife]559-the wood - wife fell to learning [her]559-the wood - wife the lore of [the earth]432-the earth , as [she]559-the wood - wife had done aforetime with [Birdalone]108-birdalone ; and [Atra]109-atra waxed ruddier and merrier of countenance , whereof was [Birdalone]108-birdalone right glad , and [Arthur]150-arthur yet more glad , and [the others]1287-the others well content . So wore the time till [Hugh]118-hugh had been gone for twenty and three days , and as [they]4142-they walked [the meadows]1769-the meadows anigh [the house]311-the house about undern , [they]4142-they saw [a knight riding down the bent]4148-a knight riding down the bent toward [them]4142-they , and presently [they]4142-they knew [him]4148-a knight riding down the bent for [Hugh]118-hugh , and turned and hastened to meet [him]4148-a knight riding down the bent , so that [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent was straightway amidst [them]4142-they , and on foot . Dear then were the greetings and caresses betwixt [them]4142-they , and when it was over , and [Birdalone]108-birdalone had led away [his]4148-a knight riding down the bent horse and dight it for [him]4148-a knight riding down the bent , and had gotten [him]4148-a knight riding down the bent victuals and drink , and [they]4142-they were all sitting on the grass together , [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent told [them]4142-they how [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent had fared . [He]4148-a knight riding down the bent had done all [his]4148-a knight riding down the bent matters in [the Land under [the Green Mountains]85-the green mountains]4149-the land under the green mountains , and had given over [[his]4148-a knight riding down the bent lands and [houses]6346-houses]4150-his lands and houses to [a man of [his]4148-a knight riding down the bent lineage]4152-a man of his lineage , [[his]4148-a knight riding down the bent cousin]4153-his cousin , [a good knight]4154-a good knight , and had taken from [him]4148-a knight riding down the bent of gold and goods what [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent would . Then [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent had taken [his]4148-a knight riding down the bent two bairns and [[their]4155-their nurse]4156-their nurse , and [an old squire]4157-an old squire and [five sergeants]4158-five sergeants , whereof one was [[his]4148-a knight riding down the bent foster - brother]4159-his foster - brother , and [the others men]4160-the others men somewhat stricken in years , and had departed with [them]4160-the others men . Sithence [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent had come [his]4148-a knight riding down the bent ways to [Greenford]39-greenford , and had held talk therein with [the prior of [a great and fair house of [Black Canons]4163-black canons]4162-a great and fair house of black canons]4161-the prior of a great and fair house of black canons , and had given [him]4161-the prior of a great and fair house of black canons no little wealth wherewith to re - do [the Castle of [the Quest]26-the quest]25-the castle of the quest what was needed , and for [livelihood of four canons to dwell [there]215-there]4164-livelihood of four canons to dwell there , and [Leonard]139-birdalone to be [[their]4166-they prior]4167-their prior , that there [they]4166-they might remember [Sir Baudoin]115-baudoin [[their]4166-they dear friend]4168-their dear friend daily in [the office]4169-the office , and do good unto [his]115-baudoin soul . Sithence [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent had ridden to [the Castle of the Quest]4707-the castle of the quest with [the said Prior of [St. Austin of Greenford]87-st. austin of greenford]4171-the said prior of st. austin of greenford , and had found [Leonard]139-birdalone , and had settled all the business how it was to be done . Thereafter [he]4148-a knight riding down the bent had returned to [Greenford]39-greenford , and gathered [[his]4148-a knight riding down the bent folk]1328-his folk , and got [him]139-birdalone gone , under the guidance of [[Habundia]97-habundia â€™s folk]4173-habundia â€™s folk , by [castles]4174-castles and thorps and [towns]4175-towns the nearest way to [the edge of [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw]4016-the edge of evilshaw . And [they]4166-they had come to [the forest]6120-the forest , and ridden it six days without mishap ; and when [they]4166-they had come to [the Oak of Tryst]11-the oak of tryst once more , [the way - leaders]4178-the way - leaders said that it were well if all [they]4166-they together tarried not much longer in [the forest]6120-the forest ; wherefore [they]4166-they had brought [them]4166-they to [a fair wood - lawn]4180-a fair wood - lawn , and there [they]4166-they encamped , and were there as now . And , said [Hugh]118-hugh , there are [they]4166-they abiding [me]0-i , and it is in [my]0-i mind that this very eve [we]4166-they go , all of [us]4166-they , and meet [them]4166-they there , if [ye]4181-ye may truss [your]4181-ye goods in that while ; but as to victuals , [we]4166-they have plenty , and it needeth not . And then tomorrow shall [we]4166-they wend [our]4166-they way as straight as may be toward [the good town of]4182-the good town of [Utterhay]1-utterhay . All [they]4166-they yeasaid it , though in [her]4183-her heart maybe [Birdalone]108-birdalone had been fain of abiding a little longer in [[her]108-birdalone own land]4184-her own land ; but [she]108-birdalone spake no word thereof . And [they]4166-they all set to work to the trussing up of [their]4166-they goods , and then turned [their]4166-they backs on [the Great Water]13-the great water , and came up into [the woodland]657-the woodland , and so to [the camp in the wood - lawn]4186-the camp in the wood - lawn . And there had [Viridis]108-birdalone a joyful meeting with [[her]108-birdalone babes]4187-her babes , and [she]108-birdalone gladdened the hearts of [[Sir Hugh]118-hugh â€™s men - at - arms]4188-sir hugh â€™s men - at - arms by [her]108-birdalone kind greeting ; and [they]4188-sir hugh â€™s men - at - arms rejoiced in meeting [Aurea]107-aurea and [Atra]109-atra again , and [they]4188-sir hugh â€™s men - at - arms wondered at [Birdalone]108-birdalone and [her]108-birdalone beauty , and [their]4188-sir hugh â€™s men - at - arms hearts went out to [her]108-birdalone , both [the old men]4189-the old men â€™s and [the young ones]4190-the young ones . But [[Habundia]97-habundia â€™s men]4191-habundia â€™s men looked on it all like images of [warriors]1809-warriors . There then [they]4191-habundia â€™s men feasted merrily that evening . But when the morrow was come [they]4191-habundia â€™s men were speedily on the way toward [Utterhay]1-utterhay ; and [the way - leaders]4178-the way - leaders guided [them]4191-habundia â€™s men so well and wisely , that by noon of the fifth day [they]4191-habundia â€™s men were come forth of [the wood]335-the wood and on to the bent that looked down upon [the town of [Utterhay]1-utterhay]4134-the town of utterhay . There turned to [Hugh]118-hugh [the three way - leaders]4196-the three way - leaders , and spake : [Lord]2064-lord , [we]4196-the three way - leaders have done [thee]2064-lord the service which [we]4196-the three way - leaders were bidden ; if [thou]2064-lord hast no further need of [us]4196-the three way - leaders , give [us]4196-the three way - leaders leave . Said [Hugh]118-hugh : Leave [ye]2064-lord have , and [I]0-i shall give [you]2064-lord a great reward ere [ye]2064-lord go . Said [the chief of them]4198-the chief of them : Nay , [lord]2064-lord , no reward may [we]4196-the three way - leaders take , save a token from [thee]2064-lord that [thou]2064-lord art content with [us]4196-the three way - leaders . What token shall it be ? said [Hugh]118-hugh . Quoth [the way - leader]2308-the way - leader : That each of [us]4196-the three way - leaders kiss [the Lady Birdalone]108-birdalone on the mouth , for [she]108-birdalone it is that is verily [[our]4196-the three way - leaders mistress]1107-our mistress under [[our]4196-the three way - leaders great mistress]4202-our great mistress . Laughed [Hugh]118-hugh thereat , but [the men]4811-the men laughed not ; then spake [Hugh]118-hugh : This must be at [the lady]1145-the lady â€™s own will . Even so , said [they]4811-the men . Then [Hugh]118-hugh brought [Birdalone]108-birdalone thither and told [her]108-birdalone what was toward , and [she]108-birdalone consented to the kiss with a good will , and said to each of [the men]4811-the men after [they]4811-the men had kissed [her]108-birdalone : Herewith goeth [my]0-i love to [[the mistress]698-the mistress and queen of [the woods]450-the woods]4207-the mistress and queen of the woods ; do [ye]4209-ye bear the same unto [her]108-birdalone . And thereafter [those way - leaders]4210-those way - leaders fared back into [the woods]450-the woods . Now [they]4210-those way - leaders gather [themselves]4210-those way - leaders together and go down toward [Utterhay]1-utterhay , and make a brave show , what with the sumpter - horses , and the goodly array of [the four ladies]4212-the four ladies , and the glittering war - gear of [the men - at - arms]4947-the men - at - arms ; and [Sir Hugh]118-hugh and [Sir Arthur]150-arthur displayed [their]4210-those way - leaders pennons as [they]4210-those way - leaders went . All this saw [the warders]4214-the warders on the wall of [Utterhay]1-utterhay ; and [they]4210-those way - leaders told [the captain of the porte]4215-the captain of the porte , and [he]4215-the captain of the porte came up on to the wall , and [a man]217-a man with [him]4215-the captain of the porte ; and when [he]4215-the captain of the porte saw [this bright company]4217-this bright company coming forth from [the wood]335-the wood , [he]4215-the captain of the porte bade [men]204-men to [him]4215-the captain of the porte , [two score of [them]4217-this bright company]4220-two score of them , all weaponed , and [he]4215-the captain of the porte did on [his]4215-the captain of the porte armour , and rode out - a - gates with [them]4217-this bright company to meet [those new - comers]4221-those new - comers ; and this [he]4215-the captain of the porte did , not because [he]4215-the captain of the porte did not see [them]4217-this bright company to be but few , but because [they]4217-this bright company came forth out of [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw , and then doubted if [they]4217-this bright company were trustworthy . So [he]4215-the captain of the porte met [them]4217-this bright company two bowshots from the gate , and rode forward till [he]4215-the captain of the porte was close to [the wayfarers]5423-the wayfarers ; and when [he]4215-the captain of the porte beheld the loveliness of [the women]1990-the women , and especially of [Birdalone]108-birdalone , who wore that day the gleaming - glittering gown which [Habundia]97-habundia had given [her]108-birdalone , [he]4215-the captain of the porte was abashed , and deemed yet more that [he]4215-the captain of the porte had to do with [folk of [the Faery]77-the faery]4224-folk of the faery . But [he]4215-the captain of the porte spake courteously , and said , turning to [Hugh]118-hugh , who rode the foremost : [Fair sir]1675-fair sir , would [ye]1675-fair sir tell unto [the man whose business it is to safeguard [the good town of Utterhay]4227-the good town of utterhay what [folk]4521-folk [ye]1675-fair sir be]4226-the man whose business it is to safeguard the good town of utterhay what folk ye be , and on what errand [ye]1675-fair sir ride , and how it is that [ye]1675-fair sir come forth from [Evilshaw]2-evilshaw safe , in good case , with pennons displayed , as if [the said wood]218-the said wood were [your]1675-fair sir very own livelihood ? For , sooth to say , hitherto [we]4230-we have found this , that [all men dread Evilshaw]4231-all men dread evilshaw , and [none]1359-none will enter [it]2-evilshaw uncompelled . Thereto answered [Hugh]118-hugh : [I]0-i hight [Sir Hugh the Green Knight]118-hugh , and am come from under [the Green Mountain]88-the green mountain ; and this is [Sir Arthur]150-arthur , called [the Black Squire]1325-the black squire , but [a knight]1343-a knight [he]150-arthur is verily , and of great kindred and [a warrior most doughty]4235-a warrior most doughty . And [he]150-arthur hath been captain of [the good town of Greenford]2267-the good town of greenford west away through [the wood yonder]4237-the wood yonder a long way , and [hath]4238-hath done [the town]305-the town and the frank thereof mickle good service in scattering and destroying [the evil companies of [the Red Hold]2256-the red hold]4240-the evil companies of the red hold , which hold [we]4230-we took by force of arms from [the felons who held it for the torment and plague of [the country - side]4792-the country - side]4242-the felons who held it for the torment and plague of the country - side . Now as to [our]4230-we errand , [we]4230-we be minded to dwell in [[your]4244-you good town of [Utterhay]1-utterhay]4245-your good town of utterhay , and take [our]4230-we part with [[your]4244-you folk]4246-your folk , and [we]4230-we have wealth enow thereto , so as to be beholden to [none]1359-none ; and as time goes on [we]4230-we may serve [you]4244-you in divers wise , and not least in this maybe , that with a good will [we]4230-we shall draw sword for [your]4244-you peace and the freedom of [them]4246-your folk of [Utterhay]1-utterhay . When [the captain]4248-the captain heard these words , [he]4248-the captain made obeisance to [Sir Hugh]118-hugh , and said : Fair sir , though [we]4230-we be here a long way from [Greenford]39-greenford , yet have [we]4230-we heard some tale of the deeds of [you]4244-you , and surely [the porte]4249-the porte and [all the folk]2103-all the folk shall be fain of [your]4244-you corning . Yet [I]0-i pray [thee]4244-you be not wrath ; for there is a custom of [the good town]3003-the good town , that [none]1359-none may enter [its]3003-the good town gates coming from out of [this Forest of Evilshaw]4073-this forest of evilshaw , save [he]1359-none leave some pledge or caution with [me]0-i , be it [his]1359-none wealth , or the body of [some friend or fellow]4254-some friend or fellow , or , if nought else , [his]1359-none very own body . Wherefore if [thou]4244-you , [Sir Green Knight]118-hugh , wilt but give [us]4230-we some sure pledge , then will [I]0-i turn about and ride with [you]4244-you back and through the gate into [Utterhay]1-utterhay ; and doubtless , when [the mayor]4255-the mayor hath seen [you]4244-you and spoken with [you]4244-you , the said pledge shall be rendered to [you]4244-you again . Ere [Hugh]118-hugh might answer , came [Birdalone]108-birdalone forth and said : [Sir captain]4256-sir captain , if [I]0-i , who am [the lady of the Black Squire]4257-the lady of the black squire here , be hostage good enough , then take [me]0-i , and if need be , chain [me]0-i to make surer of [me]0-i . And [she]108-birdalone drew near unto [him]4256-sir captain smiling , and held out [her]108-birdalone hands as if for the manacles . But when [the captain]4248-the captain saw [her]108-birdalone thus , all the blood stirred in [his]4248-the captain body for joy of [her]108-birdalone beauty , and [he]4248-the captain might but just sit [his]4248-the captain horse for [his]4248-the captain wonder and longing ; but [he]4248-the captain said : [The saints]4259-the saints forbid it , [lady]493-lady , that [I]0-i should do [thee]493-lady any hurt or displeasure , or aught save the most worship [I]0-i may . But [thy]493-lady hostage [I]0-i will take , [Sir Knight]5002-sir knight if [thou]493-lady be content to yield [her]108-birdalone , whereas in an hour belike [she]108-birdalone shall be free again . And now fare [we]4262-them all gateward again . So then [they]4262-them all rode on together , [Birdalone]108-birdalone by [the captain]4248-the captain â€™s left hand ; and as [they]4262-them passed by [the poor houses]4264-the poor houses without the wall , [she]108-birdalone looked and saw the one which had been [[[her]108-birdalone mother]318-her mother â€™s dwelling]4266-her mother â€™s dwelling , so oft and so closely had [she]108-birdalone told [her]108-birdalone all about it . Thus then [they]4262-them entered [Utterhay]1-utterhay , and [the captain]4248-the captain led [them]4262-them straight to [the mote - house]4268-the mote - house whereas [the mayor]4255-the mayor and [the porte]4249-the porte were sitting ; and [much people]4271-much people followed [them]4262-them through [the streets]3007-the streets , wondering at [them]4262-them , and praising the loveliness of [the women]1990-the women , and the frank and gallant bearing of [the men - at - arms]4947-the men - at - arms . So [they]4262-them lighted down at [the mote - house]4268-the mote - house and were brought to [the mayor]4255-the mayor , and when [he]4255-the mayor had spoken [them]4262-them but a little , and had come to [himself]4255-the mayor again from the fear and abashment that [he]4255-the mayor had of [them]4262-them , [he]4255-the mayor showed [himself]4255-the mayor full fain of [their]4262-them coming , and bade [them]4262-them welcome to [the good town]3003-the good town , and took [them]4262-them into [[his]4255-the mayor own house]3017-his own house to guesting , until [folk]4521-folk might dight [a very goodly house]4280-a very goodly house which [the porte]4249-the porte did give unto [them]4262-them . But some two hours afterwards , when [they]4262-them were housed in all content , as [they]4262-them sat in [the hall of [the mayor]4255-the mayor , which was great and goodly , talking and devising with worthies of [Utterhay]1-utterhay]4282-the hall of the mayor , which was great and goodly , talking and devising with worthies of utterhay , there entered [two fair and frank - looking young men]4284-two fair and frank - looking young men , who went straight up to [Birdalone]108-birdalone , and [the first]4285-the first knelt down before [her]108-birdalone and kissed [her]108-birdalone hand , and said : O [[our]4286-our lady]477-our lady , and art [thou]4288-thou verily come to [us]4286-our ! O [our]4286-our happiness and the joy of this day ! But when [she]108-birdalone saw [him]4285-the first and heard [him]4285-the first and felt the touch of [his]4285-the first hand , [she]108-birdalone bent down to [him]4285-the first and kissed [him]4285-the first on the forehead , for [she]108-birdalone knew [him]4285-the first that it was [Robert Gerardson]174-robert . Then [the other man]4289-the other man came up to [her]108-birdalone as if [he]4289-the other man also would have knelt to [her]108-birdalone , but [his]4289-the other man purpose changed , and [he]4289-the other man cast [his]4289-the other man arms about [her]108-birdalone body and fell to kissing [her]108-birdalone face all over , weeping the while , and then [he]4289-the other man drew off and stood trembling before [her]108-birdalone and [she]108-birdalone , all blushing like a red rose and laughing a little , and yet with the tears in [her]108-birdalone eyes , said : O [Giles Gerardson]175-giles gerardson , and [thou]175-giles gerardson , [Robert]174-robert , how fain [I]0-i am to see [you]174-robert twain ; but tell [me]0-i , is [[your]174-robert father]4290-your father well ? [Yea]4291-yea , verily , [[our]4292-our dear lady]6232-our dear lady , said [Robert]174-robert , and it will be unto [him]4290-your father as a fresh draught of youth when [he]4290-your father wotteth that [thou]4294-thou art come to dwell amongst [us]4292-our ; for so it is , [O [lady beloved]4296-lady beloved]4295-o lady beloved , is it not ? said [he]174-robert . [Yea]4291-yea , forsooth , or even so [I]0-i hope , said [Birdalone]108-birdalone . But here be other friends that [ye]4291-yea must needs know , if [we]4292-our come to dwell together [here]244-here in peace ; and then go and fetch [me]0-i hither [[your]174-robert father]4290-your father . Therewith [she]108-birdalone presented [them]4299-them unto [Arthur]150-arthur and [Hugh]118-hugh and [the three ladies of the Quest]4300-the three ladies of the quest , and all [they]4301-they greeted [them]4299-them kindly and in all honour ; and [the Gerardsons]180-the gerardsons loved and worshipped [them]4299-them , and especially [the lovely ladies]4302-the lovely ladies , [the she - friends of [[their]180-the gerardsons lady]4584-their lady]4303-the she - friends of their lady . And whiles [they]4292-our were about this , in [cometh old Gerard]173-gerard [himself]173-gerard , and when [Birdalone]108-birdalone saw [him]173-gerard at the door , [she]108-birdalone arose and ran to meet [him]173-gerard , and cast [her]108-birdalone arms about [him]173-gerard as if [she]108-birdalone were [[his]173-gerard own daughter]4305-his own daughter ; and most joyful was the meeting betwixt [them]4292-our .
